About the Team
The group is a part of Liberty Mutual Insurance, a Fortune 100 company with 45,000 employees in 900 offices worldwide. Its mission is to act as a catalyst for Artificial intelligence (AI)-enabled innovation across Liberty Mutual, and all of insurance, which includes driving the company’s recently established AI Collaboration with one of the top research institutions in the world. Liberty Mutual recognizes that AI is driving the next wave of transformation in the insurance industry across the entire value chain (e.g., underwriting/risk selection, quoting/buying, customer behavior, claims fraud detection) and interdisciplinary collaboration is critical to unlocking its business and societal impact.
Job Summary & Responsibilities:
Reporting to the SVP & Head of Corporate Strategy, you will have the unique opportunity to take a leadership role to drive Liberty Mutual’s efforts in its AI Collaboration with a world renowned research institution and build a dedicated, interdisciplinary team that partners with the enterprise (e.g., business leaders, Product, data scientists, IT) to strategically ideate, develop, and operationalize prioritized AI-enabled innovations.
You will be accountable for priority setting, designing, and leading innovation projects sourced from across the organization through to execution/implementation, typically in the realm of AI/emerging technologies (e.g., predictive modeling, extreme weather, synthetic datasets, cybersecurity, IoT, computer vision, NLP, fairness, bias). You will provide strategic guidance and influence the direction of the Collaboration. You will play an instrumental role in driving Liberty Mutual’s strategic AI-related innovation efforts and through your work, develop key thought-partner relationships with executives across the organization.
You will be the ambassador to key internal and external stakeholders (e.g., business unit leaders, data scientists, IT, distinguished academic professors/researchers) and lead efforts to build/manage a talent pipeline for the group. You will coach, mentor, and champion the careers of your direct reports. In turn, the SVP will support your development and career aspirations.
Your responsibilities will include:
Building the group by aligning and setting the mission, values, and culture in harmony with the organization’s mission and strategic priorities
Acting as the focal point and conduit of Liberty Mutual’s efforts in the Collaboration; working with cross-functional business partners to identify transformational opportunities to apply AI/ML and create value, develop AI competitive advantages, and enrich the lives of Liberty Mutual’s customers, employees, and partners
Overseeing the strategic development and prioritization of project proposals, work plans, and research; bringing executive-level “One Liberty” perspective and strategic thinking to maintain the vision and goals of the Executive Leadership Team (ELT)
Overseeing the successful execution, implementation, and scaling of high impact/complex AI projects, with a keen eye toward shortening the path from research to value creation; partner with appropriate corporate legal counsel to manage the AI patent process with the USPTO, as applicable
Working with the SVP, Head of Corporate Strategy and corporate strategy leadership team to ensure the program’s ongoing alignment with company priorities; direct line and visibility to Liberty Mutual’s corporate strategy
Crafting storylines and presenting complex analytical concepts/strategic findings to senior executives to move the organization to action
Building and cultivating relationships with key stakeholders (e.g., The Office of Data Science, business executives, IT, distinguished professors/researchers)
Individually and within the team, maintaining a strong understanding of ongoing projects/business challenges and potential emerging technological solutions
Surfacing cross-functional challenges/dependencies and directing team and stakeholders towards consensus points/gaining buy-in for complex and uncertain break-through topics
Building, managing, and mentoring a high-performing team; inspiring others and resolving challenging relationship situations under tight deadlines; cultivating a talent pipeline within and outside the organization
Qualifications:
The group is looking for a leader with a strategic and entrepreneurial mindset, balanced with a desire and capability to achieving results. The leader should have a natural passion for innovation, AI, and the future of insurance. The leader will ideally have a proven track record of driving transformational change in large corporate settings and applying emerging technologies to solve business problems and deliver commercial value at scale.
Ideal candidates will possess:
Undergraduate degree required; advanced business or other quantitative degree (e.g., MBA, MSc, Analytics, etc.) from a top-tier institution preferred
10+ years of experience with some combination of strategy consulting experience (with specialization in innovation, AI, emerging tech), corporate-level innovation, insurance, InsurTech, and/or financial services preferred
Credibility and presence among peers and senior executives and adept at influencing through excellent verbal, analytical, written, and presentation skills
Strong sense of ownership/founder mentality to strategize and drive projects to completion; undeterred by challenges/obstacles and will remain motivated and apply creative thinking to overcome them
Skilled at identifying and articulating clear paths from strategy to execution
Strong critical thinking skills with ability to elevate thinking and apply judgment during analysis about how components fit together and with bigger picture
Strong leadership skills and ability to work independently and to guide and coach a dedicated team
Passion for applying innovation, AI, research, and emerging technologies to the commercial world; deep network within the InsurTech, corporate innovation, AI/ML, and insurance communities a plus
Adept at working in a fast-paced environment with incomplete information; able to manage multiple projects/clients concurrently and balance strategic/tactical priorities to advance projects based on known information, judgment, and orchestration of diverse stakeholders.

****Position includes an annual bonus target of 25% of salary****
Required steps:
All candidates must apply to the job posting on the Liberty Mutual Careers website with their cover letter and resume.
Benefits:

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits
Overview:

At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.
We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

job_title_origin: Technical Program Manager, Ads Delivery Product
job_description:
The Ads Delivery Team’s mission is to make every impression meaningful. We help advertisers to achieve business goals balanced with users’ goals of having the most engaging content and ads to view on Facebook. It’s having a big impact on the ecosystem and company revenue with a portfolio of products or platforms such as ads targeting, ads delivery, dynamic ads, prediction, simulation, ads score and optimizations. TPMs can provide technical vision and leadership across teams to bring Ads Delivery Products to the next higher ground.
TECHNICAL PROGRAM MANAGER, ADS DELIVERY PRODUCT RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop overall strategy, product roadmap and tactical business decisions for Ads Delivery products and platforms.
Define and own metrics as key performance indicators that measure the impact of Ads Delivery Products.
Establish shared goals with product teams across the company to get alignment and to drive optimal results for business, people, partners and Facebook.
Provide hands-on program management during analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, and post implementation phases.
Develop and manage end-to-end project plans and ensure on-time delivery. Provide day-to-day coordination and quality assurance for projects and tasks.
Proactively identify, mitigate and manage risks to ensure success.
Collaborate with Engineering, Product, Marketing, Design, Contents, Privacy and Data Science teams for product requirements, scope and implementation.
Drive internal process improvements across multiple teams and functions.
Own joint technical roadmap, prioritization and alignment.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
B.S. Computer Sciences or 5+ years of Software Application development experience.
5+ years of experience working across functions (Engineering, Product Management, Legal) in order to deliver a product or features.
5+ years of organizational coordination experience in a technical company.
5 or more years of problem-solving experience with large scale technical systems.
5 or more years of experience understanding product requirements and translating those product needs into plans.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
PMP Certification (PMI).
Technical Industrial experience in large scale Machine learning/Artificial intelligence or scaling out data engineering and infrastructure.
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.

Overview:
NCI is a leading provider of enterprise solutions and services to U.S. defense, intelligence, health and civilian government agencies. Coupled with a refined focus on strategic partnerships, we are successfully bridging the gap between commercial best practices and mission-critical government processes. Core competencies include:
Artificial intelligence
Agile digital transformation
Advanced analytics
Hyperconverged infrastructure solutions
Cyber security and information assurance
Fraud, waste and abuse
Engineering and logistics
NCI has been designated a 2018 Military Friendly Employer by MilitaryFriendly.com

Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, NCI has approximately 2,000 employees operating at more than 100 locations worldwide.
Responsibilities:
As a Development Lead (Senior Developer), you will be developing and designing front end web architecture, ensuring the responsiveness of applications, and working alongside graphic designers for web design features, among other duties. You need to be proficient in both front and back end coding and perform tasks using Agile methodologies participating in creating user stories for business functionality, technical requirements, and defining acceptance criteria. You are required to see out a project from conception to final product, requiring collaboration, excellent organizational skills, and attention to detail. In assuming this position, you are a vital contributor to meeting NCI's mission: To deliver innovative, cost-effective solutions and services that enable our customers to rapidly adapt to dynamic environments as well as to expand our AI solutions.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop application software solutions using Java, and JavaScript-based frameworks like Angular, and Spring Boot.
Develop secure REST and SOAP web services using Java Spring and Java Security
Ensure high-quality code by creating and maintaining a high percentage of unit and integration test cases.
Support frequent iterations of code deployments using mature Agile DevSecOps processes and an established CI/CD pipeline in a cloud environment.
Implement and maintain Docker configuration files to deploy microservices as shippable containers.
Query, cleanse, and migrate data between legacy and modernized data sources using open source technologies.
Analyze, query, and manage data in PostgreSQL and MongoDB databases.
Ensure application accessibility and 508 compliance using tools such as WAVE, AMP, and JAWS.
Create and update the required documentation, such as the System Design Document (SDD) and Interface Control Document (ICD).
Write and execute load test scripts.
Troubleshoot system issues related to software applications.
Contribute to Agile ceremonies/meetings, including providing demonstrations of code and contributing to the Agile team wherever required.
Work alongside graphic designers for web design features.
Seek through a project from conception to finished product.
Meet both technical and consumer needs.
Stay abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages.
Qualifications:
REQUIREMENTS:
U.S. citizenship.
Must have Secret clearance or higher.
Possess bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
7+ years in C++, Java, JavaScript, database, REST/SOAP/Web Services, Network Performance/Resilience, and Tomcat
5+ years leading software development teams
5+ years in Agile software development and DevOps
5+ years in performing end-to-end software application development and software application management (Front End, Middle Tier, Back End, Storage, and Integration Points)

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
This position requires the ability to perform the below essential functions:

Sitting for long periods
Ambulate throughout an office
Ambulate between several buildings

Company Overview
----------------

Come join a higher calling and find a deeper purpose!

TuSimple is a global Artificial Intelligence Technology Company. We are the epicenter of the Autonomous Vehicle Universe. Our breakthroughs are multiple generations ahead of anyone in the world. While inventing the framework of Autonomous Driving, our current fleet of autonomous Trucks are helping communities receive much-needed supplies and medical equipment around the clock. Our people are some of the most talented engineers and contributors who are leaving behind a historic legacy.

TuSimple was founded half a decade ago with the goal of bringing the top minds in the world together to achieve the dream of a driverless truck solution. With a foundation in computer vision, algorithms, mapping, and Artificial Intelligence, TuSimple is working to create the first GLOBALLY commercially viable autonomous truck driving platform!

Responsibilities


Direct point of contact for the company during OEM vehicle development
Manage formal processes integrating the company with the OEM during vehicle development, including development processes, safety processes, Development Interface Agreement negotiation, Verification & Validation execution, etc.
Define and execute market research programs to characterize business opportunities relevant to our technologies
Perform competitive analysis
Develop, prioritize, and manage product requirements
Prepare ROI analyses
Develop partner strategies relevant to our product and solution offerings

Qualifications


5+ years experience related to product management required
Experience as a product manager in the full development lifecycle of bringing a Tier 1 solution or an OEM vehicle to market
Strong communication skills, ability to deal effectively with diverse sets of stakeholders
Deep understanding of the logistics and trucking industry strongly preferred
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field required, MBA preferred
Experience in Autonomous Technology - fully autonomous vehicles or ADAS preferred

Perks


Competitive Salary
Shape the landscape of autonomous driving
Employer Paid Health, Dental Vision (100% Employer paid premiums for you and family)
Meals served all day (breakfast, lunch, and dinner, late dinner)
Full kitchen with unlimited snacks and fruit
Company paid life insurance
Weekly team happy hour

This company does not discriminate in employment and personnel practices on the basis of race, sex, age, handicap, religion, national origin or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Hiring, transferring and promotion practices are performed without regard to the above-listed items.

Account Manager, Startups - Job Description

Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers a complete set of cloud services that enable all companies, from startups to enterprises, to run virtually everything in the cloud, including mobile applications, big data analytics, AI/ML platforms, and microservices/serverless infrastructures. Startups, which are now primarily born-in-the-cloud, represent a critically important and growing subset of customers to AWS. Startups have unique needs, priorities, and growth trajectories that distinguish them from traditional businesses and require different engagement strategies and sales motions from sellers to effectively acquire, grow, and retain them long-term on the AWS platform.

As AWS continues to rapidly grow, we seek an Americas Startup Account Manager to help drive the growth of high-potential early, mid, and late stage startups. Your responsibilities will include driving revenue and user adoption, migrations, and ensuring new startups select AWS as their primary cloud provider. You will align closely with counterparts in business development, marketing, solution architecture and partner teams to lead execution of coordinated go-to-market strategies and sales plays. You will also work closely with business development teams who are driving strategic support, global co-programming, and portfolio engagement to help drive top-of-funnel customer acquisition and accelerate seller cycles in the field.

You will be at the heart of latest trends like artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), serverless and IoT. Your customers leverage state-of-the-art technologies on AWS to innovate and become the next disrupters, like today’s AirBnB, Slack, DoorDash, and Lyft. You are passionate about startups, a self-starter with a strong entrepreneurial spirit who is prepared to work in a fast-paced, often ambiguous environment, execute against ambitious goals, and consistently embrace the Amazon Culture.

Roles & Responsibilities:
Ensure customer success with early, mid and late stage startupsDrive revenue and market share in a defined territory or industry verticalAccelerate customer adoption through well-developed sales engagements and successful GTM StrategyMeet or exceed quarterly revenue and goal targets.Develop and execute against a comprehensive account/territory plan.Create & articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services.Accelerate customer adoption by engaging Founders, CxO, Board of Directors and VC influencersWork with partners to extend reach & drive adoption.Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts.Ensure customer satisfaction.Expect moderate travel.

Preferred Qualifications
MBA/MA/MS degreePrevious cloud expertise at a technology companyA technical background in engineering or computer scienceHistory of working for, or selling to tech startups
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Comfortable delivering results amid ambiguity and change
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

This position may be located in one of the following U.S. AWS Corp. offices (New York, Boston, Arlington Va, Atlanta)

SkyWater is co-creating the next wave of computing by operating a unique business model that enables innovative technology developers to utilize our advanced processing expertise and volume-manufacturing capabilities to bring their revolutionary products to market. This puts SkyWater at the center of a technology revolution as we exit the smartphone era and into the age of 5G and artificial intelligence. Joining our team means contributing to commercialization of some of the most exciting technologies the world has ever seen including superconducting and 3D ICs, carbon nanotube and photonic logic devices, Micro Electro-Mechanical Systems (MEMS) and other emerging device topologies.

We cultivate an environment of learning and invest in further developing the knowledge of our highly skilled and dedicated employees. We provide them with a dynamic workplace, open communication and an opportunity to grow within the company. If you’re searching for a company where you can be apart of the next level of technology and truly make a difference, consider joining SkyWater today!

Position Summary: This position will be responsible for developing and closing business in one or more areas of business including: Standard Foundry, volume wafer opportunities including ASICs designed to process, device process ports and process transfers or Custom Foundry, projects needing process technology customization with a goal of moving to volume wafer manufacturing.

Responsibilities:

Identify new business accounts and opportunities aligned with SkyWater's business focus and technical capabilities.
Develop opportunities and position SkyWater as the best solution leveraging the company’s value proposition.
Generate proposals, quotes, and statement of work (SOW), including pricing strategy.
Coordinate communication and facilitate engineering scoping to develop SOW-based pricing.
Facilitate customer requests for Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA), representations and certifications, vendor setup, pricing validations.
Negotiate purchase order (PO) terms and contracts for optimal profit, cash flow, intellectual property (IP) terms, and liability.
Work with legal and/or contracts administration to develop redlines on negotiated documents.
Close PO’s and contracts, both with customer and internal stakeholders.
Partner with SkyWater Technical Account Manager(s) to obtain and document customer requirements, revenue potential, ROI, milestones and other program details as required.
Interface between customer and internal groups (engineering, finance, operations, quality).
Track and update opportunities in Salesforce CRM including revenue probabilities and next steps to close.
Present regularly on customer opportunities and collaborate on closing strategy as well as overall Territory Pipeline.
Grow Pipeline quarter over quarter at a defined % by identifying new opportunities and moving opportunities through the funnel.
Represent SkyWater as a Trusted Innovation Partner (vs a transactional vendor).
Address customer concerns and find ways for SkyWater to add value.
Foster close connections with customer stakeholders to understand needs and position SkyWater as the solution.
Attend conferences to represent SkyWater, make connections, and learn more about customer needs.
Partner with reps to develop new contacts, opportunities and manage existing customer relationships.
The job also requires performing other duties as assigned.

Required Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor’s degree

Experience and/or Training:

3+ years experience in technical sales or business development role
Strong technical understanding of electronics with the ability to learn semiconductor device fabrication and create technical solutions.
Active listening and questioning skills to understand customers needs and pain points as well as ability to extract critical sales opportunity information.
Outstanding written and verbal communication abilities including presentation experience.
Ability to collaborate effectively with internal teams, reps, customers and market partners as needed.
Organized and professional business acumen.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively.

Technology/Equipment:

Sales and opportunity tracking using CRM tools ideally Salesforce with abilities to use SmartSheet and Tableau as well.
Highly proficient computer skills and internet with developed skills in Microsoft Office (i.e. Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.).

Licenses or Certifications:

Willingness to pursue a security clearance.

U.S. Citizen Required: This position will require the holding of or ability to obtain government security clearance which requires U.S Citizenship.

Travel Requirements: 30% travel

Preferred Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in engineering (electrical preferred)

SkyWater is co-creating the next wave of computing by operating a unique business model that enables innovative technology developers to utilize our advanced processing expertise and volume-manufacturing capabilities to bring their revolutionary products to market. This puts SkyWater at the center of a technology revolution as we exit the smartphone era and into the age of 5G and artificial intelligence. Joining our team means contributing to commercialization of some of the most exciting technologies the world has ever seen including superconducting and 3D ICs, carbon nanotube and photonic logic devices, Micro Electro-Mechanical Systems (MEMS) and other emerging device topologies.

We cultivate an environment of learning and invest in further developing the knowledge of our highly skilled and dedicated employees. We provide them with a dynamic workplace, open communication and an opportunity to grow within the company. If you’re searching for a company where you can be apart of the next level of technology and truly make a difference, consider joining SkyWater today!

Position Summary: This position will work directly within the sales team, all SkyWater functional areas and customers while being fully responsible for the coordination and response to customer requests during the pre-purchase order phase through final shipment process. Primary focus will be on defining requirements, managing delivery to the requirements and addressing modifications to requirements requested by either SkyWater or the customer during the development and/or manufacturing process with the goal of meeting the customer’s expectations and SkyWater’s business objectives.

Responsibilities:

Develop a strong partnership with the sales leaders including frequent interaction while jointly managing the customer/account.
Collect, prioritize and document customer specific requirements.
Manage the internal specification review documentation of requirements while engaging the customer with technical and business questions.
Coordinate the applications review internally.
Mange the overall coordination of the customers’ requests within SkyWater including interaction internally with the Engineering, Manufacturing, Quality, Sales and Customer Management teams.
Balance and coordinate the needs of our external customers with the internal workloads of the various groups by filtering requests, prioritizing projects and buffering noise caused by incomplete requests.
Ensure the fulfillment of the technical requirements given to SkyWater by customers to enable them to make a favorable buying decision for SkyWater while meeting ROI and business objectives.
This position requires excellent communication, organization and planning skills in order to scope and complete projects in a timely manner .
Creativity and a continued willingness to learn are also key elements to success in this role.
Self-motivated initiative to proactively address potential issues quickly and to work effectively on meeting both internal and external customer needs.

job_title_origin: Director I, Data Products - BI & Analytics
job_description:
Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance - A Fortune 100 Company.
As a Director I, Data Products with Liberty Mutual Insurance, you will be a key strategic leader responsible for creating and executing our BI and Analytics strategy for GRM. The leader will also be responsible for building/augmenting our BI and analytics solutions and toolkit used to drive various business lines and needs in GRM. This role will be responsible for helping define the strategy, vision and advanced processes for a set of Data & Analytics capabilities and tools that advances our platform towards analytics, machine learning and automation in the enterprise and enabling data as a service.
You will partner with internal business owners to understand business objectives, pain points and design product requirements. You will also collaborate with engineering teams to build capabilities that best leverage the right technology to meet business objectives and deliver value. This role will be responsible for simplification of our BI solutions and footprint by matching the right personas with the appropriate tools/solutions. This role will also be responsible for launching new technical solutions and tools to enable the business partners to achieve speed to market for data. This role requires having knowledge of data infrastructure and ability to drive insights through products and solutions.
The ideal candidate will be highly motivated, strategic, solution oriented, tactical and self-driven. This person should also be an articulate communicator, detail oriented, and committed to providing outstanding results every day. If you are passionate about data and the power of analytics to create industry re-defining insights and committed to the mission of enabling data to achieve an advantage, we want you to join our team!
This position will report to the Senior Director of Data Products and can be based in any of the following NH offices: Portsmouth, Exeter, or Dover.
Responsibilities:
Understand business needs and priorities to collaborate with leaders throughout the GRM organization and create the vision for the right business intelligence and analytics solutions
Own, create and improve the delivery and utilization of business intelligence data products and platform capabilities across the organization (On prem and Cloud)
Develop a strategy to leverage the right business intelligence solutions for cloud and enable data and technology to enable appropriate personas and needs and enable self service.
Product planning, defining detailed requirements, coordinating across teams (front end developers, data engineers, solution engineers, data scientists, data analysts, and executives), mitigating risks and balancing delivery timelines with technical constraints to support business objectives
Enable change and best practices through the BI and Analytics COE (Center of excellence)
Determine business requirements and produce supporting process design documentation that clearly articulates the requirements to the Data Engineering team
Develop and improve KPI’s reflecting appropriate usage of solutions based on persona, need and speed to market
Define project success criteria and business metrics to confirm results meet the business need
Leverage agile project management disciplines for planning and execution of data and analytics projects, including design, development, testing and deployment
Gather feedback and measure the performance of delivered products
Qualifications:
6+ years’ product management experience, ideally with experience in managing a global data product
Familiar with localization and other global requirements
3+ years of people management experience, either a leader of teams or a direct manager
Demonstrated experience with full life-cycle product management: problem definition and solution discovery, stakeholder buy-in, validation, launch, and ongoing operations
Experience working with Power Platform, Tableau, SQL, SAS, MicroStrategy, Looker or other reporting and data visualization tools
Experience tracking down and creating datasets, knowledge of preparation, organization and statistical analysis
Comfortable with quick iteration and experimentation
Creative problem-solving skills, analytical thinker and passion for new technology
Excellent communication (written and oral) and presentation skills; solid business acumen; well-honed influencing skills are essential.
Familiarity and the ability to combine data science with application of machine learning, computer vision, deep learning and artificial intelligence capabilities emerging in the industry
Benefits:
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits
Overview:
At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.
We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

job_title_origin: AI/ML - ASR Grading and Analytics Manager, Siri Understanding
정리된 job_title: AI/ML - ASR Grading and Analytics Manager
job_description:
Summary
Posted: May 7, 2020
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200168175
Play a part in the next revolution in human-computer interaction. Contribute to a product that is redefining mobile computing. Create groundbreaking technology for large scale systems, spoken language, big data, and artificial intelligence. And work with the people who built the intelligent assistant that helps millions of people get things done — just by asking. Join the Siri team at Apple.
The Siri team is looking for an outstanding Engineering Manager to build and lead a team of data scientists and engineers passionate about improving speech recognition and language understanding via insights derived from massive amounts of data.
Key Qualifications
Track record of building high-performance software development teams that have delivered complex data science and engineering projects.
Proven track record of growing and guiding a development organization through learning, solving complex problems, and mentorship.
Proactive communicator, with experience guiding strong results via cross-functional partnerships and leadership skills.
Experience with large scale data processing using MapReduce/Hadoop/Spark and creating dashboards using Tableau.
5+ years of industry experience building and directing a team of high-performing software and data engineers.
Description
As a Manager of ASR Grading and Analytics, you will help hire and oversee a team of data scientists and engineers responsible for validating logging and measuring accuracy, creating dashboards, transcribed offline data sets, and executive reports. This position requires a leader who possesses strong technical skills in machine learning and big data, and a team player who can cross organizational boundaries and thrives in finding insights in ambiguity.
Education & Experience
Master’s or PhD in Computer Science or related field.

EvTek is a full-service Recycling Technology Company that helps people, businesses and municipalities who want money and data for their recyclables. The EvTek System is a reliable and trustworthy recycling solution that generates metrics to connect consumers to their actions and provides our customers value through carbon credits, consumer data, and higher quality raw materials. Unlike other companies that have aging and inefficient recycling processes, EvTek increases value by maximizing efficiency at every step of the supply chain.

As the Lead Software Engineer, you will be in charge of all software-related aspects of the company. Our team is small, fast and agile and we are tackling some of the industry's most challenging problems every day. We are partnered with one of Long Island's largest recycling centers so we are able to test our technology in the real world and make a true difference in our community and beyond.

Skills Required:
Passion for Recycling.
Solid Mathematical and Algorithms Knowledge (Strong knowledge of Computer Vision, Machine Learning with a focus in Deep Learning, and general Artificial Intelligence algorithms is required).
Expertise In Programming Languages (Python/C++/Java).
Understands high-level architectural design and patterns.
Experience building "full" solutions.
Actively mentors intermediate and junior developers.
Well-Versed With Probability and Statistics.
Efficiency In Distributed Computing.
Command Over Unix Tools.
Curiosity, Creativity, and Patience.
Ability To Grasp New Concepts Quickly.

Significant Equity + Negotiable Salary
Come join us and Close the Loop!



About EvTek

We believe it is our responsibility to build a sustainable world. It is possible to naturally shift human behavior so that together we save and maintain the world's beauty, instead of destroying it. When our customers recycle with us, we go to extraordinary lengths to ensure them that they aren't just recycling, they are truly contributing to closing the loop. Our incentive based programs coupled with advanced metrics allow individuals and corporations to easily adopt a sustainable lifestyle. When you recycle with us it is just the beginning, through our educational programs and eco-friendly product line, we help guide people to make sustainable choices, creating a first of its kind positive feedback loop.

Join us as we ignite the change that changes everything.

About the Position

The Intelligent Retail Lab is part of Walmart's Store No 8, an innovation hub formed by the world's largest retailer focused on identifying and investing in trends and technologies reshaping the shopping experience. As a people-led, tech-empowered business, we believe that technology has immense potential to enhance the associate and customer experience in our stores. That's why we created the first-of-its-kind IRL inside an existing and fully-operating grocery store in Levittown, NY. This working Artificial Intelligence lab, inside a 50K sq. ft store with 30K items and more than 100 associates, will allow us to test a broad range of applications such as improving inventory and on-shelf availability, enhancing both the associate and customer experience in our stores.

The Director Customer Success role is a customer-facing account management position that is a foundational part of the Intelligent Retail Lab's commercial growth plans. You will be the lead account person overseeing the customer relationship, coordinating work initiatives, product deliverables, and stakeholder engagements that further the relationships and grows revenues with the customer. Responsibilities will include developing the customer strategy, ensuring customer delight and pursuing organic revenue growth opportunities within the client. In this process you will partner with internal stakeholders such as the Product, Operations, Technology and Business Development teams to support your client management efforts. As the business matures, this role will continue to evolve.

In This Role, You Will


Manage and grow the relationship within your assigned customer accounts
Responsible for developing a strategy and plan to meet or exceed sales targets, customer delight and contract renewals
Lead customer-facing presentations and product demos
Support Business Development team from the Proof-of-Concept to contract stage for new business, at which point the Customer Success team assumes responsibility for the account relationship
Manage Engagement Managers within each customer team
Senior contact and lead point of communication with customer stakeholders.
Internal customer advocate, representing the voice of the customer.
Leads teams in development of project/program plans and timelines
Monitors execution progress and ensures deliverable quality
Manage program which encapsulates multiple workstreams in parallel
Leads teams in development of project/program plans and timelines
Identifies potential issues and devises contingencies
Manage successful relationship within the organization

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or higher
10+ years experience in Account Management and/or Customer Success with enterprise SaaS, software, information technology or analytics.
5+ years experience leading Account Management teams with multimillion-dollar engagements within Retail and CPG
5+ years people management and leadership experience
Able to translate a customer strategy into an execution plan
Experience representing and supporting innovative technologies that are in the infancy of market adoption
Track record of managing a quota with long sales cycles, successfully navigating enterprise contract renewals, maintaining high customer delight ratings, and growing account relationships over $5 million in annual billing
Excellent verbal, written and presentation communication skills
Ability to travel up to 50% both domestic and international
Technology savvy with high level proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel, and Salesforce

Why you would love it here

At IRL we function like a startup and have the benefits of the largest retailer in the world, Walmart. Our benefit package includes a monthly gym stipend, a generous parental leave program, leading healthcare options, 401k matching, and more! We offer unlimited vacation and a great culture filled with quarterly outings, happy hours, work out classes, celebrations, and clubs. Most importantly, we empower our industry-leading tech team to solve far future problems and focus on building magical shopping experience for the consumers. Join us!

Space Warfighting Capabilities Chief Scientist - (00055665)
Description

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us.
MITRE is different from most technology companies. MITRE is a trusted operator of federally funded research and development centers and we’re on a mission to make a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. We are chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do.

To deliver on our mission, we need the world’s best talent and leaders—groundbreakers and partnership-builders on a global scale in areas like space, cybersecurity, critical infrastructure resiliency, artificial intelligence, healthcare, and pandemic management. In return, we have the privilege of backing you with thousands of technical experts in diverse fields, a culture of innovation and knowledge sharing, access to data and resources uniquely available to MITRE through our wide-ranging partnerships across government, industry and academia.

MITRE is seeking a Technical Advisor and Project Manager to join our senior leadership team supporting the Air Force Space and Missile System Center (SMC). Our Space Warfighting Division is composed of incredible people withdiverse thinking and backgrounds in fields like satellite systems engineering,astrodynamics, satellite communications, space-based sensing, signal processing,software system integration, PNT and mission analysis. This position is an exciting opportunity to have significant mission impact on cutting edge and critical advanced capabilities for the Space Force.

In this position you will apply demonstrated technical depth in space and groundsystem design, enterprise engineering, system interfaces, modeling & simulation, system resiliency and/or mission analysis. In addition, significant responsibility will be given to the candidate to execute MITRE’s work program aligned. The candidate will partner with senior SMC Special Programs sponsors, as well as, other mission partners, AFRL, and across SMC’s Cross Mission Ground and Portfolio Architect.


In this position, you will:
Assume a key role in developing, integrating, and implementing mission direction and objectives, providing technical recommendations through rapid prototyping, creating solutions in support of our primary partner. engagement, executing technical solution performance with rigorous attention to detail, and focusing on compliance, growth, project schedules, and deliverables.
Identify key areas of innovation and investment where MITRE can actively engage sponsors and provide technical recommendations through rapid prototyping.
- Provide agile, responsive, decisive advice on complex mission directives and strategies involving technical document preparation/presentation to division technical directors and department leadership, application of company policies and procedures, and enterprise project execution to support mission needs.

Actively collaborate with Space Division and Space Portfolio technical directors.
Manage technical project mission impact of a project of projects, whilemaintaining scope, schedule, staffing, and budget.
Identify and align work programs across the Space Division to achieve strategyoutcomes.
- Engage with PEOs and material leaders to shape desired project outcomes and serve as the primary interface.
- Engage with MITRE Portfolio Managers, Program Division Department Heads, and Tech Centers to shape and execute the project consistent with the Space Warfighting Portfolio strategy and staff accordingly.
- Oversee activities of individual project contributors, providing regular feedback on their contributions, and engaging with the program division chief engineer to maintain technical quality on the project.
- Manage risk consistent with MITRE and Space Division’s risk management processes.
Qualifications

Qualifications:
Extensive working knowledge of space mission operations, cyber operations, enterprise engineering and architecture, system interfaces, command and control systems, modeling & simulation, system resiliency, and space sensors and data exploitation.
- Familiarity with operations and architectures across Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, civil, and commercial agencies.
- Understanding of space systems and missions across DoD, the Intelligence Community, and civil and commercial agencies.
- Experience establishing and growing trusted relationships at senior leadership levels (GO/SES), with a proven track record of being a strategic partner.
- Strong analytical approach to strategy development and implementation, problem solving, and technology- and threat-based risk assessments.
- Ability to provide expert, timely recommendations on complex mission directives and strategies involving technical document preparation and presentations.

Current TS and eligibility for SAP.Must be located or willing to relocate to Los Angeles.

Minimum Qualifications:
BS and 15 years of related experience.

Primary Location: United States-California-El Segundo
Work Locations: MITRE Los Angeles 90245
Job: Systems Engineering
This requisition requires a clearance of: SAP
Travel: Yes, 25 % of the Time

job_title_origin: GBSD OC2 Principal Cyber Software Engineer (Agile Dev/Sec/Ops)
job_description:
Start your future with a new mission: Northrop Grumman Space Systems (NGSP). As a part of the NGSP Team, you will work with experts that develop systems and solutions to keep our world safe. Together we protect our troops, public safety, information, and our planet. It's unique work. It's challenging and rewarding. But most of all, it is work that makes a difference. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work, and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history. Join us and launch your career.


Northrop Grumman Space Systems is seeking a Cyber DevSecOps Principal Software Engineer. This position will be located in Huntsville, AL and will support the Ground Based Strategic Deterrent (GBSD) program. Learn more about the GBSD program here .


Northrop Grumman supports the Air Force's sustainment, development, production and deployment of hardware and system modifications for Intercontinental Ballistic Missile (ICBM) Ground and Airborne Launch Control Systems, Launch Facilities and associated infrastructure.


What you will get to do, specific duties to include, but are not limited to the following:


Designs, develops and tests Cyber functionality

Designs, develops and tests simulation software for use in high fidelity simulation based training systems; training systems may include a combination of console and weapon system simulations, virtual reality, and augmented reality

Design and develop artificial intelligence algorithms to tutor, assess and evaluate learner knowledge

Develops and maintains databases to monitor and analyze learner and system performance

Collaborates with Systems and Quality Engineers to ensure software requirements are met

Performs software peer reviews, version control, automated tests, software analysis, continuous integration, and continuous delivery in accordance with DevSecOps processes and best practices

Performs code quality management and corrects defects

Coordinates with HW/SW team to perform retests and regression tests once defects are corrected.




As a full-time employee of Northrop Grumman Space Systems, you are eligible for our robust benefits package including:


Medical, Dental & Vision coverage

401k

Educational Assistance

Life Insurance

Employee Assistance Programs & Work/Life Solutions

Paid Time Off

Health & Wellness Resources

Employee Discounts



This position's standard work schedule is a 9/80. The 9/80 schedule allows employees who work a nine-hour day Monday through Thursday to take every other Friday off.


GBSD_Jobs


Qualifications:

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree and 5 years of relevant experience; or 3 Years with Masters; 0 Years with PhD

Must have an Active DoD Secret Clearance with adjudication in the last 6 years

Candidate should have:


Strong experience with build automation tools such as Jenkins, GoCD, Travis CI or Circle CI

Strong experience with deployment automation tools such as chef, puppet or ansible

Experience with working in a fast pace, agile environment with the ability to work on cross-function Scrum team focused on quality and capability delivery

Experience with Java/C/C++ development and/or front-end web development including JavaScript Frameworks (Angular JS or React), HTML, and CSS

Familiarity with DevSecOps, continuous integration, and continuous delivery

Familiarity with distributed version control software (Git, Mercurial)

Experience with Linux and Windows operating systems

Familiarity with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, Extreme Programming), Scaled Agile Framework - SAFe for Lean Enterprises





Travel 10-15%


Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Being a Cloud Services Manager at iManage means…
You are responsible for the day to day iManage Cloud Customer Portfolio deployment planning, management including overall Cloud customer satisfaction and reference-ability. You will be accountable for Cloud customer account administration, support, and direction while ensuring day-to-day operational success. In addition, you will interface directly with and provide guidance to our Cloud customer's implementation services provider (iManage Partners), including key stakeholders such as the project manager, business sponsor, networking, and operations teams to ensure iManage Cloud onboarding success.
As a Cloud Services Manager, you will work closely with the internal iManage team such as Cloud Operations and Cloud Support to ensure continuity when a customer transitions from implementation to ongoing operations in the iManage Cloud.
iM Responsible For...
Providing day to day management of assigned cloud onboarding portfolio for project tasks and communications
Proactively managing the relationship with internal and outsourced iManage Cloud implementation partners and customers, including setting expectations regarding deliverables and schedules; ensuring that the project team members are effectively communicating and collaborating
Establishing and maintaining a business relationship with the iManage Cloud customer as well as the customer's implementation team to ensure customer satisfaction with the implementation; serving as the first line of response for customer escalations during implementation
Interfacing with internal iManage teams to ensure successful delivery of the components required for an iManage Cloud implementation including iManage CloudOpS, Networking, R&D, Pre-Sales, Sales, and Product Management.
Maintaining cloud-related customer data in appropriate systems including: Salesforce, DevOps, ZenDesk, etc.
Listening to customer and partner feedback and resolving any issues or conflicts
Assisting with developing relationships with onboarding customers/partners that promote retention and loyalty
Ensuring that new customers are referenceable 60 days after go-live for new deployments and upgrades
Learning and supporting iManage Cloud Product lines for customer onboarding
Educating iManage cloud implementation partners for cloud onboarding processes
Remaining current on technology and process changes as it relates to Cloud Services and Onboarding
Supporting department initiatives which include but not limited to projects such as documentation updates, reporting metrics, and net promoter scores
iM Qualified Because I have...
A Bachelor's Degree in Business, Business Administration, Information Management, Computer Science or the equivalent
A minimum of 3-5+ Years' experience managing software implementation projects
Project Management skills
SaaS/PaaS implementation experience
Excellent business communication, organizational and project management skills
Strong computer skills
Excellent time management and decision-making skills
Bonus Points Because I have...
A working knowledge of iManage products
Used SalesForce and ticketing systems
A team player attitude; an ability to work well independently and as part of a team
A PMP certification
About iManage
iManage combines artificial intelligence with content and email management to free, secure, and understand information. Over 3000 companies and 1 million users worldwide rely on our market-leading software to share and protect their most valuable data. Our work is not always easy but it is ambitious and rewarding.
So we're looking for people who love a challenge. People who are happiest when they're solving problems and collaborating with the industry's best and brightest. In exchange, we'll make sure the work you do here is worth doing. That's the iManage way. It's how we do things that might appear impossible. How we develop our employees' strengths and unlock their potential. It's how we find meaning in everything we do.
Whoever you are, whatever you do, however you work. Make it mean something at iManage.

Learn more at: www.imanage.com
Please see our privacy statement for more information on how we handle your personal data: https://imanage.com/privacy-policy/

job_title_origin: Director I, Data Products - BI & Analytics
job_description:
Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance - A Fortune 100 Company.
As a Director I, Data Products with Liberty Mutual Insurance, you will be a key strategic leader responsible for creating and executing our BI and Analytics strategy for GRM. The leader will also be responsible for building/augmenting our BI and analytics solutions and toolkit used to drive various business lines and needs in GRM. This role will be responsible for helping define the strategy, vision and advanced processes for a set of Data & Analytics capabilities and tools that advances our platform towards analytics, machine learning and automation in the enterprise and enabling data as a service.
You will partner with internal business owners to understand business objectives, pain points and design product requirements. You will also collaborate with engineering teams to build capabilities that best leverage the right technology to meet business objectives and deliver value. This role will be responsible for simplification of our BI solutions and footprint by matching the right personas with the appropriate tools/solutions. This role will also be responsible for launching new technical solutions and tools to enable the business partners to achieve speed to market for data. This role requires having knowledge of data infrastructure and ability to drive insights through products and solutions.
The ideal candidate will be highly motivated, strategic, solution oriented, tactical and self-driven. This person should also be an articulate communicator, detail oriented, and committed to providing outstanding results every day. If you are passionate about data and the power of analytics to create industry re-defining insights and committed to the mission of enabling data to achieve an advantage, we want you to join our team!
This position will report to the Senior Director of Data Products and can be based in any of our offices in New Hampshire or in Boston, Seattle, and Indianapolis. We are also open to considering a remote/virtual hire.
Responsibilities:
Understand business needs and priorities to collaborate with leaders throughout the GRM organization and create the vision for the right business intelligence and analytics solutions
Own, create and improve the delivery and utilization of business intelligence data products and platform capabilities across the organization (On prem and Cloud)
Develop a strategy to leverage the right business intelligence solutions for cloud and enable data and technology to enable appropriate personas and needs and enable self service.
Product planning, defining detailed requirements, coordinating across teams (front end developers, data engineers, solution engineers, data scientists, data analysts, and executives), mitigating risks and balancing delivery timelines with technical constraints to support business objectives
Enable change and best practices through the BI and Analytics COE (Center of excellence)
Determine business requirements and produce supporting process design documentation that clearly articulates the requirements to the Data Engineering team
Develop and improve KPI’s reflecting appropriate usage of solutions based on persona, need and speed to market
Define project success criteria and business metrics to confirm results meet the business need
Leverage agile project management disciplines for planning and execution of data and analytics projects, including design, development, testing and deployment
Gather feedback and measure the performance of delivered products
Qualifications:
6+ years’ product management experience, ideally with experience in managing a global data product
Familiar with localization and other global requirements
3+ years of people management experience, either a leader of teams or a direct manager
Demonstrated experience with full life-cycle product management: problem definition and solution discovery, stakeholder buy-in, validation, launch, and ongoing operations
Experience working with Power Platform, Tableau, SQL, SAS, MicroStrategy, Looker or other reporting and data visualization tools
Experience tracking down and creating datasets, knowledge of preparation, organization and statistical analysis
Comfortable with quick iteration and experimentation
Creative problem-solving skills, analytical thinker and passion for new technology
Excellent communication (written and oral) and presentation skills; solid business acumen; well-honed influencing skills are essential.
Familiarity and the ability to combine data science with application of machine learning, computer vision, deep learning and artificial intelligence capabilities emerging in the industry
Benefits:
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits
Overview:
At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed.
We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

Responsibilities
The Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Department seeks a creative and enthusiastic Data Science Project Leader to join a diverse team of engineers, data scientists, and programmers with a passion for machine and deep learning, data analytics, natural language processing, statistical analysis, and computer vision. Systems and Technology Research (STR) is a rapidly growing technology company with locations north of Boston, MA, Arlington, VA and near Dayton, OH. We specialize in advanced research and development for defense, intelligence, and national security, trying to understand how to protect our society: from stopping malicious botnet attacks, to understanding cyber vulnerabilities, providing next generation sensors, radar, sonar, communications, and electronic warfare to developing artificial intelligence algorithms and analytics to make sense of the complexity that is exploding around us.

STR is hiring a Cybersecurity Manager to lead the technical and compliance role on the Enterprise IT team responsible for ensuring that the company's information resources are secure from unauthorized access, protected from inappropriate alteration, physically secure, compliant and available to users in a timely fashion. The Cybersecurity Manager is responsible for designing, implementing, supporting and maintaining policies and security solutions in both operational and customer hosted environments. This position is perfect for an organized, action-oriented team player with the ability to prioritize daily work and support on multiple initiatives simultaneously, strong communication, technical skills and customer focus is required.

What you’ll do:
Lead IT/InfoSec projects, identifying and communicating risks specific to the project, and actions necessary for remediation including recommendations for logical access controls, secure application configuration, general secure data handling processes.
Support the development, implementation, and management of security policies/procedures to ensure they remain aligned with business objectives/meet regulatory requirements.
Manage the day-to-day security systems operations, including the log reviews and following up on any security alerts.
Manage the Incident Response Plan, leads the Incident Response team during all cybersecurity incidents, and represents the InfoSec team on all other security incidents.
Correlate threat information from various sources including security incidents raised by the user community including phishing attempts, malware outbreaks, unauthorized access attempts as well as security alerting sources.
Research and assessing new threats and security alerts and recommend remedial actions.
Proactive scanning of systems and networks to ensure that vulnerabilities are identified and oversee remediation, including the configuration of scan sites, scheduling of scans, production of reports, interpretation and communication of results.
Provide expertise and support to ensure the company’s security framework remains in compliance with applicable regulations including evolving data privacy regulations.
Provide support with third party security risk assessments/IT audit and provides tracking for findings, resolution.
Support the development, implementation and management of cybersecurity knowledgebase.
Serve as an internal information security lead and consultant to the organization, providing guidance and support for business inquiries, requests.
Serve as a primary point of contact with STR’s cybersecurity partner.
Perform additional duties and projects as assigned.

Who you are:
US Citizen with the ability to obtain a Security Clearance
BS/BA degree in Computer Information Systems/Management Information Systems or related discipline or equivalent
5 - 7 years related work experience in information security governance and/or related functions such as IT audit and IT Risk Management.
Strong technical background with a variety of information security systems and tools including firewalls, intrusion detection systems, intrusion prevention systems, vulnerability management, intrusion detection and prevention, cloud access security broker, anti-virus/malware, data loss prevention.
Experience designing and implementing controls within corporate networks to include computer and network security and operating systems such as UNIX, Linux, MAC, and WINDOWS, as well as LAN/WAN internetworking protocols such as TCP/IP and network perimeter protection.
Excellent analytical skills in order to identify security risks and appropriate measures needed to help mitigate those risks. Must be comfortable in conducting independent research of issues and inquiries to provide guidance when requested.
Experience with system implementations, identification of security related risks and development of recommended actions for remediation.
Experience with Security Incident Response including hands on involvement in detection, analysis, containment and remediation phases.
Knowledgeable with information security management frameworks such as AT101 SOC 2, ISO, ITIL, CobiT and knowledge of NIST 800.171 to include development of policies, process and procedures within the environment.

Systems and Technology Research (STR) is a rapidly growing technology company with locations north of Boston, MA, Arlington, VA and near Dayton, OH. We specialize in advanced research and development for defense, intelligence, and national security, trying to understand how to protect our society: from stopping malicious botnet attacks, to understanding cyber vulnerabilities, providing next generation sensors, radar, sonar, communications, and electronic warfare to developing artificial intelligence algorithms and analytics to make sense of the complexity that is exploding around us.

STR is hiring a Cybersecurity Manager to lead the technical and compliance role on the Enterprise IT team responsible for ensuring that the company's information resources are secure from unauthorized access, protected from inappropriate alteration, physically secure, compliant and available to users in a timely fashion. The Cybersecurity Manager is responsible for designing, implementing, supporting and maintaining policies and security solutions in both operational and customer hosted environments. This position is perfect for an organized, action-oriented team player with the ability to prioritize daily work and support on multiple initiatives simultaneously, strong communication, technical skills and customer focus is required.

What you’ll do:
Lead IT/InfoSec projects, identifying and communicating risks specific to the project, and actions necessary for remediation including recommendations for logical access controls, secure application configuration, general secure data handling processes.
Support the development, implementation, and management of security policies/procedures to ensure they remain aligned with business objectives/meet regulatory requirements.
Manage the day-to-day security systems operations, including the log reviews and following up on any security alerts.
Manage the Incident Response Plan, leads the Incident Response team during all cybersecurity incidents, and represents the InfoSec team on all other security incidents.
Correlate threat information from various sources including security incidents raised by the user community including phishing attempts, malware outbreaks, unauthorized access attempts as well as security alerting sources.
Research and assessing new threats and security alerts and recommend remedial actions.
Proactive scanning of systems and networks to ensure that vulnerabilities are identified and oversee remediation, including the configuration of scan sites, scheduling of scans, production of reports, interpretation and communication of results.
Provide expertise and support to ensure the company’s security framework remains in compliance with applicable regulations including evolving data privacy regulations.
Provide support with third party security risk assessments/IT audit and provides tracking for findings, resolution.
Support the development, implementation and management of cybersecurity knowledgebase.
Serve as an internal information security lead and consultant to the organization, providing guidance and support for business inquiries, requests.
Serve as a primary point of contact with STR’s cybersecurity partner.
Perform additional duties and projects as assigned.

Who you are:
US Citizen with the ability to obtain a Security Clearance
BS/BA degree in Computer Information Systems/Management Information Systems or related discipline or equivalent
5 - 7 years related work experience in information security governance and/or related functions such as IT audit and IT Risk Management.
Strong technical background with a variety of information security systems and tools including firewalls, intrusion detection systems, intrusion prevention systems, vulnerability management, intrusion detection and prevention, cloud access security broker, anti-virus/malware, data loss prevention.
Experience designing and implementing controls within corporate networks to include computer and network security and operating systems such as UNIX, Linux, MAC, and WINDOWS, as well as LAN/WAN internetworking protocols such as TCP/IP and network perimeter protection.
Excellent analytical skills in order to identify security risks and appropriate measures needed to help mitigate those risks. Must be comfortable in conducting independent research of issues and inquiries to provide guidance when requested.
Experience with system implementations, identification of security related risks and development of recommended actions for remediation.
Experience with Security Incident Response including hands on involvement in detection, analysis, containment and remediation phases.
Knowledgeable with information security management frameworks such as AT101 SOC 2, ISO, ITIL, CobiT and knowledge of NIST 800.171 to include development of policies, process and procedures within the environment.
DoD 8570 Certs - CISA, CISM, CRISC, CISSP, or similar security certification.
