job_title_origin: Director of Order Trade and Compliance Technology
정리된 job_title: Director - Order Trade and Compliance Technology
job_description:
Our Firm
American Century Investments® is a leading global asset manager with over 60 years of experience helping investors achieve their financial goals. Serving a broad client base including financial advisors, institutions and individual investors, we offer a wide range of investment strategies across a variety of investment disciplines.
Privately controlled and independent, we focus solely on investment management. This empowers us to align our decisions with client expectations and concentrate on their long-term money management needs.
We are committed to providing institutional-quality, actively managed solutions with a performance-centered mindset. Our expertise spans global growth equity, global value equity, disciplined equity, multi-asset strategies, global fixed income, alternatives and ETFs.
Our culture of winning behaviors exemplifies our dedication to clients every single day.
Delivering investment results enables us to distribute over 40% of our dividends—or more than $1.5 billion since 2000—to the Stowers Institute for Medical Research, a 550-person, non-profit biomedical research organization with a controlling interest in American Century Investments. Our dividend payments provide ongoing financial support for the Institute’s work of uncovering the causes, treatments and prevention of life-threatening diseases, like cancer.
Headquartered in Kansas City, MO, we also have offices located in New York; London; Hong Kong; Sydney; El Segundo, CA (Los Angeles area); and Mountain View, CA (Silicon Valley).
For more information, please visit americancentury.com.
Position Summary:
The Director of Order Trade & Compliance Technology leads the technical order generation, trade execution and pre-trade compliance capabilities for the firm. We are undertaking a significant transformation of our Investments technology capabilities, and this person will be essential to supporting this endeavor!
We have multiple, intricate sets of systems supporting our current capabilities and have built and embedded custom IP within them over the years. In order to maintain our competitive position, we need to retrain and enhance those capabilities while we upgrade our technology estate!
This is a key leadership role, responsible for inspiring and driving technology teams and working with key business partners. They will lead technology efforts in alignment with the firm’s strategy.
Specific areas of importance include trading and order management, technology leadership and partnership to business; enterprise technology design and development. They will drive digital transformation through AI, ML and Blockchain; data engineering and data analytics.

In this role, you will:
Utilize progressive technologies and design patterns to build a roadmap for trading and executing upgrades within the firm.
Modernize the deployment of microservices based architecture, cloud technologies, artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies.
Provide inspirational leadership and management to build strong application development teams.
Lead and advise business partners on architecture, capabilities, projects, opportunities and problems.
Participate in enterprise prioritization processes to represent the business needs and gain consensus for allocation of resources to complete the work.
Offer thought leadership to the firm by encouraging standard methodologies, driving the organization vision, referencing architecture and positively participating in strategy formulation etc.
Lead technology delivery, plan and lead staffing requirements, scheduling and projects in an agile environment. Review performance, quality, budget, organization and standards of the development team efforts.
Participate on the Application Development leadership team and actively influence strategic direction for the organization while ensure all tactics are in support of the long-term strategy.
Improve the productivity, cost-effectiveness and quality of the Information Technology department and business area.
Ensure accountability of management of security, compliance and audit requirements for all systems, including information security related projects or requests.
Required Skills/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree preferably in Computer Science, MBA is preferred.
15+ years of experience with significant leadership and supervisory tenure, preferably in buy side firms.
Experience in building and deploying Order Management Systems, Trade Execution technologies, pre and post trade compliance systems.
Experience with leading OMS systems like CRD, SimCorp OMS, EzeCastle etc. will be helpful.
A strong expertise in trading and order management architecture.
Significant experience operating in financial services, with preference for buy-side (asset management, investment manager, hedge fund, mutual fund) experience.
Working understanding of the entire value chain of investment management including research, portfolio construction, portfolio management, risk management, investments analytics etc.
Cross asset class knowledge –Equities, Fixed Income, Alternatives and Multi-Asset flows.
Outstanding interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate with individuals at all levels of the organization in both verbal and written form
Solid technical knowledge, including expertise in Cloud platforms (AWS preferred), microservices architecture, enterprise integration design patterns, current data engineering practices, and an understanding of artificial intelligence and machine learning.
Inspirational people leader, who can serve as a role model, to build and lead an Information Technology team.
Strong enterprise level project management and vendor relationship skills.
EOE Policy Statement : American Century Investments believes all individuals are entitled to equal employment opportunity and advancement opportunities without regard to race, religious creed, color, sex, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age for individuals forty years of age and older, military and veteran status, sexual orientation, and any other basis protected by applicable federal, state and local laws. ACI does not discriminate or adopt any policy that discriminates against an individual or any group of individuals on any of these bases.

job_title_origin: ES Tech, Sr. Technical Program Manager
job_description:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field7+ years of customer-facing product development and product management experience, including defining, launching, and optimizing product and services

Software has revolutionized every industry it has touched. While online learning has taken a strong root over the last two decades, we are at the cusp of the next wave of innovation in the learning space with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. And where better to influence that than in the company known for innovation at a global scale.

Amazon Learning Products and Services team is looking for a Sr. Technical Program Manager to join an exciting opportunity to reinvigorate our learning platform. You are responsible for working with our business partners across the company and its subsidiaries, articulating and driving the product feature design, prioritizing feature roadmap, contributing to the system design and architecture, and ensuring the final product experience.

On this team, you’ll get to wear many hats, work fast and smart, and iterate quickly. We are looking for someone who is ready to take ownership of a growing business opportunity and join a tightly-knit team tackling interesting challenges. You are innovative, courageous, positive, and are itching to explore your own full potential in creativity, technology, and experiences.

Proven track record of taking ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentExperience leading cross-functional teams to deliver products and online services on tight deadlinesExperience coordinating complex products with stringent technical requirements, development cycles and schedulesExperience with learning management systems (LMS) or other similar learning environment a huge plusStrong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations and drive actionsAbility to think strategically and execute methodically, with a penchant for deeply technical solutionsProficient writer and communicator, with ability to communicate any technical depthMBA or Master’s degreeExperience with developing business partnershipKnowledge of agile product development and life-cycle management process

Program Manager
Who are we?
SDL is the global leader and innovator in language and content management technology and services. We enable companies to create meaningful digital journeys and form important emotional connections with their global customers by powering the creation, translation and delivery of relevant, personalized content to make understanding possible. We are a dynamic, collaborative and globally diverse team, working together to completely transform how the world communicates and connects with one another through content. If you like making an impact, helping others, taking a fresh look at processes and tools, furthering an open an innovative culture and tend to generally look at even the smallest task in the context of how it impacts the overall organization – we should talk!
What is this role?
SDL Research is currently looking to hire a Program Manager to join our organization and help us evolve our proven record of Machine Translation innovation and success in delivering cutting edge Linguistic Artificial Intelligence technology to our valued customers.
In this role you will be responsible for planning, driving, coordinating and monitoring programs and activities throughout the program management lifecycle in order to support our organization's strategic short term objectives. You will also be tasked with managing and measuring progress and performance towards achieving long term company goals.
The perfect candidate is a service-minded self-starter with excellent organization, communication and adaptability skills that is experienced in project and program management, can collaborate with multiple teams and managers simultaneously and has an affinity for process and team productivity improvement.
Responsibilities:
Plan, implement and monitor programs in accordance with the mission, strategy and goals of the organization
Develop program status and success assessment protocols for evaluation and continuous improvement
Oversee multiple research and development team activities, ensuring program objectives are met in alignment with customer satisfaction, high quality standards and high team performance
Manage and analyze program risks and dependencies
Organize and facilitate stakeholder sync-ups to ensure communication regarding program progress and impediments is seamless and transparent
Support research and development teams and activities to guarantee a cadenced delivery schedule for services and new products versions
Manage and monitor program scope changes and interventions to ensure program objectives are not compromised
Manage and monitor customer escalations to guarantee appropriate prioritization and resolution
Produce accurate and timely reporting of program stats throughout its lifecycle to ensure accurate record keeping and optimize decision making processes

Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
2+ years of experiencing in project and/or program management
Excellent communication skills (oral and written)
Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, Outlook and SharePoint
Understanding of Agile frameworks and experience with Agile project management software
Bachelor’s degree or master degree in the field of operations, linguistics or strategy

Preferred Qualifications:
Understanding of NLP (Natural Language Processing) principles and hands-on experience with machine translation
Experience with creation and implementation of scaled processes and operations
Proven stakeholder management skills
Ability to analyze data and present metrics in order to facilitate decision making
High attention to detail and excellent ability to accommodate competing priorities in a fast-paced working environment
Ability to thrive and constantly perform while working to facilitate, support and monitor research and development efforts

Benefits:
Amazing benefits. (Seriously!)
Infinite training, professional development and personal growth opportunities.
The rare opportunity to impact how organizations communicate globally. There’s a reason we work with 90 of the top 100 brands.
Smart, engaged co-workers, a culture of diversity, innovation and opportunity.
Relaxed, fun environment with a game room, in house happy hours and many great office events throughout the year.
Great work life balance with 5 weeks of PTO and 40 hours of volunteer time per year!

We are seeking to fill a position of Project Manager to manage all activities for customer interface, project deployment, installation, configuration, and support of our intelligent systems. This role requires a “hands-on” PM to be able to execute project management fundamentals including, but not limited to, development of schedules, risk management, and the management of sub-contractors on and off site. The position requires excellent written and verbal communication skills for customer and executive level status reporting while also being able to technically contribute to installation, configuration and deployment of our product portfolio. This is a full-time position located in Jacksonville, FL and reports to the Vice President of Field Operations.
We specialize in developing, implementing and supporting integrated advanced technology systems to address complex business challenges. Our core proprietary technologies incorporate artificial intelligence applications, including video analytics-based security applications, intelligent process controls, and information technologies, for a wide range of global customers. For more information, please visit our website at http://www.duostech.com/.
Responsibilities:
Direct and manage assigned full-scale project plans and project lifecycles from beginning to end in a fast-paced dynamic environment
Responsible for overall performance of the project team and sub-contractors, including design, procurement, construction, test, and operations
Define and document project scope, goals, and deliverables that will support business goals in collaboration with management and stakeholders
Identify, record, and mitigate risks throughout the project lifecycle
Effectively set and communicate project expectations in line with upper management and company stakeholders
Work with project team to define success criteria for project lifecycle with members and stakeholders in a timely and clear fashion
Effectively document and deliver progress reports to continually set and manage project expectations with team members and other stakeholders
Possess the ability to manage changes in project scope, identify potential issues, and devise contingency plans
Plan, schedule, track, and communicate project timelines, milestones, and deliverables using appropriate tools
Prepare project budgets, track costs, and provide leadership reports on actual vs budget financials
Proactively manage operational KPIs to identify financial risks and develop action plan to mitigate loss
Modify budgets, project forecasting, and adapt to changes and escalate as needed
Maintain working knowledge of all Duos Technologies products and systems to be a subject matter expert
Educate and train internal departments and external customer about the products key features and service offering
Qualifications:
5-7 years of project management experience in the one of the fields below is desired:
 Commissioning of video surveillance/video analytics systems
Physical security applications
Large scale automated or heavy equipment involving subcontractors/buildouts
BS Degree in Engineering discipline preferred, or a combination of education and experience
Project management skills (development of Gantt charts, use of project management software) required
Motivated self-starter who is comfortable working alone or in a team environment
Demonstrated ability managing staff and directing project teams and sub-contractors to complete required tasks and activities
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate cross-organization and work well in a small, fast-paced team environment
Demonstrated client and vendor management skills – excellent interpersonal skills
Demonstrated ability in handling, resolving, and communicating complex technical issues with customers in real-time using strong analytical and communication skills
Excel in negotiation skills/techniques with internal delivery teams or vendors to manage work execution
Solid understanding of infrastructure and IT technologies
Execute program plans by using tools identified in the planning phase and by auditing the results of their use to align the program outcomes with stakeholder expectations and standards
PMP Certification is a plus
Understanding of current environmental laws and practices is a plus
Experience in the transportation or rail/railroad industry is a plus
Bi-lingual English and Spanish is a plus
Inspires loyalty and trust, handles oneself ethically following core values
Generous compensation package with incentives based on performance. Benefit package includes paid group health, dental, life, and disability insurance; voluntary vision, critical illness, and off the job accident insurance, non-matching 401(k) plan, and paid vacation and sick days.
To apply please submit a detailed resume, and if qualified, our Human Resources will administer a mandatory questionnaire.

ABOUT US

Lark is the world's largest A.I. healthcare provider, servicing more than a million patients suffering from, or at risk of, chronic disease with A.I. Nurses. We're on a mission to improve people's health and happiness through our digital health coach. We are the only A.I. nurse ever to become fully medically reimbursed to 100% replace a live nurse because we achieved equivalent health outcomes to live healthcare professionals - which allows for infinitely scalable healthcare. Since launch, Lark has continued to receive awards and accolades for both our product, and our leadership, including:


Apple's Top 10 Apps in the World
Business Insider's most innovative companies in the world along with Uber and Snapchat
A CEO who was recognized as the #1 in Top 10 Women in Tech to Watch by Inc.
CDC recognition of our Diabetes Prevention Program.

Duties and Responsibilities

What You'll Do:

Lead a team of developers to build a world-class microservices architecture to help the Lark product scale
Coordinate the team's efforts in core development using the agile methodology
Work closely with leadership to plan and manage a sustainable release cycle
Manage a team responsible for the core backend services for Lark, which include our conversation engine, accounts management, SSO, ...
Coordinate with Data and Business teams as needed
Recruit, mentor and grow team members
Build a culture of engineering best practices

Knowledge and Skills

What You'll Need:

Java / Javascript / Node.js required
Spring Boot/Hibernate nice-to-have
Experience with microservice architecture
Experience with AWS
Experience with Kubernetes a very big plus
Experience with both SQL and NoSQL technologies, when to use what
Familiarity with Test Driven Development a big plus
Knowledge of SSO practices and OAuth workflows a plus
Comfortable moving quickly and learning new technologies to use daily
Religious about writing maintainable and performant code
Passionate about Lark's mission in the health/wellness space

Credentials and Experience


Experience leading a team of Engineers through various stages of product development, with a prior focus on scaling consumer-facing applications.
Minimum of 10+ years of experience in software development
5+ years of experience leading a team
Experience scaling backend services to millions of users.

We are using NLP to process millions of meals, and accelerometer data to compute activity and sleep amounts from users' phones. Our chat AI is the most sophisticated digital health engagement tool in the world. Join us and make it even better!

Job Description:
Program Manager

Who are we?

SDL is the global leader and innovator in language and content management technology and services. We enable companies to create meaningful digital journeys and form important emotional connections with their global customers by powering the creation, translation and delivery of relevant, personalized content to make understanding possible. We are a dynamic, collaborative and globally diverse team, working together to completely transform how the world communicates and connects with one another through content. If you like making an impact, helping others, taking a fresh look at processes and tools, furthering an open an innovative culture and tend to generally look at even the smallest task in the context of how it impacts the overall organization – we should talk!

What is this role?

SDL Research is currently looking to hire a Program Manager to join our organization and help us evolve our proven record of Machine Translation innovation and success in delivering cutting edge Linguistic Artificial Intelligence technology to our valued customers.

In this role you will be responsible for planning, driving, coordinating and monitoring programs and activities throughout the program management lifecycle in order to support our organization's strategic short term objectives. You will also be tasked with managing and measuring progress and performance towards achieving long term company goals.

The perfect candidate is a service-minded self-starter with excellent organization, communication and adaptability skills that is experienced in project and program management, can collaborate with multiple teams and managers simultaneously and has an affinity for process and team productivity improvement.

Responsibilities:
Plan, implement and monitor programs in accordance with the mission, strategy and goals of the organization

Develop program status and success assessment protocols for evaluation and continuous improvement

Oversee multiple research and development team activities, ensuring program objectives are met in alignment with customer satisfaction, high quality standards and high team performance

Manage and analyze program risks and dependencies

Organize and facilitate stakeholder sync-ups to ensure communication regarding program progress and impediments is seamless and transparent

Support research and development teams and activities to guarantee a cadenced delivery schedule for services and new products versions

Manage and monitor program scope changes and interventions to ensure program objectives are not compromised

Manage and monitor customer escalations to guarantee appropriate prioritization and resolution

Produce accurate and timely reporting of program stats throughout its lifecycle to ensure accurate record keeping and optimize decision making processes

Requirements:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree

2+ years of experiencing in project and/or program management

Excellent communication skills (oral and written)

Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, Outlook and SharePoint

Understanding of Agile frameworks and experience with Agile project management software

Bachelor’s degree or master degree in the field of operations, linguistics or strategy

Preferred Qualifications:
Understanding of NLP (Natural Language Processing) principles and hands-on experience with machine translation

Experience with creation and implementation of scaled processes and operations

Proven stakeholder management skills

Ability to analyze data and present metrics in order to facilitate decision making

High attention to detail and excellent ability to accommodate competing priorities in a fast-paced working environment

Ability to thrive and constantly perform while working to facilitate, support and monitor research and development efforts

Benefits:
Amazing benefits. (Seriously!)

Infinite training, professional development and personal growth opportunities.

The rare opportunity to impact how organizations communicate globally. There’s a reason we work with 90 of the top 100 brands.

Smart, engaged co-workers, a culture of diversity, innovation and opportunity.

Relaxed, fun environment with a game room, in house happy hours and many great office events throughout the year.

Great work life balance with 5 weeks of PTO and 40 hours of volunteer time per year!

SDL is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will be evaluated for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran, and disability status. For more information about EEO/AAP legislation please visit http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf .

Software and Services for Human Understanding

The Challenge:
Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open up new opportunities. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors — from fraud detection, to cancer research, to national intelligence — you know the answers are in the data.
We have an opportunity for you to use your leadership and analytical skills to improve strategic innovation for the federal government. You’ll work closely with your customer to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environment to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You’ll mentor teammates, develop algorithms, write scripts, build predictive analytics, apply machine learning, and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn that set of disparate data points into objective answers to help federal health organizations make informed decisions. You’ll provide your customer with a deep understanding of their data, what it all means, and how they can use it. Join us as we use data science for good in the federal government.
Empower change with us.
You Have:
5+ years of experience with machine learning, data science, or data engineering
2+ years of experience with natural language processing (NLP) model or deep learning (DL) model building
Experience with scripting languages, including Python and ProgR, and using packages used in machine learning applications or advanced data analytics
Ability to lead teams of data scientists and technical consultants in project based areas
Ability to articulate workflows and explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences
TS/SCI clearance
MA or MS degree
Nice If You Have:
Experience with a wide variety of machine learning tools, including Elsticsearch, Keras, TensorFlow, and Caffee
Experience with extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes and tools
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.
Build Your Career:
At Booz Allen, we know the power of analytics and we’re dedicated to helping you grow as a data analysis professional. When you join Booz Allen, you can expect:
access to online and onsite training in data analysis and presentation methodologies, and tools like Hortonworks, Docker, Tableau, and Splunk
a chance to change the world with the Data Science Bowl—the world’s premier data science for social good competition
participation in partnerships with data science leaders, like our partnership with NVIDIA to deliver Deep Learning Institute (DLI) training to the federal government
You’ll have access to a wealth of training resources through our Analytics University, an online learning portal specifically geared towards data science and analytics skills, where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and state-of-the-art tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications? Take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site bootcamps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want, as you chart your own course for success.
We’re an EOE that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change.

Our Firm
American Century Investments® is a leading global asset manager with over 60 years of experience helping investors achieve their financial goals. Serving a broad client base including financial advisors, institutions and individual investors, we offer a wide range of investment strategies across a variety of investment disciplines.
Privately controlled and independent, we focus solely on investment management. This empowers us to align our decisions with client expectations and concentrate on their long-term money management needs.
We are committed to providing institutional-quality, actively managed solutions with a performance-centered mindset. Our expertise spans global growth equity, global value equity, disciplined equity, multi-asset strategies, global fixed income, alternatives and ETFs.
Our culture of winning behaviors exemplifies our dedication to clients every single day. Delivering investment results enables us to distribute over 40% of our dividends—or more than $1.5 billion since 2000—to the Stowers Institute for Medical Research, a 550-person, non-profit biomedical research organization with a controlling interest in American Century Investments. Our dividend payments provide ongoing financial support for the Institute’s work of uncovering the causes, treatments and prevention of life-threatening diseases, like cancer.
Headquartered in Kansas City, MO, we also have offices located in New York; London; Hong Kong; Sydney; El Segundo, CA (Los Angeles area); and Mountain View, CA (Silicon Valley).
For more information, please visit americancentury.com.
Role Summary:
The Head of Investment Operations Technology leads the technology for investment operations, fund administration, financial reporting, tax and post trade lifecycle capabilities for the firm. We are undertaking a significant transformation of our Investments technology capabilities, and this person will be a key leader supporting this transformation journey!
We have multiple, intricate sets of systems supporting investment operations, middle office and fund administration and have built and embedded custom IP within them over the years. These systems help us maintain a competitive advantage. We need to retrain and enhance them while modernizing our technology estate!
This is a key leadership role, responsible for inspiring and leading technology teams and working with key business partners. They will lead technology efforts in alignment with the firm’s strategy.
Specific areas of importance include automated reconciliations maximizing AI/ML capabilities, centralized management of sophisticated workflows, driving towards 100% automated straight thru processing. The Director of Investment Operations Technology will drive enterprise design and development. They will focus on digital transformation using AI, ML and Blockchain; data engineering and data analytics.
What you will do:
Create a roadmap for modernization of investment operations technology in the firm, using current technologies and design patterns.
Modernize the deployment of microservices-based architecture, cloud technologies, artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies.
Provide inspirational leadership and management to build strong application development teams.
Provide technology leadership and advice to business partners on architecture, capabilities, projects, opportunities and problems.
Participate in enterprise prioritization process to represent the business needs and gain consensus for allocation of resources to complete the work.
Offer thought leadership to the firm by fostering standard methodologies, owning the organization vision, reference architecture and in strategy formulation etc.
Lead technology delivery, plan and lead staffing requirements, scheduling and projects in an agile environment.
Review performance, quality, budget, organization and standards of the development team efforts.
Participate on the Application Development leadership team.
Influence strategic direction and architecture for the Application Development organization and ensure all tactics are in support of the long-term strategy.
Improve the efficiency, cost-effectiveness and quality of the Information Technology department and business area.
Ensure accountability of management of security, compliance and audit requirements for all systems, including information security related projects or requests.
Required Skills/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree preferably in Computer Science, MBA is an added plus
15+ years of experience with significant leadership and supervisory tenure, preferably in buy side firms.
Experience in building and deploying operational systems to support a portfolio’s lifecycle.
Experience with leading Fund Administration systems, Middle Office systems, Tax and reporting systems, like SimCorp, Eagle, FIS, Omgeo etc. will be helpful.
A strong expertise in Investment Operations architectures including trade lifecycle, custody operations, cash management, corporate actions, vendor oversight and investment data.
Significant experience operating in financial services, with preference for buy-side (asset management, investment manager, hedge fund, mutual fund) experience.
Working understanding of the entire value chain of investment management including research, portfolio construction, portfolio management, risk management, investments analytics etc.
Cross asset class knowledge –Equities, Fixed Income, Alternatives and Multi-Asset flows.
Outstanding interpersonal skills including the ability to interact with individuals at all levels of the organization in both verbal and written form.
Solid technical knowledge including expertise in Cloud platforms (AWS preferred), microservices architecture, enterprise integration design patterns, and current data engineering practices.
Solid understanding of artificial intelligence and machine learning with applicability in financial services is a big plus.
Inspirational people leader, who can serve as a role model, to build and lead an Information Technology team.
Strong enterprise level project management and vendor relationship skills.

We are looking for a senior product manager to define and own the product vision and roadmap for our artificial intelligence and machine learning product team, offering products that exploit and extract insights on critical customer data. As a senior product manager at Rebellion, you will be responsible for a key part of a rapidly growing portfolio of products, working to rally Rebellion design and engineering teams to deliver on the vision you’ve charted. You will work with Rebellion’s customers and prospective customers, senior DoD/intelligence community and MoD civilian and military leadership to understand the core customer needs and bring a product to market.

This position is located in Washington, D.C., and involves some travel. Relocation packages are available for candidates and their families. Ability to hold a Top Secret security clearance (without polygraph) is preferred, but not required.
We look for a track record of the following:
Delivering software-as-a-service products that scale to large enterprises or consumer bases
Working with software engineers with diverse expertise to deliver a superior product to an end user
Balancing customer needs with engineering constraints
Thorough understanding of product management, engineering, design, and sales functions of the business
Defining and exceeding success metrics with the products you build
Inspirational leadership — the ability to coalesce many groups of stakeholders around a common goal without direct authority
Working with users and shipping products in highly regulated industries or otherwise constrained environments (e.g., government, healthcare, national security, industrial systems design)
Managing senior customer stakeholders with decades of experience in their field
Communicating effectively across diverse technical and non-technical audiences, internally and externally
Establishing clear product-market fit, understanding the core customer need, and breaking this into priorities for design and engineering teams
Experience bringing artificial intelligence, machine learning, or computer vision products to market (preferred)
At least 8 years of experience in product management or product design
You might be a good fit if you:
have a passion for getting to know the user and protecting the United States, UK, and its allies from adversaries
are self-directed and can prioritize experiences that will provide the most immediate value for the customer
are capable of rapid iteration and comfortable with ambiguity in initial problem definition
Your work will matter because:

As a senior product manager in the artificial intelligence/machine learning portfolio, your work will drive our strategic product and technology vision for products running scaled ML models for media exploitation (imagery, full-motion video, text). You will own the team's products, existing or new, from ideation through development to launch, growth, and expansion.

Rebellion is a well-capitalized technology start-up seeking a talented senior product manager who is passionate about defining and delivering modern, life-changing software products to the US Department of Defense (DoD), the UK Ministry of Defence (MoD), and their allies. Expect talented, motivated, intense, and interesting co-workers. Compensation includes full medical coverage and meaningful equity ownership.

The Service Delivery Manager (SDM) will manage all service delivery-related processes and the delivery of projects. The SDM will be the service owner for all end user and customer-facing IT services and solutions and will ensure end-to-end delivery of services. The SDM will be responsible for improving, optimizing, standardizing, and streamlining customer support processes that yield improvements to the customer experience.
The SDM will be responsible for leading large-scale IT service delivery with an emphasis on best practices to transition to easier-to-use, self-help formats of delivery which reduce the frequency and quantity of human interaction. The SDM is responsible for overall coordination, status reporting, and stability of project oriented work efforts. The SDM establishes and implements project management processes and methodologies for the IT community to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, adhere to high quality standards and meet customer expectations.
Responsibilities and Duties:
Manage daily operations of 24/7 IT Service Desk and desk side support CONUS and OCONUS.
Monitor and manage incident and request tickets for content, proper routing, first call resolution, problem detection, and timely closure.
Identify, recommend and implement approved automation, artificial intelligence and tier 0 capabilities
Ensure all operational processes and procedures are clearly documented and maintained.
Participate in change management and disaster recovery processes.
Manage and communicate high severity issues through resolution, providing accurate and timely status reports to management.
Manage delivery of services and resources to meet or exceed service level agreements and key performance indicators
Provide leadership for the team to identify and implement opportunities for service enhancements
Meet with clients to gain feedback on team performance and take action to address gaps, if any.
Mitigate risks, controls costs and schedule variance, and effectively manages large scale, integrated projects.
Meet budgetary objectives and make adjustments to project constraints based on financial analysis
Work with the team to develop comprehensive project plans to be shared with clients as well as other staff members
Ensure efficient delivery of contract capabilities using industry standards and repeatable processes including an ITIL framework.
Manage and oversee subcontractors, as well as full time employees. Direct the work of employees assigned to the program from technical and administrative areas.
Assemble project plans and teamwork assignments, directing and monitoring work efforts on a daily basis, identifying resource needs, performing quality reviews; and escalating functional, quality, cost, timeline risks and issues appropriately.
Track key project milestones and adjust project plans and/or resources to meet the needs of customers.
Coordinate communication with all areas of the enterprise that impact scope, budget, risk and resources of the work effort being managed.
Manage human resources and staffing functions to ensure project performance is exemplary (e.g., hiring, performance management).
Serve as the service owner for all end user and customer facing IT Services
Required Qualifications:
A minimum of five years of technical experience managing, maturing, and modernizing service delivery for remote and geographically dispersed users with end-to-end service delivery with a large number of locations (500+ CONUS and OCONUS desired)
Recent (within the last five years) experience with implementing SLAs and performance metrics on a contract with a large number of locations (500+ CONUS and OCONUS desired)
Experience in promoting and institutionalizing the utilization of AI (e.g., virtual agents) to drive continuous improvement in business value and customer experience.
Certified ITIL 4 Managing Professional or Strategic Leader
Desired Qualifications:
Recent experience implementing, managing, and modernizing successful self-help/self-heal services.
Help Desk Institute Support Center Manager (HDI-SCM) Certification.
Active Project Management Institute (PMI) Project Management Professional (PMP) or Program Management Professional (PgMP) certification.
Experience with facilitating/coordinating cross-functional teams to develop, deliver, operationalize, document, and support solutions.
Recent experience with developing and managing a customer-focused continuous improvement program.
Travel
Up to 25% travel may be required

Strong or expert knowledge of several disciplines is a must, including Search Engine Marketing, Paid Digital Advertising, Social Media Marketing, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Website and Landing Page Development, Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO). Evidence of thought leadership within the industry is essential.This role is for a seasoned business leader who understands how agencies work, in addition to having a broad understanding of various B2B and B2C business models employed by our clients, including revenue/cost structures. This is a doer/management position that includes both executing development and management of paid digital advertising programs, as well as overseeing day-to-day activities of employees and contractors, so a proven ability to deliver results through others is a must. In addition to managing a handful of clients yourself, you would hire, train, coach and monitor day-to-day activities and prepare employees for their next opportunities. As a manager and a leader of our organization, you are expected to demonstrate a continual growth in your knowledge and skills so as to enlarge DirectiveGroup’s position as a thought leader. Additionally, you would help lead all DirectiveGroup employees to grow our company by writing articles for internal and external blogs, making content updates to our corporate website, writing proposals and preparing presentations, speaking at conferences and seminars, networking and referring new clients, etc.To do well in this role, you will require:Expert knowledge in paid digital advertising, including all aspects of attaining strong performance, as well as sufficient knowledge about other digital marketing tactics.Strong capabilities in people management, from identification of appropriate resources, to hiring, coaching and managing, so as to attain strong performance and a high retention rate.Strong client relationship management and outstanding representation of company and industry in small settings and large venues, including fostering an industry-leading POV.Strong organizational leadership and culture-building capabilities that facilitate a high performing team built on the principles of excellence and mutual support to attain outstanding, industry-leading performance.Strong capabilities in project management, process management and all internal administrative processes that underlie a consistently strong performance.A significant plus would be very deep hands-on digital experience, previous agency ownership experience, a broad and well-seasoned business background and top tier consulting background. For such a candidate, there is a medium-term partnership opportunity with an earned equity share.You would be setting the cultural tone with this role. We are a virtual company, so you’d be joining a team self-starters that are very disciplined and organized. Our positions are fast-paced, so the ability to multi-task and self-manage is of crucial importance. We ask for a lot from our team, but for these hardy souls, we offer some degree of flexibility in hours, dependent primarily on the needs of assigned clients. In addition, we seek to build an environment of learning that includes ‘fast failing’ to get to the top faster and a mutually supportive space for trying new things with a proper risk-mitigation mindset that fosters application of thoughtful solutions vs reckless behavior.After one year of service, all employees are encouraged to dedicate up to five percent of their time to assist non-profits that meet our company criteria. Senior Product Manager Oracle Integration (OIC)-20000EI1


No Visa Sponsorship is available for this position.

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English

Preferred Qualifications


Oracle Integration (OIC) is a global, market leader in the iPaaS and integration space making Enterprises - Fortune 100, Startups, Governments and everyone in between - successful with a robust and productive integration platform. Learn more about us here: https://cloud.oracle.com/integration
We are hiring a senior-level Product Manager in our exciting product portfolio. This position requires a talented, open-minded person who can act as a thought leader for the team to help drive our product strategy forward. You will have an innovative mindset with a laser focus on the market. In this role you will be the bridge between business, technical and design, working cross-functionally to drive our product capabilities from ideation to launch and beyond. You will have strong user focus and empathy with which you will bring in and prioritize requirements, use cases, develop and orchestrate product messaging/positioning while focusing on internal and external day-to-day activities.
You will work with a talented group of product managers, engineers, UX designers, marketers, sales teams, partners and more. Technical depth and previous hands on experience is strongly desired (preferably in Integration technologies but not mandatory). Familiarity with on-premises as well as multi-tenant cloud architectures, security, user interface, agile development methodologies is a plus. We also prefer you have experience in Application Integration for Oracle and/or third-party Cloud/On-premises applications as well as the emerging Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) space applied to Integration. Your experience should translate quickly into the evolving differentiation of these capabilities within Oracle’s Integration Portfolio.
You would also have a comprehensive understanding of the iPaaS competitive landscape and market business value, as this is key to elaborating and crafting product direction, internal and external communication, prioritization and effective evolution of the product strategy.
Preferred Qualifications·
5+ years’ experience in technology product management
Proven track record of successful software product delivery
Strong understanding of enterprise software and cloud computing with practical and deep hands-on experience in iPaaS, SaaS and/or SOA products
Strong understanding and/or practical experience with AI/ML technologies and trends
Strong understanding of integrating with complex enterprise applications and integration frameworks/interfaces
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work with a geographically distributed team
An MBA is a plus

This is a great opportunity for someone who has an entrepreneurial mindset and wants to own a product to be the best in the market working in an agile, fast-paced team at an enterprise software industry leader, with plenty of opportunities for personal and professional growth.
Come join us help shape the future of iPaaS and have fun doing it working with the best in the industry. If this sounds interesting, we look forward to hear from you!


Detailed Description and Job Requirements

Lead a team that acts as the central resource and driving force for the design, process, manufacturing, test, quality and marketing of product(s) as they move from conception to distribution. Organize interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/product on schedule and within budget.

As a member of the product development division, you will analyze and integrate external customer specifications. Suggest and justify product directions and specifications. Specify, design and implement moderate changes to existing software architecture. Build new products and development tools. Build and execute unit tests and unit test plans. Review integration and regression test plans created by QA. Communicate with QA and porting engineering to discuss major changes to functionality.

Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 7 years of software engineering or related experience.

Oracle is an Affirmative Action-Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Director Paid Digital Advertising Position Description [Virtual/Job Share]Position OverviewThe Director Paid Digital Advertising holds a key position in our service delivery group as it relates to paid advertising. Strong or expert knowledge of several disciplines is a must, including Search Engine Marketing, Paid Digital Advertising, Social Media Marketing, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Website and Landing Page Development, Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO). Demonstrated thought leadership within the industry is essential.This role is for a seasoned business leader who understands how agencies work, in addition to having a broad understanding of various B2B and B2C business models employed by our clients, including revenue/cost structures. This is a doer/management position that includes both executing development and management of paid digital advertising programs, as well as overseeing day-to-day activities of employees and contractors, so a proven ability to deliver results through others is a must. In addition to managing a handful of clients yourself, you would hire, train, coach and monitor day-to-day activities and prepare employees for their next opportunities. As a manager and a leader of our organization, you are expected to demonstrate a continual growth in your knowledge and skills so as to enlarge DirectiveGroup’s industry authority position. Demonstrated thought leadership in digital marketing would be a plus, as you would help lead all DirectiveGroup employees to grow our company by writing articles for internal and external blogs, speaking at conferences and seminars, making content updates to our corporate website, writing proposals and preparing presentations, networking and referring new clients, etc.To do well in this role, you will require:Expert knowledge in paid digital advertising, including all aspects of attaining strong performance, as well as sufficient knowledge about other digital marketing tactics.Strong capabilities in people management, from identification of appropriate resources, to hiring, coaching and managing, so as to attain strong performance and a high retention rate.Strong client relationship management and outstanding representation of company and industry in small settings and large venues, including fostering an industry-leading POV.Strong organizational leadership and culture-building capabilities that facilitate a high performing team built on the principles of excellence and mutual support to attain outstanding, industry-leading performance.Strong capabilities in project management, process management and all internal administrative processes that underlie a consistently strong performance.A significant plus would be very deep hands-on digital experience, previous agency ownership experience, a broad and well-seasoned business background and top tier consulting background. For such a candidate, there is a medium-term partnership opportunity with an earned equity share.You would be setting the cultural tone with this role. We are a virtual company, so you’d be joining a team self-starters that are very disciplined and organized. Our positions are fast-paced, so the ability to multi-task and self-manage is of crucial importance. We ask for a lot from our team, but for these hardy souls, we offer some degree of flexibility in hours, dependent primarily on the needs of assigned clients. In addition, we seek to build an environment of learning that includes ‘fast failing’ to get to the top faster and a mutually supportive space for trying new things with a proper risk-mitigation mindset that fosters application of thoughtful solutions vs reckless behavior.After one year of service, all employees are encouraged to dedicate up to five percent of their time to assist non-profits that meet our company criteria. All employees are required to possess a computer with the latest version of MS Windows OS & MS Office Productivity Suite, as well as sufficient internet capacity for a VoIP phone.Compensation: $75K - $90K annually FT (50-60 hrs), including performance bonus, based on skills and experience. Accenture Consulting: Your Unique Place in our Global Collective

Being part of Accenture Consulting means becoming an expert at making the New happen Now. To us, the New is all about the wise pivot that turns constant disruption to continuous reinvention. We are an innovation led-company that works at the heart of our clients’ organizations so that no matter how complex the business challenge, we face the future with confidence.

If you love solving challenges and not just studying them, then Accenture Consulting is the right place for you. Join us to develop your ideas into provocative points of view and transformative insights that help shape industries. You’ll work with an amazing and diverse mix of world-class experts with access to one of the most robust portfolios of capabilities and ecosystem relationships in the industry. Together, you’ll do so much more than consult.

Coming here means future-proofing your career and going as far as your ambition takes you. Becoming a tech-savvy, well-rounded, multi-disciplined and market-relevant advisor doesn’t happen by chance. We invest in training and development in a big way, so you can build your future along with ours, creating an impactful career unique to you. Ultimately, we believe we is greater than me and that diverse perspectives lead to the best solutions. Joining Accenture Consulting means you will learn, innovate and lead, and together we will improve the way the world works and lives.

Do you want to work where scientific innovation meets leading-edge technology? Join Accenture Scientific Informatics Services and help our clients apply digital technologies to revolutionize scientific and laboratory processes.

Accenture Scientific Informatics Services (ASIS) combines the scientific and laboratory informatics expertise with Accenture’s strategic and business consulting capabilities, industry platforms, innovation approach and global scale to help transform how scientific and laboratory processes are conducted across a variety of industries—helping make them faster, more efficient and more effective than ever before.

Leveraging digital technologies such as automation, artificial intelligence, Internet of Things, analytics and cloud, in combination with a fundamental redesign of the scientific user experience, Accenture Scientific Informatics Services helps organizations better capture, manage, integrate and analyze complex scientific data. This can improve the discovery and manufacturing of new products, improve quality, ensure compliance, reduce time to market and improve operational efficiency.

As an Accenture Scientific Informatics Services (ASIS) Consultant you will be exposed to the technologies and processes that many leading US companies and government agencies utilize. We offer a generous compensation package consisting of salary, bonuses and benefits.

Job Description – Project Manager
Essential Duties and Job Functions:
Overall accountability for the resources and activities within medium to large size projects for LIMS or other lab systems implementation
Ensure workstream coordination and cooperation
Determine and implement appropriate change management processes for the project
Drive risk management activities and processes
Overall responsibility for the creation and ongoing management of the project schedule
Perform stakeholder identification, management and communication activities
Perform scope identification, decomposition and verification activities
Ensure appropriate quality processes are in place and being followed
Monitor and control the project budget including services and expenses
Overall responsibility for effective communication processes, meetings and activities within the project
Act as escalation point for issues that arise from workstreams
Provide feedback to management regarding employee performance
Proactively coach project resources to increase their effectiveness
Demonstrate business and political savvy when interacting with client organizations
Ensure the scope of the project is documented and understood by all stakeholders
Proactively control costs and expenses within the project and determine ways of reducing the project costs while ensuring quality and scope objectives are met
Schedule meetings, document meeting notes and distribute meeting notes to invitees
Collect and monitor progress on project activities from resources
Maintain excellent client relationships

Minimum Qualifications:

4 Year degree in an applicable field
2 Years of experience leading small to medium size Laboratory Informatics projects
2 Years of experience working in regulated environments
2 Years of experience implementing enterprise laboratory information management systems (LIMS, ELN)
2 years of experience implementing technology under a defined corporate and compliant methodology
Preferred Qualifications:

Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Excellent organizational skills
Advanced level knowledge of Microsoft Project
Advanced leadership skills
3 Years of consulting experience
Expert understanding of computer and application architecture, technology, and validation
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Project Management Professional PMP certification
Advanced degree in a related field
Superior consulting skills
Expert negotiation skills


Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.

Accenture is a Federal Contractor and an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity

All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.

Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

The San Diego Supercomputer Center (SDSC) is a world leader in using, innovating and providing cyberinfrastructure (CI) to enable advances and new discovery in science and engineering. Focusing on data-oriented and computational science and engineering applications, SDSC serves as an international resource for data cyberinfrastructure through the provision of software, hardware and human resources in multi-disciplinary science and engineering, and serves as a leadership national cyberinfrastructure Center to the National Science Foundation (NSF) and broader community.
The WIFIRE Lab develops integrated systems for natural hazards monitoring, simulation, and response. The Lab’s mission is to conduct research and development towards infrastructure, services and tools for artificial intelligence integrated fire science. It is a consortium of UC San Diego organizations and a number of partnerships including the university collaborators, industry partners, fire departments, utilities, State’s CalOES and CPUC. Although the WIFIRE Cyberinfrastructure is built with a primary goal of enhancing fire science, it has developed an operational branch to deploy WIFIRE research to emergency response and public situational awareness settings. To meet growing needs in hazards monitoring and response, the WIFIRE Lab aims to be an all hazards knowledge cyberinfrastructure, becoming a management layer from the data collection to modeling efforts. The Lab adds value to the raw data and prepare the best data in real-time for any monitoring and modeling effort (along with our own dynamic data-driven models) for research and operational use.
The Workflows for Data Science (WorDS) Center of Excellence at SDSC offers expertise and services to support data-driven applications, data analysis projects, data scientists and software engineers in their computational practices involving process management.
The incumbent will use his/her skills as an advanced, specialized GIS professional with an in-depth understanding of the GIS field to resolve a wide range of highly complex analysis and research issues. S/he may lead or mentor a team of GIS professionals. The incumbent will be responsible for related technology systems, programs and equipment and recommend original, independent, imaginative and creative courses of action.
The Geographic Information Systems Programmer 4 will serve as the Associate Director for Operational Programs for the WIFIRE Lab and will contribute to the WorDS Center as a Senior Spatial Data Scientist specializing in GIS, remote sensing, and environmental science applications. The Associate Director for Operational Programs for the WIFIRE Lab directs the public and private operational programs in the WIFIRE Lab, and supports the Lab Director by identifying and enabling strategic research and application thrusts related to translating the research-driven products to operational use. To do this, the incumbent will leverage and continue development of partnerships and collaborations with disaster response groups and agencies in public and private sectors to identify needs for research-based applications for disaster response in practice.
The incumbent will also oversee integration of solutions for disaster response needs in operations to spatial data science infrastructure within the WIFIRE Lab, evaluate emerging technologies and industry offerings applicable to the Lab’s efforts in public/private partnerships, and manage the Lab personnel participating in the WIFIRE Lab operational programs. The incumbent will also work with the Research and Product branches of the WIFIRE Lab to identify gaps between practice and research, implement the work above, and contribute to development of a roadmap for development. The incumbent will also develop partnerships and work with other initiatives at UCSD that require problem solving using geospatial and remote sensing data (e.g., BigPixel Initiative and Study of Mothers and Infants (SOMI) ) through the WorDS Center.
For more information, please visit www.sdsc.edu.
QUALIFICATIONS
Strong demonstrated experience developing community partnerships and engagements for applying scientific research to practice. Ability to communicate technical information in a clear and concise manner.
Strong theoretical knowledge of environmental hazards and sustainability, attained through a graduate degree in a related field, or equivalent combination of experience/education.

In-depth knowledge of GIS software, applications programming, database administration, user interface and experience design and web application development. Excellent knowledge of GIS systems. Experience with open source GIS tools such as GDAL, and GIS formats including Shapefiles, GeoJSON, and GeoTIFF.

Experience with the synthesis and analysis of data for research, scientific visualization, and related public policy management issues.

Advanced demonstrated research experience with a focus on interdisciplinary and spatial data science research methods with scientific visualization using GIS and remote sensing.

SPECIAL CONDITIONS
Job offer is contingent upon satisfactory clearance based on Background Check results.

Evenings and weekends may be required.

Must have access to reliable transportation.

job_title_origin: Senior Director, Data Science Portfolio Management
job_description:
Janssen Research & Development LLC, a Johnson & Johnson company, is recruiting for a Senior Director, Portfolio Management Data Science. You will report to the Chief Operating Office of Data Science, Global Head of JRD Strategy and Operations. The primary location for this position is either New Brunswick, NJ or Spring House, PA. Consideration will be given to Raritan, NJ and Titusville, NJ.
Who We Are:
Janssen develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and Development areas encompass Oncology, Cardiovascular and Metabolic disorders, Immunology, Neuroscience, and Infectious diseases. Our ultimate goal is to help people live longer, healthier lives. We have produced and marketed many first-in-class prescription medications and are poised to serve the broad needs of the healthcare market – from patients to practitioners and from clinics to hospitals. To learn more about Janssen, one of the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, visit www.janssenpharmaceuticalsinc.com.

Lead in a highly matrixed environment with cross-functional teams of TA/functional representatives, Data Scientists, Software engineers, external partners (when needed), etc. while also providing executive visibility to the COO of DS and TA/function leads

Build and cultivate right partnerships and alliances with internal and external partners in collaboration with Business Development, Innovation Centers, etc.
Develop a deep understanding and appreciation of the partners, understand and align the problems and the value of use case with key partners

Being a Cloud Services Manager at iManage means…
You are responsible for the day to day iManage Cloud Customer Portfolio deployment planning, management including overall Cloud customer satisfaction and reference-ability. You will be accountable for Cloud customer account administration, support, and direction while ensuring day-to-day operational success. In addition, you will interface directly with and provide guidance to our Cloud customer's implementation services provider (iManage Partners), including key stakeholders such as the project manager, business sponsor, networking, and operations teams to ensure iManage Cloud onboarding success.
As a Cloud Services Manager, you will work closely with the internal iManage team such as Cloud Operations and Cloud Support to ensure continuity when a customer transitions from implementation to ongoing operations in the iManage Cloud.
iM Responsible For...
Providing day to day management of assigned cloud onboarding portfolio for project tasks and communications
Proactively managing the relationship with internal and outsourced iManage Cloud implementation partners and customers, including setting expectations regarding deliverables and schedules; ensuring that the project team members are effectively communicating and collaborating
Establishing and maintaining a business relationship with the iManage Cloud customer as well as the customer's implementation team to ensure customer satisfaction with the implementation; serving as the first line of response for customer escalations during implementation
Interfacing with internal iManage teams to ensure successful delivery of the components required for an iManage Cloud implementation including iManage CloudOpS, Networking, R&D, Pre-Sales, Sales, and Product Management.
Maintaining cloud-related customer data in appropriate systems including: Salesforce, DevOps, ZenDesk, etc.
Listening to customer and partner feedback and resolving any issues or conflicts
Assisting with developing relationships with onboarding customers/partners that promote retention and loyalty
Ensuring that new customers are referenceable 60 days after go-live for new deployments and upgrades
Learning and supporting iManage Cloud Product lines for customer onboarding
Educating iManage cloud implementation partners for cloud onboarding processes
Remaining current on technology and process changes as it relates to Cloud Services and Onboarding
Supporting department initiatives which include but not limited to projects such as documentation updates, reporting metrics, and net promoter scores
iM Qualified Because I have...
A Bachelor's Degree in Business, Business Administration, Information Management, Computer Science or the equivalent
A minimum of 3-5+ Years' experience managing software implementation projects
Project Management skills
SaaS/PaaS implementation experience
Excellent business communication, organizational and project management skills
Strong computer skills
Excellent time management and decision-making skills
Bonus Points Because I have...
A working knowledge of iManage products
Used SalesForce and ticketing systems
A team player attitude; an ability to work well independently and as part of a team
A PMP certification
About iManage
iManage combines artificial intelligence with content and email management to free, secure, and understand information. Over 3000 companies and 1 million users worldwide rely on our market-leading software to share and protect their most valuable data. Our work is not always easy but it is ambitious and rewarding.
So we're looking for people who love a challenge. People who are happiest when they're solving problems and collaborating with the industry's best and brightest. In exchange, we'll make sure the work you do here is worth doing. That's the iManage way. It's how we do things that might appear impossible. How we develop our employees' strengths and unlock their potential. It's how we find meaning in everything we do.
Whoever you are, whatever you do, however you work. Make it mean something at iManage.

Learn more at: www.imanage.com
Please see our privacy statement for more information on how we handle your personal data: https://imanage.com/privacy-policy/

The San Diego Supercomputer Center (SDSC) is a world leader in using, innovating and providing cyberinfrastructure (CI) to enable advances and new discovery in science and engineering. Focusing on data-oriented and computational science and engineering applications, SDSC serves as an international resource for data cyberinfrastructure through the provision of software, hardware and human resources in multi-disciplinary science and engineering, and serves as a leadership national cyberinfrastructure Center to the National Science Foundation (NSF) and broader community.
The WIFIRE Lab develops integrated systems for natural hazards monitoring, simulation, and response. The Lab’s mission is to conduct research and development towards infrastructure, services and tools for artificial intelligence integrated fire science. It is a consortium of UC San Diego organizations and a number of partnerships including the university collaborators, industry partners, fire departments, utilities, State’s CalOES and CPUC. Although the WIFIRE Cyberinfrastructure is built with a primary goal of enhancing fire science, it has developed an operational branch to deploy WIFIRE research to emergency response and public situational awareness settings. To meet growing needs in hazards monitoring and response, the WIFIRE Lab aims to be an all hazards knowledge cyberinfrastructure, becoming a management layer from the data collection to modeling efforts. The Lab adds value to the raw data and prepare the best data in real-time for any monitoring and modeling effort (along with our own dynamic data-driven models) for research and operational use.
The Workflows for Data Science (WorDS) Center of Excellence at SDSC offers expertise and services to support data-driven applications, data analysis projects, data scientists and software engineers in their computational practices involving process management. The incumbent will use his/her skills as an advanced, specialized GIS professional with an in-depth understanding of the GIS field to resolve a wide range of highly complex analysis and research issues. S/he may lead or mentor a team of GIS professionals. The incumbent will be responsible for related technology systems, programs and equipment and recommend original, independent, imaginative and creative courses of action.
The Geographic Information Systems Programmer 4 will serve as the Associate Director for Operational Programs for the WIFIRE Lab and will contribute to the WorDS Center as a Senior Spatial Data Scientist specializing in GIS, remote sensing, and environmental science applications. The Associate Director for Operational Programs for the WIFIRE Lab directs the public and private operational programs in the WIFIRE Lab, and supports the Lab Director by identifying and enabling strategic research and application thrusts related to translating the research-driven products to operational use. To do this, the incumbent will leverage and continue development of partnerships and collaborations with disaster response groups and agencies in public and private sectors to identify needs for research-based applications for disaster response in practice.
The incumbent will also oversee integration of solutions for disaster response needs in operations to spatial data science infrastructure within the WIFIRE Lab, evaluate emerging technologies and industry offerings applicable to the Lab’s efforts in public/private partnerships, and manage the Lab personnel participating in the WIFIRE Lab operational programs. The incumbent will also work with the Research and Product branches of the WIFIRE Lab to identify gaps between practice and research, implement the work above, and contribute to development of a roadmap for development. The incumbent will also develop partnerships and work with other initiatives at UCSD that require problem solving using geospatial and remote sensing data (e.g., BigPixel Initiative and Study of Mothers and Infants (SOMI) ) through the WorDS Center.
For more information, please visit www.sdsc.edu.
QUALIFICATIONS
Strong proven experience developing community partnerships and engagements for applying scientific research to practice. Ability to communicate technical information in a clear and concise manner.
Thorough theoretical knowledge of environmental hazards and sustainability, attained through a graduate degree in a related field, or equivalent combination of experience/education.

In-depth knowledge of GIS software, applications programming, database administration, user interface and experience design and web application development. Superb knowledge of GIS systems. Experience with open source GIS tools such as GDAL, and GIS formats including Shapefiles, GeoJSON, and GeoTIFF.

Demonstrated experience with the synthesis and analysis of data for research, scientific visualization, and related public policy management issues.

Advanced demonstrated research experience with a focus on interdisciplinary and spatial data science research methods with scientific visualization using GIS and remote sensing.

SPECIAL CONDITIONS
Job offer is contingent upon a satisfactory clearance based on background check results.

Evenings and weekends may be required.

Must have access to reliable transportation.
