Experience from Pharma industry is a plus.
For the right candidate, there are opportunities to for career progression both within the Data Provisioning team, within the Data Office and more widely within AstraZeneca.
Next Steps – Apply Now!

Would you like to be a part of a Data Science & Artificial Intelligence (DS&AI) group who has direct strategic impact on drug development, playing a key role in getting medicines to patients?
At AstraZeneca, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines, with a real passion for discovery and a pipeline to show for it. Here, you’ll have the chance to create a difference in people’s lives every single day.
AstraZeneca is investing heavily in data management and analysis capabilities, through its long-term Growth Through Innovation Strategy. The DS&AI team collaborates across R&D to drive innovation through data science and AI. Together we seek to:
Improve our understanding of disease and uncovering new targets
Transform R&D processes
Speed the design and delivery of new medicines for patients
The R&D Data Office, within DS&AI, is a key organisation to deliver upon AstraZeneca’s strategy. Data Office operates a central capability, with R&D wide accountability, to ensure that we harness the power of data to drive innovative science. Data Office will govern data, drive data quality and ensure our data is readied for analytics, crafting paved-paths for scientists to perform data-driven research, without compromising our legal restrictions or ethical principles.
Within Data Office, your role is Senior Data Provisioning Lead, a member of a dedicated Data Provisioning Operations team. You will lead end-to-end activities associated to Data Provisioning including: Liaising with both external collaboration partners and key internal partners; taking on leadership of high-priority and multifaceted data provisioning projects, performing risk assessment associated to data-sharing, with emphasis on AstraZeneca’s four sharing principles – business sensitivity, legal rights, ethical and scientific merit; and leading cross-team activities to achieve delivery outcomes. Crucially, your role will drive the maintenance and improvement of the four sharing principles to make data available for re-use within or outside AstraZeneca.
To be successful in this role you must have excellent critical thinking skills, the ability to handle multifaceted, cross-functional projects, and be able to communicate with partners from different experience levels and cultures. Overall, you will drive data provisioning activities to enable data science that will directly support the scientific research required to get new medicines to our patients.
Tasks and responsibilities
Build strong working relationships within AstraZeneca and with external collaborators in-line with AstraZeneca ethical business policy
Successful end-to-end management (planning, execution and closure) of high-priority and complex data provisioning projects
Coordinate data provisioning requests and associated information from cross-functional areas
Responsible for tracking progress of requests and project activities, ensure relevant information is collected at each stage and responsible for keeping each request running smoothly
Acting as a central coordinator for projects requiring cross-functional activities, including arranging, hosting and minuting meetings, coordinating actions to-time and to-task
Monitor request and project progress, to handle and seek mitigation for any issues that might arise
Manage interface between AstraZeneca collaboration partner(s) to clarify data requirements, proactively identify, mitigate and manage risks that may impact any partners
Work with the Data Provisioning team and other partners to identify and eliminate blockers
Ensure data sharing standards and requirements are met
Use tools to monitor and report on progress of requests and projects
Support the Data Provisioning team in considering ways to improve project and data provisioning processes and ultimately value to our customers
Minimum requirements
Proven work experience in a project management role
Must have a high level of attention to detail
Ability to employ professional judgement and analytical skills to manage complexity uncertainty, project risks, stakeholder expectations and project timelines
Must be self-motivated, goal-oriented, and able to demonstrate excellent customer service skills at all times
Flexible with creative thinking skills
Excellent multi-tasking and time-management skills
Strong communication, negotiation and teamwork skills
Strong analytical skills
BSc in Business Administration, related field, or equivalent professional experience
Leadership Core Capabilities: Influencing, innovation, business awareness
Preferred experience and key factors
Industry-recognised Project Management certification highly desirable
Experience from Pharma industry is significant advantage
Experience in a data management role a significant advantage
For the right candidate, there are opportunities to for career progression both within the Data Provisioning team, within the Data Office and more widely within AstraZeneca.
Next Steps – Apply Now

Emerging and future digital technologies and the opportunities they offer will profoundly improve the lives of those furthest behind. Recognizing this potential, the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) has launched an organization-wide digital transformation that will splice digital into its DNA—harnessing its potential to do good for more people, better and faster. UNDP’s 2019-2021 Digital Strategy has created a new UNDP Digital Unit, charged with leading the next wave of innovation in sustainable development.
UNDP is the development arm of the United Nations. Present in 170 countries with over 17,000 people, UNDP works on the world’s biggest problems: extreme poverty, climate change, good governance, renewable energy, crisis prevention, and women’s empowerment, among others.
We are leveraging the power and agility of digital to propel all people forward, starting with digital initiative development, scaling innovation, and communicating this organizational change internally and externally. To achieve this, we need a team that's nimble, that's passionate, that has the technical skills required to help close the digital divide. Are you one of these people? Read more about our digital strategy here.
To bring digital around the globe, we need someone who can work directly with digital innovations that show a high potential for global impact to make them successful.
The position of the Digital Innovation & Scaling lead will be part of the team under Chief Digital Officer and report to the Chief Digital Officer.


Duties and Responsibilities


The Digital Innovation & Scaling Lead is responsible for the following:
Supporting digital innovation and impact at scale
Identify, develop and test digital innovations globally within UNDP, leveraging ideas generated by Accelerator Labs and other innovation stakeholders
Assess use cases and internal processes in order to identify innovation opportunities aligned with UNDP digital strategy.
Coach teams working on innovations during ideation and product design
Advise teams working on innovations on key decisions regarding product features and technology options
Provide project management support, including supporting the development of innovative solutions
Support product testing and improvements as required
Source innovations in collaboration with relevant business units and needs.
Connect stakeholders as necessary across UNDP involved in digital innovation (Country Offices, Regional Bureaux, Accelerator Labs, etc)
Lead the development and implementation of scale up and scale out strategies within UNDP and partner agencies
Manage and coordinate digital and innovation support services
Support the growth, management and delivery of a global digital response service for UNDP.
Develop and coordinate team(s) to provide appropriate digital capacity.
Balance competing demands and priorities to ensure alignment with broader agreed visions.
Structure and manage requests for support.
Innovation Portfolio Management
Actively employ a portfolio management approach to ensure that the innovation pipeline, inclusive of emerging (“fuzzy front end”) technology, supports and responds to SDG and UNDP digital strategy
Align innovation pipeline and portfolio with strategy and ensure sufficiency of plans to deliver strategic targets and goals. (e.g. Early Strategic Alignment review of new digital initiatives)
Support innovation scaling by working to expand existing and future digital initiatives throughout UNDP region, countries and partners.
Interact and collaborate effectively with relevant UNDP partners and agencies.
Dynamically evolve portfolio strategy and manage portfolio performance to changing needs of diverse stakeholders within the UNDP and UN eco-system.
Staff and Leadership Development in Innovation
Provide advice and support for digital innovators across UNDP in frontier technologies and digital innovation processes
As part of the digital team, work to create conditions for a culture of innovation and strengthen this competency amongst UNDP stakeholders (Bureaux / Country Offices)
Support with specific innovation and digital partnerships and collaborations with solution providers.
Innovation Tracking, KPI management
Define key performance indicators and milestones for individual initiatives, the portfolio and team performance.
Monitor impact measures and adjust initiatives accordingly.


Competencies


Core
Innovation
Ability to make new and useful ideas work Level 5: Creates new and relevant ideas and leads others to implement them
Leadership
Ability to persuade others to follow Level 5: Plans and acts transparently, actively works to remove barriers
People Management
Ability to improve performance and satisfaction Level 5: Models high professional standards and motivates excellence in others
Communication
Ability to listen, adapt, persuade and transform Level 5: Gains trust of peers, partners, clients by presenting complex concepts in practical terms to others
Delivery
Ability to get things done while exercising good judgement
Technical/FunctionalExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to build strong and sustainable relationships and capability to interact at all levels within the organization.Ability to deliver in a high pressure environmentAbility to handle complex situations and multiple responsibilities simultaneously, mixing long-term projects with the urgency of immediate demands.Ability to collaborate with and achieve actionable resultsAbility to develop digital initiatives and oversee the development of long-term plans and proposals to support business objectivesAbility to challenge, convince and manage multiple stakeholdersAbility to effectively drive business, culture, and technology change in a dynamic and complex operating environment.Strong business acumen; understands the key financial drivers and dynamics related to growth and revenue goalsFull knowledge of project, risk and operations managementAbility to formulate and allocate budgetsStrong conceptual thinking to develop new strategies & innovative projectsSelf-motivated and able to work with a high degree of autonomyFully committed and motivated to achieve the aims of UNDP and the SDGs


Required Skills and Experience


Education:
Masters Degree in fields related to Business Administration, Public Administration or Management, Computer Science, Innovation Management or equivalent.
A first-level university degree in combination with two additional years of qualifying experience may be accepted in lieu of the advanced university degree.
Experience:
At least 8 years of professional experience in innovation management and/or digital product development at a senior level
Deep understanding of traditional and emerging technology innovations (e.g. mobile apps, blockchain, artificial intelligence)
Working knowledge of cloud computing, business intelligence and analytics, Agile, lean startup, and DevOps methodologies
Strong understanding of the human-centered design and lean startup methodologies.
Proven track record in driving projects - effectively delivering impactful elements of projects in fast-moving environment, ideally for new businesses, new business models, startups.
History of successful intra/entrepreneurship in a high growth environment.
Experience in supporting innovations to scale within large organizations and change management.
Practical experience of innovation management within the UN and/or international development environment.
Able to generate new and original solutions to complex problems
Language Requirements:
Excellent knowledge of English, as well as writing, presentation, and communication skills. Fluency in other UN languages is an asset

Application Procedure
The application package containing the following (to be uploaded as one file):
Personal CV
Note: The above documents need to be scanned in one file and uploaded to the online application as one document.
Evaluation process
Applicants are reviewed based on the Required Skills and Experience stated above and based on the technical evaluation criteria outlined below. Applicants will be evaluated based on cumulative scoring. When using this weighted scoring method, the award of the contract will be made to the individual consultant whose offer has been evaluated and determined as:
Being responsive/compliant/acceptable; and
Having received the highest score out of a pre-determined set of weighted technical and financial criteria specific to the solicitation where technical criteria weighs 70% and Financial criteria/ Proposal weighs 30%.

Technical evaluation - Total 70% (70 points)
Demonstrated experience and deep understanding of technology innovations (e.g. mobile apps, blockchain, artificial intelligence) (Maximum points: 20 points)
Working knowledge of human-centered design and innovation/scaling process (Maximum:20 points)
Demonstrated experience in working with multicultural and remote teams ( Maximum 10 points)
Demonstrated experience in a social mission-driven organization with a global scale. (Maximum points: 10 points)
Interview (10 points)
Candidates with a minimum scored of 49 points (70% of 70 points) will be short-listed for the financial evaluation, and an interview may be needed.
Financial evaluation - Total 30% (30 points)
The following formula will be used to evaluate financial proposal:
p = y (µ/z), where
p = points for the financial proposal being evaluated
y = maximum number of points for the financial proposal
µ = price of the lowest-priced proposal
z = price of the proposal being evaluated

Shortlisted candidates (ONLY) will be requested to submit a Financial Proposal.
The financial proposal should specify an all-inclusive daily fee (based on an 8-hour working day with 1-hour lunch included - and an estimated 21.75 days per month).
The financial proposal must be all-inclusive and take into account various expenses that will be incurred during the contract, including the daily professional fee; the cost of travel from the home base to the duty station and vice versa, where required; living allowances at the duty station; communications, utilities, and consumables; life, health, and any other insurance; risks and inconveniences related to work under hardship and hazardous conditions (e.g., personal security needs, etc.), when applicable; and any other relevant expenses related to the performance of services under the contract.
In the case of unforeseeable travel requested by UNDP, payment of travel costs including tickets, lodging and terminal expenses should be agreed upon, between UNDP and Individual Consultant, prior to travel and will be reimbursed. In general, UNDP should not accept travel costs exceeding those of an economy class ticket. Should the IC wish to travel on a higher class he/she should do so using their own resources.
If the Offeror is employed by an organization/company/institution, and he/she expects his/her employer to charge a management fee in the process of releasing him/her to UNDP under a Reimbursable Loan Agreement (RLA), the Offeror must indicate at this point and ensure that all such costs are duly incorporated in the financial proposal submitted to UNDP.

The Financial Proposal is to be emailed as per the instruction in the separate email that will be sent to shortlisted candidates.
Contract Award
Candidate obtaining the highest combined scores in the combined score of Technical and Financial evaluation will be considered technically qualified and will be offered to enter into a contract with UNDP.
Institutional arrangement
The consultant will work under the guidance and direct supervision of Digital Innovating & Scaling Lead and will be responsible for the fulfillment of the deliverables as specified above.
Payment modality
Payment to the Individual Contractor will be made based on the actual number of days worked, deliverables accepted, and upon certification of satisfactory completion by the manager.

Being a Cloud Services Manager at iManage means…
You are responsible for the day to day iManage Cloud Customer Portfolio deployment planning, management including overall Cloud customer satisfaction and reference-ability. You will be accountable for Cloud customer account administration, support, and direction while ensuring day-to-day operational success. In addition, you will interface directly with and provide guidance to our Cloud customer's implementation services provider (iManage Partners), including key stakeholders such as the project manager, business sponsor, networking, and operations teams to ensure iManage Cloud onboarding success.
As a Cloud Services Manager, you will work closely with the internal iManage team such as Cloud Operations and Cloud Support to ensure continuity when a customer transitions from implementation to ongoing operations in the iManage Cloud.
You will be responsible for supporting our customers located on the West Coast, and so working West Coast hours is something you are comfortable with.
iM Responsible For...
Providing day to day management of assigned cloud onboarding portfolio for project tasks and communications
Proactively managing the relationship with internal and outsourced iManage Cloud implementation partners and customers, including setting expectations regarding deliverables and schedules; ensuring that the project team members are effectively communicating and collaborating
Establishing and maintaining a business relationship with the iManage Cloud customer as well as the customer's implementation team to ensure customer satisfaction with the implementation; serving as the first line of response for customer escalations during implementation
Interfacing with internal iManage teams to ensure successful delivery of the components required for an iManage Cloud implementation including iManage CloudOpS, Networking, R&D, Pre-Sales, Sales, and Product Management.
Maintaining cloud-related customer data in appropriate systems including: Salesforce, DevOps, ZenDesk, etc.
Listening to customer and partner feedback and resolving any issues or conflicts
Assisting with developing relationships with onboarding customers/partners that promote retention and loyalty
Ensuring that new customers are referenceable 60 days after go-live for new deployments and upgrades
Learning and supporting iManage Cloud Product lines for customer onboarding
Educating iManage cloud implementation partners for cloud onboarding processes
Remaining current on technology and process changes as it relates to Cloud Services and Onboarding
Supporting department initiatives which include but not limited to projects such as documentation updates, reporting metrics, and net promoter scores
iM Qualified Because I have...
A Bachelor's Degree in Business, Business Administration, Information Management, Computer Science or the equivalent
A minimum of 3-5+ Years' experience managing software implementation projects
Project Management skills
SaaS/PaaS implementation experience
Excellent business communication, organizational and project management skills
Strong computer skills
Excellent time management and decision-making skills
Bonus Points Because I have...
A working knowledge of iManage products
Used SalesForce and ticketing systems
A team player attitude; an ability to work well independently and as part of a team
A PMP certification
About iManage
iManage combines artificial intelligence with content and email management to free, secure, and understand information. Over 3000 companies and 1 million users worldwide rely on our market-leading software to share and protect their most valuable data. Our work is not always easy but it is ambitious and rewarding.
So we're looking for people who love a challenge. People who are happiest when they're solving problems and collaborating with the industry's best and brightest. In exchange, we'll make sure the work you do here is worth doing. That's the iManage way. It's how we do things that might appear impossible. How we develop our employees' strengths and unlock their potential. It's how we find meaning in everything we do.
Whoever you are, whatever you do, however you work. Make it mean something at iManage.

Learn more at: www.imanage.com
Please see our privacy statement for more information on how we handle your personal data: https://imanage.com/privacy-policy/

At least 8 years of professional experience in innovation management and/or digital product development at a senior level
Deep understanding of traditional and emerging technology innovations (e.g. mobile apps, blockchain, artificial intelligence)
Working knowledge of cloud computing, business intelligence and analytics, Agile, lean startup, and DevOps methodologies
Strong understanding of the human-centered design and lean startup methodologies.
Proven track record in driving projects - effectively delivering impactful elements of projects in fast-moving environment, ideally for new businesses, new business models, startups.
History of successful intra/entrepreneurship in a high growth environment.
Experience in supporting innovations to scale within large organizations and change management.
Practical experience of innovation management within the UN and/or international development environment.
Able to generate new and original solutions to complex problems
Language Requirements:
Excellent knowledge of English, as well as writing, presentation, and communication skills. Fluency in other UN languages is an asset

Application Procedure
The application package containing the following (to be uploaded as one file):
Personal CV
Note: The above documents need to be scanned in one file and uploaded to the online application as one document.
Evaluation process
Applicants are reviewed based on the Required Skills and Experience stated above and based on the technical evaluation criteria outlined below. Applicants will be evaluated based on cumulative scoring. When using this weighted scoring method, the award of the contract will be made to the individual consultant whose offer has been evaluated and determined as:
Being responsive/compliant/acceptable; and
Having received the highest score out of a pre-determined set of weighted technical and financial criteria specific to the solicitation where technical criteria weighs 70% and Financial criteria/ Proposal weighs 30%.

Technical evaluation - Total 70% (70 points)
Demonstrated experience and deep understanding of technology innovations (e.g. mobile apps, blockchain, artificial intelligence) (Maximum points: 20 points)
Working knowledge of human-centered design and innovation/scaling process (Maximum:20 points)
Demonstrated experience in working with multicultural and remote teams ( Maximum 10 points)
Demonstrated experience in a social mission-driven organization with a global scale. (Maximum points: 10 points)
Interview (10 points)
Candidates with a minimum scored of 49 points (70% of 70 points) will be short-listed for the financial evaluation, and an interview may be needed.
Financial evaluation - Total 30% (30 points)
The following formula will be used to evaluate financial proposal:
p = y (µ/z), where
p = points for the financial proposal being evaluated
y = maximum number of points for the financial proposal
µ = price of the lowest-priced proposal
z = price of the proposal being evaluated

Shortlisted candidates (ONLY) will be requested to submit a Financial Proposal.
The financial proposal should specify an all-inclusive daily fee (based on an 8-hour working day with 1-hour lunch included - and an estimated 21.75 days per month).
The financial proposal must be all-inclusive and take into account various expenses that will be incurred during the contract, including the daily professional fee; the cost of travel from the home base to the duty station and vice versa, where required; living allowances at the duty station; communications, utilities, and consumables; life, health, and any other insurance; risks and inconveniences related to work under hardship and hazardous conditions (e.g., personal security needs, etc.), when applicable; and any other relevant expenses related to the performance of services under the contract.
In the case of unforeseeable travel requested by UNDP, payment of travel costs including tickets, lodging and terminal expenses should be agreed upon, between UNDP and Individual Consultant, prior to travel and will be reimbursed. In general, UNDP should not accept travel costs exceeding those of an economy class ticket. Should the IC wish to travel on a higher class he/she should do so using their own resources.
If the Offeror is employed by an organization/company/institution, and he/she expects his/her employer to charge a management fee in the process of releasing him/her to UNDP under a Reimbursable Loan Agreement (RLA), the Offeror must indicate at this point and ensure that all such costs are duly incorporated in the financial proposal submitted to UNDP.

The Financial Proposal is to be emailed as per the instruction in the separate email that will be sent to shortlisted candidates.
Contract Award
Candidate obtaining the highest combined scores in the combined score of Technical and Financial evaluation will be considered technically qualified and will be offered to enter into a contract with UNDP.
Institutional arrangement
The consultant will work under the guidance and direct supervision of Digital Innovating & Scaling Lead and will be responsible for the fulfillment of the deliverables as specified above.
Payment modality
Payment to the Individual Contractor will be made based on the actual number of days worked, deliverables accepted, and upon certification of satisfactory completion by the manager.

Annexes (click on the hyperlink to access the documents):
Annex 1 - UNDP P11 Form for ICs
Annex 2 - IC Contract Template
Annex 3 – IC General Terms and Conditions
Annex 4 – RLA Template



UNDP is committed to achieving workforce diversity in terms of gender, nationality and culture. Individuals from minority groups, indigenous groups and persons with disabilities are equally encouraged to apply. All applications will be treated with the strictest confidence.

UNDP does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of harassment, including sexual harassment, and discrimination. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks.

Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.
We're looking for a Product Manager to join Snap Inc! We're looking for someone who has a ML-focused background that can leverage and apply machine learning technology to shape the future of our paid products. Working from our Santa Monica headquarters, you’ll partner closely with Engineering in building out scalable ranking systems and models to improve ads personalization and advertiser performance. You’ll become the internal voice of our revenue-generating products by focusing on synthesizing external research, internal analytics, and cross-functional team feedback into a long-term product vision and near-term execution plan.
What you'll do:
Develop and launch machine learning centric products and services that help our broader business, while being conscientious and cautious of impacts on core user experience
Define the business goals and own the results for your product area
Manage a long-term roadmap for internal tools, data and analytics, and revenue-related products and improvements
Solicit ideas and feedback, gather requirements, write specs, create wireframes and workflows, and coordinate cross-functionally
Drive strategic product decisions via evaluation of market trends and meticulous retrospective and prospective analysis of product and revenue performance
Become the internal voice and representative for revenue-related products
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner
Exceptional analytical skills
Minimum Qualifications:
BA/BS from a leading undergraduate institution in CS/EE/General Engineering or Economics/Physics/Psychology/Math
3+ years of product management or product marketing experience at a consumer or enterprise technology company
Deep knowledge of machine learning/artificial intelligence/computer vision
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience building and applying ML technologies to large scale problems
Experience with product design, software development, or interaction design
Experience with brands and agencies in the digital advertising space
Familiarity with SQL, Python, ProgR, Minitab, or SPSS
At Snap, we believe that having a team of diverse backgrounds and voices working together will enable us to create innovative products that improve the way people live and communicate. Snap is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. EOE, including disability/vets. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don’t be shy and contact us at accommodations-ext@snap.com .

job_description:
Janssen Research & Development LLC, a Johnson & Johnson company, is recruiting for a Senior Director, Portfolio Management Data Science. You will report to the Chief Operating Office of Data Science, Global Head of JRD Strategy and Operations. The primary location for this position is either New Brunswick, NJ or Spring House, PA. Consideration will be given to Boston, MA, Raritan, NJ and Titusville, NJ.

Who We Are:
Janssen develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and Development areas encompass Oncology, Cardiovascular and Metabolic disorders, Immunology, Neuroscience, and Infectious diseases. Our ultimate goal is to help people live longer, healthier lives. We have produced and marketed many first-in-class prescription medications and are poised to serve the broad needs of the healthcare market – from patients to practitioners and from clinics to hospitals. To learn more about Janssen, one of the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, visit www.janssenpharmaceuticalsinc.com.


You will:

Partner with the COO, Data Science (DS) and the relevant TA/Function to define and prioritize a portfolio of high impact use cases in alignment with TA/Function strategy and JRD Data Science strategy
Champion, build and drive large strategic and complex DS projects to achieve the intended impact in a timely manner
Lead in a highly matrixed environment with cross-functional teams of TA/functional representatives, Data Scientists, Software engineers, external partners (when needed), etc. while also providing executive visibility to the COO of DS and TA/function leads
Collaborate with the DS analytics and Data Platform team to execute on the priorities, pragmatically build a roadmap to deliver the user cases, from test and learn to scale up deployment
Build and cultivate right partnerships and alliances with internal and external partners in collaboration with Business Development, Innovation Centers, etc.
Develop a deep understanding and appreciation of the partners, understand and align the problems and the value of use case with key partners

Qualifications
Required:

MD, Ph.D. degree, Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence, Physics, Mathematics, Computational Chemistry, Chemistry, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Biology or a related discipline.
8+ years of experience in the Data Science and /or Digital Health space in a company ranging from start-ups to consulting firms with established Data Science practices or large Fortune 500 companies.
Experience in product management and leadership experience to design and execute on high impact data science projects / platforms
Proven project leadership in complicated context, able to influence and engage the strategic and technical partners
Proven track record of partnership and leading in a matrix organization
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and written skills.
Preferred:

Familiarity with drug discovery and clinical development processes.
Experience delivering on data science projects using predictive technologies, data mining and/or text mining.
Managing of healthcare relevant datasets, such as EHR, insurance claims or registry data.
Experience with visualization software/tools such as ProgR, Spotfire, Tableau, etc.
Thriving on a diverse company culture and celebrating the uniqueness of our employees, we are committed to inclusion. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Working with Johnson & Johnson can change everything. Including YOU.

#JNJDataScience #JRDDS

Overview:
Peraton is looking for a part-time academic researcher with innovative thinking on Human Machine Interfaces (HMI) for the modeling of human behavior and reward functions for the purpose of infusing Artificial Intelligence (AI) in human centric design of assistive robots in order to endow them with learning and online behavioral adaptation capabilities. Expertise in creating rational strategies for irrational human behavior to anticipate and respond to irrational human actions. Additional research may include the use of emerging theories of the mind as they apply to the design of AI systems that account for the management of data which overwhelm the humans and to provide guidance to the AI’s learning mechanisms. Research on planning for non-positive eventualities of cyber physical AI systems, such as weapons, which will become a part of the human ecosystem.
Responsibilities:
What you’ll do…
Conduct research on HMI for socially adept robotic systems.
Model human behavior and reward functions for human centric design of AI systems.
Create rational strategies for modeling and anticipation of irrational human behaviors.
Apply emerging theories of the mind to the design of AI systems to account for overwhelming data.
Document and disseminate these research ideas in academic publications and journal articles.
Evangelize research ideas in public fora such as Ted Talks and other discussions.
Qualifications:
You’d be a great fit if…
You have a Master’s degree or higher (with a minimum of 8 years experience) in the fields of education, human machine interfaces or social robotics.
You are an innovative thinking in modeling of human behavior is expected.
Have excellent written and oral communication skills with demonstrated competence on dissemination of ideas to a wide audience.
You’d be an even better fit if…
You have high academic achievement.
SECURITY CLEARANCE

This position requires the candidate be able to obtain and maintain a secret level security clearance. In order to obtain a clearance you must be a US Citizen.
About Peraton:
At Peraton, we’re at the forefront of delivering the next breakthrough in national security, every day. We’re the partner of choice to help solve some of the world’s most daunting challenges. How? By thinking differently. We’re not mired in the past. We look at all problems with fresh eyes. We look past the obvious to bring the best talent, tech, and ideas together to completely transform how problems are solved. So bring your unique ideas, your entrepreneurial spirit, and your drive to succeed. Get ready to be part of something bigger. Get ready to do the can’t be done.
EEO Statement:
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

Description:

Our client is THE global leader of entertainment and technology. Among their key initiatives are interactive entertainment such as gaming, artificial intelligence, cloud services, film entertainment, and other internet services. Some of their best of breed International partners and investment companies include Epic Games, Riot, Activision, Take-Two and EA.

Our client is dedicated to creating a reliable, fun, and professional interactive entertainment experience for users through the creation of world class online games. If you are eager to do groundbreaking work in a friendly, cross-cultural environment, they can provide unparalleled stability, resources, access to more than a billion users, and an international perspective.

Job Description:
Our Award-winning client seeks an Audio Director with outstanding skills who can really help us build a new world-class IP from concept to market!

Are you ready to create something groundbreaking, genre-defining and fun for years to come? Do you have an insatiable passion for video games and creating new ways for players to be engaged?

Responsibilities:

Start with a player-first mentality, embedding an obsessive drive to know, understand, and serve the players who are engaged with the game.
Work with the team to develop and manage a vision of sound and music, and a production plan capable of delivering upon the promise of the game.
Keep up-to-date with the bleeding edge of audio trends within video game development and evangelize ideas that will innovate both the player experience and the creative development of the product.
Participate in the hiring of the audio discipline.
Responsible for the career growth and mentorship of the audio discipline on the project.
Act as the key art contact for the studio, representing the project and team to all external partners and stakeholders.
Define and uphold audio principles to ensure the sound and music direction of the game is cohesive, inspiring, and with distinct style.
Work side-by-side with all directors and leads to take a multi-discipline approach to creativity and problem solving.
Proactively identify opportunities and risks to improve the work of the team, the quality of the project, and studio knowledge as a whole.
Have a cross platform mindset up front and ensure that the art of the game is capable of supporting an experience that can work seamlessly on different systems and form factors.
Ensure that the audio direction of the game starts with a Live product foundation, capable of regular updates and malleable to key changes if necessary.

Requirements:
A portfolio of visionary, inspiring, industry-leading audio work that demonstrates your audio direction and capacity to execute on it within a game.
At least eight years of professional AAA game development experience.
At least two projects shipped in a leadership position.
At least one AAA action title shipped.
At least one product shipped during the current generation of games (PS4/XBOX ONE).
Demonstrable, outstanding management and communication capabilities.
Proven ability to define and manage the sound direction and roadmap for very large scale projects.
A team player who knows how to get the best out of everyone on the project and not just within audio.
Experience creating assets in and shipping a game using Unreal Engine 4 a plus

What is in it for you?

Create high-quality games backed by unlimited resources: You will be working to bring incredible game ideas to market, and you will never run out of resources at your disposal. You will be supported completely to bring next-gen experience live to players around the world!
Make a major impact at a global studio: You will be working on a key initiative at this global Studio, building games that are hits not just in the east or west, but globally. The impact of your efforts will ripple not just through the whole studio group (2,500+ employees) but will serve as a blueprint for the entire gaming industry.

To obtain more details or explore this job; please submit a copy of your resume by e-mailing: resumes@gamegrouprecruit.com.

Duties
Summary
Join the team! This position is located in the Headquarters Office of the Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC), Office of Hazard Identification and Reduction (EXHR). The Office of Hazard Identification and Reduction is responsible for managing the Commission's Hazard Identification and Analysis Program and its Hazard Assessment and Reduction Program, and develops strategies for and implements the agency's operating plans for these two hazard programs.

Responsibilities
The incumbent functions as non-supervisory senior expert advisor, subject matter expert, and Agency point of contact on Artificial Intelligence /Machine Learning (AI/ML) as used or may be adopted for use in consumer products and the impact on consumer product safety.

Major duties and responsibilities of the position include:

Performing as agency’s principal advisor on evolving technology and policy issues pertaining to innovation and safety.
Working with internal and external agency stakeholders in development of an agency roadmap to holistically address Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning in voluntary standards for consumer products.
Providing recommendations to EXHR and the Office of the Executive Director (OEX) for Commission procedures and programs for addressing hazards in products which employ Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning.
Working with EXHR staff to design and implement a testing program for consumer products that assess AI/ML technologies.
Providing periodic updates on progress to EXHR management.
Publish authoritative papers and reports on relevant AI/ML issues which further the strategic objectives of Agency Hazard Identification and Reduction programs.

Travel Required

This is a Public Trust Position. Employment in this position requires a background investigation. If you are a male born after December 31, 1959 you must certify that you have registered with the Selective Service System, or are exempt from having to do so under the Selective Service Law. Please see http://www.sss.gov for more information.

We will compare information provided on the I-9 Form to records available from the U.S. Department of Homeland Security. The system confirms employee’s identity and eligibility to work in the United States. Learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities.

Upon appointment, you will be required to complete a Confidential Financial Disclosure Report, OGE-450. You will need to provide the information annually.

You will be required to complete a 1-year trial period.
Qualifications
All applicants must have 52 weeks of specialized experience equivalent to at least the next lower grade level in the Federal Service. Specialized experience is experience that has equipped the candidate with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform successfully the duties of the position.

Qualifying specialized experience must demonstrate the following:


Experience with 1) providing innovative leadership and strategic vision in developing, directing, and implementing artificial intelligence/machine learning capabilities in support of functional needs; 2) expertise in assessment and alignment of requirements, technologies, and services with current and emerging customer, collaborator, and stakeholder expectations and requirements; 3) expertise in product testing and evaluation, particularly focused on human-system interactions in an automated environment; and 4) understanding of standards and standards development processes.

In addition to the above specialized experience, applicants must also meet the IT-Related proficiency level for all four of the competencies listed below:

Attention to Detail: Is thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail.

Customer Service: Ability to coordinate AI/ML operations with other organization functions or support activities.

Oral communication: Ability to communicate complex information, concepts, or ideas in a confident and well-organized manner through verbal means.

Problem Solving: Ability to interpret and understand complex and rapidly evolving concepts; ability to think critically.

Evidence of the above specialized experience and IT-related proficiency must be supported by detailed documentation of duties performed in positions held. Your resume is the key means we have for evaluating your skills, knowledge, and abilities as they relate to this position. Therefore, we encourage you to be clear and specific when describing your experience.

Evidence of the above specialized experience must be supported by detailed documentation of duties performed in positions held. Your resume is the key means we have for evaluating your skills, knowledge, and abilities as they relate to this position. Therefore, we encourage you to be clear and specific when describing your experience.

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

Applicants must meet the qualifications for this position within thirty (30) days of the closing date of this announcement.
Education
A Masters, PhD, or other advanced degree is preferred.

GS-15: There is no substitution for specialized experience at this grade level. Applicants must have 1 year of specialized experience (as stated above) equivalent to the GS-14 grade level AND meet the IT-Related proficiency level for all four competencies (as stated above).
Additional information
CPSC provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities on a case-by-case basis. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, please contact the Human Resources Specialist listed in this vacancy announcement.

Payment of relocation expenses is NOT authorized.

All the information you provide will be verified by a review of the work experience and/or education as shown on your application, by checking reference and through other means, such as the interview process. Any exaggeration of your experience, false statements, or attempts to conceal information may be grounds for not hiring you or for firing you after you begin work.

Additional selections may be made through this vacancy announcement.


How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.

If you meet the minimum qualifications, your responses to the questionnaire, resume and supporting documentation will then be reviewed. You will be placed in one of the three pre-defined categories. Your responses to the questionnaire will serve as the basis for your initial rating in one of three pre-defined categories: "best", "better", and "good". Within each category, those eligible through veterans preference will be listed at the top of the category. The candidates in the highest category will be certified for referral to the selecting official and may be invited to an interview.

CTAP/ICTAP candidates will be eligible if it is determined that they have exceeded the minimum qualifications for the position by attaining at least a category rating of BETTER.

Peraton is looking for a part-time academic researcher with innovative thinking on Human Machine Interfaces (HMI) for the modeling of human behavior and reward functions for the purpose of infusing Artificial Intelligence (AI) in human centric design of assistive robots in order to endow them with learning and online behavioral adaptation capabilities. Expertise in creating rational strategies for irrational human behavior to anticipate and respond to irrational human actions. Additional research may include the use of emerging theories of the mind as they apply to the design of AI systems that account for the management of data which overwhelm the humans and to provide guidance to the AI’s learning mechanisms. Research on planning for non-positive eventualities of cyber physical AI systems, such as weapons, which will become a part of the human ecosystem.
What you’ll do…

Conduct research on HMI for socially adept robotic systems.

Model human behavior and reward functions for human centric design of AI systems.

Create rational strategies for modeling and anticipation of irrational human behaviors.

Apply emerging theories of the mind to the design of AI systems to account for overwhelming data.

Document and disseminate these research ideas in academic publications and journal articles.

Evangelize research ideas in public fora such as Ted Talks and other discussions.
You’d be a great fit if…

You have a Master’s degree or higher (with a minimum of 8 years experience) in the fields of education, human machine interfaces or social robotics.

You are an innovative thinking in modeling of human behavior is expected.

Have excellent written and oral communication skills with demonstrated competence on dissemination of ideas to a wide audience.
You’d be an even better fit if…
You have high academic achievement.
SECURITY CLEARANCE
This position requires the candidate be able to obtain and maintain a secret level security clearance. In order to obtain a clearance you must be a US Citizen.

We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

Our Solution
Botkeeper is a virtual robotic bookkeeping platform transforming the accounting industry. By the end of 2018 Botkeeper was named a Cool Vendor in AI by Gartner, one of BostInno's Coolest Companies, and one of Business Insider's Enterprise Startups to Bet Your Career On in 2019. Botkeeper is truly the future of bookkeeping!
Botkeeper, a progressive software company with over 1000 clients in its early stages of growth automating financial bookkeeping, brings the next wave in machine learning and artificial intelligence technology to an important and critical aspect of any business. All companies struggle with bookkeeping, prone to error and human inference along with agonizing data entry, reconciliation, and general upkeep in financial bookkeeping. Botkeeper performs all associated tasks not limited to entries, tracking and schedules of revenue, deferred expenses accounts for payroll, reconciliation of bank accounts, and sending invoices to clients. Now scaling, we are bringing in the world's best talent to achieve the true future of bookkeeping.

The Challenge
As a Customer Success Lead at Botkeeper you guide a new client from the late stages of purchase through to their bookkeeping migration to Botkeeper. Successful candidates will have a strong working knowledge of accounting principles and QuickBooks Online. It is the Customer Success Lead's responsibility to understand the services the client has selected from Botkeeper, interpret all the information gathered during the sales process, and capture all the remaining information required from the client to make their deployment successful. This includes assisting and training clients as they provide credentials to Botkeeper to enable our services. A person with complete knowledge and mastery of the lifecycle of a client from presales to healthy client is necessary.
In this position it is also necessary to conduct multiple presentations and calls to help credential setup, facilitate an initial orientation of the deployment process in a product presentation, set appropriate client expectations, request documentation, write the initial form of a Client Playbook as a list of services Botkeeper performs, and conduct a briefing and handoff to accounting services. It is incredibly important to Botkeeper that continuity and health measurement in the first few weeks, overlapping with both Botkeeper expectations and services rendered, are successful. Ideal candidates will have a focus on being highly organized in managing a matrix of clients including both direct and indirect business.

Job Responsibilities:
Client Onboarding & Assessment of Services
Confirming Botkeeper services and additional accounting services offerings and how it applies to clients
Ability to assess QBO clients' books and confirm list of services (included and additional)
Credential all financial, payroll, sales and any other system tied to the GL accounting software with Botkeeper services
Obtain or create Botkeeper Playbook (document client services and procedures that clients do today and how they do it)

Client Deployment Presentation and Orientation:
Deliver and present multiple deployment presentation calls that provide:
Orientation of credentialing and demo of Botkeeper software and services
Describe the deployment process, including expectations of the client and timeliness
Set agenda and reinforce the services being performed
Set cadence for calls and calendar of events with client
Initial Client Training and Orientation of Botkeeper Portal
Demo and train clients on Financial Hub for direct clients
Demo and train client partners on Practice Management Suite

Client + Botkeeper Follow-up and Management
Confirm and persist in getting clients credentialed on the Botkeeper platform for services to commence
Act as the intermediary during the initial phases of deployment for all confirmations of integration and financial institution access
Liaison between accounting services and client along with prescribed additional services if necessary
Project manage each client or partner services and software onboarding

Client Health Checks:
Monitor and maintain a list of accounts and the status of each phase of the deployment workflow process
Maintain existing status reports weekly on the calendar of new deployments, on-boarded clients, and large clients

Large Partner Support
Potential routine on-site visits to Botkeeper's largest clients to continue to support deployment and enhancement of services in Botkeeper replacement of bookkeeping services

KPI's for Success:
Successfully Deployed Clients
Time to Deploy
Relative Health Weeks 1, 2, & 3 and Months 1 & 2
Client Survey Feedback

Requirements for Role:
BA in Accounting and/or 7-10 years experience in client success, accounting technical support, staff accounting, project management or consultative roles (technical or finance)
Strong understanding of QuickBooks Online
Great project management, time management, and documentation skills
Proven delivery of outcomes in client or project-based environments in either a consultative or project management capacity
Understanding of customer success principles and metrics
Comfortable demonstrating to and interacting with clients to resolve and understand services they will be consuming
Organized and meticulous calendar practices with an ability to bring together matrixed client environments and people

Overview
The Manager, Data Science & Machine Learning will be a subject matter expert who will help shape the firm’s perspectives and capabilities in the Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (AI) Machine Learning space. The right individual in this role will structure and execute cutting-edge analytical and machine learning techniques on large, complex, structured and unstructured biopharma data sets (including big/patient-claims data) to address clients’ commercial questions and help them make fact-based strategic decisions. This individual will provide thought leadership, develop new AI machine learning offerings and technology solutions, drive business impact by delivering offerings and solutions to clients, and coach and develop data scientists. Candidates will be experienced in the application of sophisticated analytics and AI machine learning techniques to address sales, marketing, payer, and provider questions using real-world data sources such as anonymized longitudinal patient claims data, EHR, lab and diagnosis data, etc. Success in this position requires demonstrated thought leadership, and demonstrated success in business development, client engagement, organizational and people development, managing multiple projects simultaneously, structuring innovative machine learning solutions, and driving business impact for clients.
Responsibilities
Solutions Leader
Serve as a subject matter expert, adept at addressing pressing commercial questions through the application of AI machine learning techniques to biopharma data, including big/patient claims data and unstructured data in order to generate actionable business insights
Play a key role in defining and developing data science and AI machine learning capabilities and offerings that create scale and advance firm’s capabilities
Work closely with Partners and client teams to uncover and understand client’s pressing commercial questions and issues, recommend appropriate AI machine learning analytics and technology solutions to innovatively address the challenges, and provide expertise in architecting and implementing solutions for clients
Lead and own successful delivery of AI machine learning engagements that deliver high-impact results for clients
Direct multiple AI machine learning projects simultaneously,
Motivate, coach, and serve as a role model for analysts in project team
Business Development
Build case studies and white papers that demonstrate the use cases for our AI machine learning capabilities and the value-proposition of our solutions to clients and prospects
Support Partners with pre-sales activities and help convert prospects to new clients
Support Partners in developing custom AI machine learning solutions to grow existing clients
Support Partners in drafting proposals with solutions, staffing plans, and pricing
Support Partners in responding to specific RFP questions; help create competitive differentiation through the innovative application of AI ML techniques to address business problems across Practice Areas like Multi-Channel Marketing, Digital, Patient Services, Brand Planning, Incentive Compensation, Sales Force Sizing, Data Management and Forecasting
Qualifications
Master’s degree in Statistics, Math, Advanced Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline; PhD degree preferred
10+ years of relevant post-collegiate work; 8+ years of work experience with PhD degree
5+ years of experience implementing big data/advanced analytics concepts and algorithms (e.g. text mining, social listening, recommender systems, feature engineering, predictive modeling, etc.) to address biopharma commercial questions
Expertise in AI Machine Learning techniques, and a strong understanding of biopharma and healthcare data sets, including big- (patient claims) data
Hand-on experience coding in Python/R/SAS
Deep knowledge of analytic tools such as ProgR, Python, SAS, SPSS, SQL, and Tableau
Hands-on experience building AI Machine Learning models to address a range of commercial questions using H2O, SageMaker, MLFlow or comparable DS framework in the AWS/Azure Cloud
Previous experience or familiarity with Hadoop and database systems
Track record of business development (pre-sell, upsell) success
Agile project planning and project management experience
Team management and skill development experience
Excellent oral and written communication skills; comfort presenting complex ideas in simple terms to clients and prospects
Strong attention to detail, with a business-focused mindset
Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills
Prior authorship of industry or academic publications
Analytics software solution development experience, preferred

At Northrop Grumman we develop cutting-edge technology that preserves freedom and advances human discovery. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We continue to innovate with developments from launching the first commercial flight to space, to discovering the early beginnings of the universe. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Northrop Grumman Mission Systems seeks an innovative, high-energy, and passionate candidate to join the team as a BD Operations Analyst focused on supporting business development and capture teams across the enterprise. The qualified applicant will lead BD operations activities as part of the Artificial Intelligence (AI) Campaign. Critical to the success of this role is demonstrated relationship building and ability to influence at all levels of the organization. The position will require understanding of the AI customer market, budgets, business opportunities and industry leading technologies.


Activities will include but not limited to:


Supports Proposals and RFI responses across the enterprise with AI related content e.g. past performance, proof points, capabilities.

In coordination with AI architects, domain, and customer SMEs, develops marketing materials to be used in customer engagement activities.

Conducts coordination activities in support of customer engagement efforts. Activities to include but not limited to: agenda creation, logistics, briefing material creation and collection.

Support market and competitor assessment efforts pertaining to AI technologies.

Manages the enterprise-wide AI business pipeline.

Aligns AI technology areas to key programs and captures


Performs analysis and assessment of the pipeline and develops reports for leadership


Collects data from internal tools (i.e. Workbench) and coordinates inputs from strategic programs across the enterprise.




Qualifications:

Basic Qualifications:

Six (6) years with a Bachelors, four (4) years with a Master’s degree in a business related degree or equivalent experience desired.

5+ years’ experience in a business development or operational role.

Dynamic self-starter with strong attention to detail and the ability to function independently.

Requires a demonstrated flexible approach to work, and understand of working collaboratively on a team, and the willingness to be an active and supportive member of a team.

Strong problem solving and analytical skills

Proven ability to make recommendations and provide guidance effectively to bring projects to completion is a must.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills required.

Experience with Windows-based office tools such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint is required.

Experience with Workbench.

Project and technical leadership experience

Experience supporting Capture and Proposal development efforts

Knowledge of the Business Acquisition Process (BAP)

Knowledge of Northrop Grumman programs and capabilities



Preferred Qualifications:
MS degree in business related degree or equivalent experience desired.

Experience with Sales Force, SharePoint (document repository) and HTML is a plus.

External customer engagement experience



Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

job_title_origin: Sr. Principal Signal Image Processing Engineer
job_description:
At Northrop Grumman we develop cutting-edge technology that preserves freedom and advances human discovery. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We continue to innovate with developments from launching the first commercial flight to space, to discovering the early beginnings of the universe. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.


The Engineering and Sciences (E&S) organization pushes the boundaries of innovation, redefines engineering capabilities, and drives advances in various sciences. Our team is chartered with providing the skills, innovative technologies to develop, design, produce and sustain optimized product lines across the sector while providing a decisive advantage to the warfighter. Come be a part of our mission!


The Algorithmic Warfare team at Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is looking for you to join our team as a Sr. Principal Signal Image Processing Engineer based out of Woodland Hills, CA.


What You'll get to Do:


Design signal processing algorithms to extract signals from noisy data.Probe large quantities of sensor data to uncover, understand, and exploit complex phenomenology.Develop and apply artificial intelligence and machine learning approaches to accomplish mission objectives.Prototype algorithms in MATLAB, IDL, Python, C, and/or C++.Measure algorithm performance as applied to a variety of sensor data.Collaborate with a software engineering team to facilitate algorithm implementation in real-time code.Present technical progress at technical review meetings, and documenting results via written reports.

WOODLANDHILLS

Qualifications:

Basic Qualifications:


Bachelor's Degree in Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline with 9 years of technical experience; Master's Degree with 7 years of technical experience; PhD with 0 years experience.Demonstrated success developing technical solutions to complex problems which require the regular use of ingenuity and creativity.Must be a U.S. citizen with the ability to obtain a DoD Top Secret clearance.

Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in any of the following areas is highly desired: data analysis, artificial intelligence, machine learning, signal processing, statistical decision theory, detection and tracking, classification, modeling and simulation, and algorithm development, particularly as applied to complex sensor systems.Experience with remote sensing data, such as radar, EO/IR, multi or hyper-spectral, acoustics.Proficiency with scientific prototyping languages such as MATLAB, IDL, Python, or Mathematica. Familiarity with signal processing algorithm design and implementation in C or C++, and real-time parallel processing.

What We Can Offer You:


Northrop Grumman provides a comprehensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages your growth and supports the mutual success of our people and our company. Northrop Grumman benefits give you the flexibility and control to choose the benefits that make the most sense for you and your family. Your package will include the following:


What We Can Offer You:


Health PlanSavings PlanPaid Time OffAdditional benefits
o Education Assistance
o Training and Development


https://benefits.northropgrumman.com/us/en2/BenefitsOverview/Pages/default.aspx

Additional Northrop Grumman Information:


Northrop Grumman has approximately 85,000 employees in all 50 states and in more than 25 countries, we strive to attract and retain the best employees by providing an inclusive work environment wherein employees are receptive to diverse ideas, perspectives and talents to help solve our toughest customer challenges: to develop and maintain some of the most technically sophisticated products, programs and services in the world.


Our Values. The women and men of Northrop Grumman Corporation are guided by Our Values. They describe our company as we want it to be. We want our decisions and actions to demonstrate these Values. We believe that putting Our Values into practice creates long-term benefits for shareholders, customers, employees, suppliers, and the communities we serve.


Our Responsibility. At Northrop Grumman, we are committed to maintaining the highest of ethical standards, embracing diversity and inclusion, protecting the environment, and striving to be an ideal corporate citizen in the community and in the world.


Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Overview:
NCI is a leading provider of enterprise solutions and services to U.S. defense, intelligence, health and civilian government agencies. NCI's AI solution, Shai(tm), scales humans with artificial intelligence by empowering the workforce to meet their mission by using best in class AI solutions coupled with our exceptional service offerings. Working with strategic partners, NCI is committed to bringing commercial innovation to missions of national importance. NCI is a mid-tier systems integrator headquartered in Reston, VA, and operates at locations across the globe.

NCI has been designated a 2020 Military Friendly Employer by MilitaryFriendly.com
Responsibilities:
NCI: The Database Administrator II, under general supervision, designs, implements and maintains moderately complex databases with respect to JCL, access methods, access time, device allocation, validation checks, reorganization, and statistical methods.

Responsibilities:
Includes maintenance of database dictionaries and integration of systems through database design
Supports data modeling activities by way of prototype database implementations

Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Kirkland, WA, USA
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or closely related field or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience leading software engineering teams (mentoring junior engineers, setting technical direction, etc.).
Large systems software design and development experience, including experience in Unix/Linux.
Hands-on programming experience in one of the following: Java, C++ or Python.

Preferred qualifications:

10 years of relevant work experience, including 6 years of industry experience.
Experience with problem-solving and technical innovation.
Ability to manage a team of engineers including task planning and design reviews.
Excellent communication skills.
People management skills, experience in mentoring and coaching team members.
About the job
Like Google's own ambitions, the work of a Software Engineer (SWE) goes way beyond just Search. SWE Managers have not only the technical expertise to take on and provide technical leadership to major projects, but also manage a team of engineers. You not only optimize your own code but make sure engineers are able to optimize theirs. As a SWE Manager you manage your project goals, contribute to product strategy and help develop your team. SWE teams work all across the company, in areas such as information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking, security, data compression, user interface design; the list goes on and is growing every day. Operating with scale and speed, our exceptional software engineers are just getting started - and as a manager, you guide the way.

As an Engineering Manager, you will work to expand and support various security teams in Seattle, Kirkland, and the San Francisco Bay Area. You will help team members to deliver an exceptional product while also developing their own skills and working towards their career goals.
You will work with partners to establish product direction, including defining priorities, working with our program managers to enable rapid progress, coordinating with peer teams, and ensuring that we're delivering incremental value to our customers.
Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.
Responsibilities
Lead a team focused on security.
Join experts in large-scale cloud computing, big data, machine learning, and cybersecurity, to build out the next generation of security intelligence solutions.
Collaborate effectively and navigate through organizational complexity to solve problems and drive cross-functional execution.
Engage with customers and internal and external partners.
Provide technical expertise throughout the product life cycle, including design, implementation, and delivery of scalable services and infrastructure.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Basic Qualifications
Passion for helping startups growEntrepreneurial “builder” mentality3-10 years of technology related sales or business development experienceExcellent verbal and written communication skillsBA/BS degree requiredComfortable delivering results amid ambiguity and change

Account Manager, Startups - Job Description

Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers a complete set of cloud services that enable all companies, from startups to enterprises, to run virtually everything in the cloud, including mobile applications, big data analytics, AI/ML platforms, and microservices/serverless infrastructures. Startups, which are now primarily born-in-the-cloud, represent a critically important and growing subset of customers to AWS. Startups have unique needs, priorities, and growth trajectories that distinguish them from traditional businesses and require different engagement strategies and sales motions from sellers to effectively acquire, grow, and retain them long-term on the AWS platform.

As AWS continues to rapidly grow, we seek an Americas Startup Account Manager to help drive the growth of high-potential early, mid, and late stage startups. Your responsibilities will include driving revenue and user adoption, migrations, and ensuring new startups select AWS as their primary cloud provider. You will align closely with counterparts in business development, marketing, solution architecture and partner teams to lead execution of coordinated go-to-market strategies and sales plays. You will also work closely with business development teams who are driving strategic support, global co-programming, and portfolio engagement to help drive top-of-funnel customer acquisition and accelerate seller cycles in the field.

You will be at the heart of latest trends like artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), serverless and IoT. Your customers leverage state-of-the-art technologies on AWS to innovate and become the next disrupters, like today’s AirBnB, Slack, DoorDash, and Lyft. You are passionate about startups, a self-starter with a strong entrepreneurial spirit who is prepared to work in a fast-paced, often ambiguous environment, execute against ambitious goals, and consistently embrace the Amazon Culture.

Roles & Responsibilities:
Ensure customer success with early, mid and late stage startupsDrive revenue and market share in a defined territory or industry verticalAccelerate customer adoption through well-developed sales engagements and successful GTM StrategyMeet or exceed quarterly revenue and goal targets.Develop and execute against a comprehensive account/territory plan.Create & articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services.Accelerate customer adoption by engaging Founders, CxO, Board of Directors and VC influencersWork with partners to extend reach & drive adoption.Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts.Ensure customer satisfaction.Expect moderate travel.

Preferred Qualifications
MBA/MA/MS degreePrevious cloud expertise at a technology companyA technical background in engineering or computer scienceHistory of working for, or selling to tech startups

Meets and exceeds assigned sales quota.
