Makes in person sales calls
Interacts with all levels of organization. Makes presentations as necessary to same.
Build trust and rapport with current and potential customers.
Regularly closes deals and builds future pipeline within or exceeding goals.
Completes all inContact paperwork timely - expense reports, sales call logs, etc.
Regularly keeps direct supervisor apprised of issues and potential sales.
Travel required 50%.

15 + years sales experience
Previous experience selling multimillion-dollar software deals
Previous experience in telecom, call center, software or hardware industries
Highly professional demeanor - presence, voice

Demonstrated success working with little to no direct daily supervision in a home office setting

NICE inContact provides the world’s No. 1 cloud customer experience platform, NICE inContact CXone™, combining best-in-class Omnichannel Routing, Workforce Optimization, Analytics, Automation and Artificial Intelligence on an Open Cloud Foundation. NICE inContact is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.

Location: Princeton, NJ
Overview
The Manager, Data Science & Machine Learning will be a subject matter expert who will help shape the firm’s perspectives and capabilities in the Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (AI) Machine Learning space. The right individual in this role will structure and execute cutting-edge analytical and machine learning techniques on large, complex, structured and unstructured biopharma data sets (including big/patient-claims data) to address clients’ commercial questions and help them make fact-based strategic decisions. This individual will provide thought leadership, develop new AI machine learning offerings and technology solutions, drive business impact by delivering offerings and solutions to clients, and coach and develop data scientists. Candidates will be experienced in the application of sophisticated analytics and AI machine learning techniques to address sales, marketing, payer, and provider questions using real-world data sources such as anonymized longitudinal patient claims data, EHR, lab and diagnosis data, etc. Success in this position requires demonstrated thought leadership, and demonstrated success in business development, client engagement, organizational and people development, managing multiple projects simultaneously, structuring innovative machine learning solutions, and driving business impact for clients.
Responsibilities
Solutions Leader
Serve as a subject matter expert, adept at addressing pressing commercial questions through the application of AI machine learning techniques to biopharma data, including big/patient claims data and unstructured data in order to generate actionable business insights
Play a key role in defining and developing data science and AI machine learning capabilities and offerings that create scale and advance firm’s capabilities
Work closely with Partners and client teams to uncover and understand client’s pressing commercial questions and issues, recommend appropriate AI machine learning analytics and technology solutions to innovatively address the challenges, and provide expertise in architecting and implementing solutions for clients
Lead and own successful delivery of AI machine learning engagements that deliver high-impact results for clients
Direct multiple AI machine learning projects simultaneously,
Motivate, coach, and serve as a role model for analysts in project team
Business Development
Build case studies and white papers that demonstrate the use cases for our AI machine learning capabilities and the value-proposition of our solutions to clients and prospects
Support Partners with pre-sales activities and help convert prospects to new clients
Support Partners in developing custom AI machine learning solutions to grow existing clients
Support Partners in drafting proposals with solutions, staffing plans, and pricing
Support Partners in responding to specific RFP questions; help create competitive differentiation through the innovative application of AI ML techniques to address business problems across Practice Areas like Multi-Channel Marketing, Digital, Patient Services, Brand Planning, Incentive Compensation, Sales Force Sizing, Data Management and Forecasting
Qualifications
Master’s degree in Statistics, Math, Advanced Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline; PhD degree preferred
10+ years of relevant post-collegiate work; 8+ years of work experience with PhD degree
5+ years of experience implementing big data/advanced analytics concepts and algorithms (e.g. text mining, social listening, recommender systems, feature engineering, predictive modeling, etc.) to address biopharma commercial questions
Expertise in AI Machine Learning techniques, and a strong understanding of biopharma and healthcare data sets, including big- (patient claims) data
Hand-on experience coding in Python/R/SAS
Deep knowledge of analytic tools such as ProgR, Python, SAS, SPSS, SQL, and Tableau
Hands-on experience building AI Machine Learning models to address a range of commercial questions using H2O, SageMaker, MLFlow or comparable DS framework in the AWS/Azure Cloud
Previous experience or familiarity with Hadoop and database systems
Track record of business development (pre-sell, upsell) success
Agile project planning and project management experience
Team management and skill development experience
Excellent oral and written communication skills; comfort presenting complex ideas in simple terms to clients and prospects
Strong attention to detail, with a business-focused mindset
Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills
Prior authorship of industry or academic publications
Analytics software solution development experience, preferred

HR Transformation Consultant Job Description
A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients' opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50+ year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of 200,000 team members in over 40 countries. The Group reported 2017 global revenues of EUR 12.8 billion. Visit us at www.capgemini.com. People matter, results count.
Industry: Information Technology and Services
Company size: 200,000+ employees
Headquarters: Paris, France
Type: Public Company
Founded: 1967
Specialties: Consulting, Technology, Outsourcing, Business Technology, Process Consulting, Package Based Solutions, Custom Solution Development, Application Management, Business Information Management, and Artificial Intelligence

Join Capgemini and drive automation and innovation for leading global organizations and corporations. Business is not usual. Today we see multiple shifts occurring simultaneously. Shifts that are broad, complex, and at high velocity and are driving new levels of disruption and value creation. The risks of not acting or acting in yesterday’s innovation paradigms are far too great. The current situation demands doing something beyond the ordinary. Organizations must confront the new realities and develop an intrinsic ability to apply innovation.
Capgemini’s HR Transformation approach helps frame and implement the solution to modern problems in volatile, uncertain, complex, and ambiguous situations.
Principle Duties and Responsibilities
As a HR Transformation Consultant within Capgemini’s Business Services Global Business Line the following set of responsibilities and duties exists. Deliver agile strategies, recommendations and solutions that will overall improve our client’s HR employee experience and HR outcomes. Constantly promoting Capgemini’s Digital Employee Operations (DEO) and Digital Learning Operations (DLO) practice, its principles while leveraging our assets. Specifically, within our DEO offering, our HR Transformation Consultants, along with improving the employee experience, will drive to adjust and manage our client’s efforts to move transactional back-office to the front office. Additionally, engage our clients in rethinking their process and HR administration operations to drive the best experience at an optimal cost. With Capgemini’s intelligent automation, our consultants help our clients to make the best use of their HCM investment through a range of intelligent automation solutions with front office live chats, chatbot, and knowledge portals to back office Robotic Process Automation (RPA) offerings.
You will partner with clients to develop and deliver HR Operating Models that will improve HR administrative operations efficiencies. Support detail assessments, design sessions, design and build requirements, support development and implementation of the to-be HR organization processes and strategies to leverage Digital HCM platforms Workday, Success Factors, Oracle, and SAP.
Minimum 4 years of external consulting experience or other relevant experience related to successful delivery of HR Transformation.
Minimum 3 years of experience in one or more of the following HCM platforms: ServiceNow, Workday, Success Factors, Oracle, PeopleSoft, and SAP
Bachelor’s Degree required. Ability to independently understand and transition into Capgemini’s methodologies and approaches. Support sales cycle with RFP/RFI/RFQ development. Demonstrated ability to influence at all levels of management. Strategic thinker who understands the ever-changing Human Resource market. Demonstrated ability to transition HR Services to BPO delivery centers. Ability to build, develop and implement and engage in new service delivery approaches; possibly different from the status quo. Comfort in identifying and communicating complex problems; takes an analytical and creative approach with problem solving. Energetic, passionate, highly self-motivated, collaborative, organized individual driven to execute flawlessly in a fast-paced, ever changing, dynamic environment. Experienced with creating thoughtful presentations in clear action driven and outcome-oriented ways. Ability to meet travel requirements where needed.

FICO (NYSE: FICO) is a leading global analytics software company, helping businesses in 90+ countries make better decisions. Join our world-class team today and fulfill your career potential!
Job Summary
Job Description
Role: Procurement Category Manager (Hardware, Software, Infrastructure)
The Opportunity
“ The Category Manager, Global Procurement for Hardware, Software and Infrastructure is a critical role within the FICO Procurement team. The successful candidate must be able to both manage a team and provide functional leadership within this specific procurement category. In addition, the role will partner with the key business units to drive supply continuity, reduced lead times and deliver leveraged value/savings aligned with the business needs. ” – Director of Procurement
What You’ll Contribute
Negotiate deals in the procurement categories of Hardware, Software, and Infrastructure.
Support key initiatives such as Source-to-Pay rollout, Business Intelligence, process efficiencies, and controls to ensure adherence to procurement governance.
Collaborates with key stakeholders, including the CTO, Product, and IT teams to ensure engagement, buy-in and ownership of key sourcing strategies.
Brainstorm and provide feedback, category planning, and best practices in supply and procurement organizations.
Makes decisions that support the function's strategy; takes personal accountability for decisions made and gains the support of others.
Responsible for supply continuity, lead time improvements, and regional savings targets.
Actively identifies gaps, proposes, and implement changes necessary to cover supplier risks.
Drive and deliver cost savings opportunities aligned with organization commitments.
Develop vendor management strategy to reduce and consolidate global vendors for Operations.
What We’re Seeking
Bachelors Degree required; MBA, MS in Engineering, MS in Supply Chain Management or preferred.
Proven experience in the Hardware, Software, and Infrastructure procurement category.
Strong knowledge in sourcing and/or category management roles that drive current procurement practices and next generation methodologies.
Successful history of leveraging global deals and collaboration with internal technical stakeholders to set procurement roadmaps and strategy.
Ability to apply knowledge and experience with relevant global suppliers and deal structures within negotiation process for favorable business outcome.
An individual that thrives on applying critical thinking and creative problem-solving approaches to solve tactical challenges.
Demonstrates adaptability for working in diverse environments.
Strong experience applying financial acumen to identify strategic cost-savings, manage efficiencies, and implement change.
Ability and willingness to travel occasionally.
Our Offer to You
A culture and work environment strongly reflecting our core values: Act Like an Owner, Delight Our Customers and Earn the Respect of Others.
The opportunity to make a difference by leveraging your unique strengths.
Highly competitive compensation and rewards.
Flexible work options, opportunities to give back to your community, social events with colleagues and a comprehensive benefits program inclusive of progressive parental leave.
Why Make a Move to FICO?
At FICO, you can develop your career with a leading organization in one of the fastest-growing fields in technology today – Big Data analytics. You’ll play a part in our commitment to help businesses use data to improve every choice they make, using advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, predictive and prescriptive modeling, and much more.
FICO makes a real difference in the way businesses operate worldwide:
Credit Scoring — 150+ billion FICO Scores have been sold to date, making it the most used credit score in the world.
Fraud Detection and Security — 2.6+ billion payment cards globally are protected by FICO fraud systems.
Lending — 3/4 of US mortgages are approved using the FICO Score.
Anti-Money Laundering — our solutions check more than half a billion transactions a day to prevent criminal schemes such as terrorist financing
Global trends toward digital transformation have created tremendous demand for FICO’s solutions, placing us among the world’s top 100 software companies by revenue. We support many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, telecommunications providers and other firms reach a new level of success.
Our success is dependent on really talented people – just like you – who thrive on the collaboration and innovation that’s nurtured by a diverse and inclusive environment. We’ll provide the support you need, while ensuring you have the freedom to develop your skills and grow your career. Join FICO and help change the way business thinks!
Learn more about how you can fulfill your potential at www.fico.com/Careers
FICO values the benefit that diversity and a culture of inclusion bring to our workplace. We are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and we’re proud to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

HR Transformation Consultant Job Description
A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients' opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50+ year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of 200,000 team members in over 40 countries. The Group reported 2017 global revenues of EUR 12.8 billion. Visit us at www.capgemini.com. People matter, results count.
Industry: Information Technology and Services
Company size: 200,000+ employees
Headquarters: Paris, France
Type: Public Company
Founded: 1967
Specialties: Consulting, Technology, Outsourcing, Business Technology, Process Consulting, Package Based Solutions, Custom Solution Development, Application Management, Business Information Management, and Artificial Intelligence

Join Capgemini and drive automation and innovation for leading global organizations and corporations. Business is not usual. Today we see multiple shifts occurring simultaneously. Shifts that are broad, complex, and at high velocity and are driving new levels of disruption and value creation. The risks of not acting or acting in yesterday’s innovation paradigms are far too great. The current situation demands doing something beyond the ordinary. Organizations must confront the new realities and develop an intrinsic ability to apply innovation.
Capgemini’s HR Transformation approach helps frame and implement the solution to modern problems in volatile, uncertain, complex, and ambiguous situations.
Principle Duties and Responsibilities
As a HR Transformation Leader within Capgemini’s Business Services Global Business Line the following set of responsibilities and duties exists. Deliver agile strategies, recommendations and solutions that will overall improve our client’s HR employee experience and HR outcomes. Constantly promoting Capgemini’s Digital Employee Operations (DEO) and Digital Learning Operations (DLO) practice, its principles while leveraging our assets. Specifically, within our DEO offering, our HR Transformation Consultants, along with improving the employee experience, will drive to adjust and manage our client’s efforts to move transactional back-office to the front office. Additionally, engage our clients in rethinking their process and HR administration operations to drive the best experience at an optimal cost. With Capgemini’s intelligent automation, our consultants help our clients to make the best use of their HCM investment through a range of intelligent automation solutions with front office live chats, chatbot, and knowledge portals to back office Robotic Process Automation (RPA) offerings.
You will partner with clients to develop and deliver HR Operating Models that will improve HR administrative operations efficiencies. Support detail assessments, design sessions, design and build requirements, support development and implementation of the to-be HR organization processes and strategies to leverage Digital HCM platforms Workday, Success Factors, Oracle, and SAP.
Minimum 10 years of external consulting experience or other relevant experience related to successful delivery of HR Transformation.
Pre-sales, or Solution shaping as part of Business Development life cycle for Consulting Services
Minimum 3 years of experience in one or more of the following HCM platforms: ServiceNow, Workday, Success Factors, Oracle, PeopleSoft, and SAP
Bachelor’s Degree required. Ability to independently understand and transition into Capgemini’s methodologies and approaches. Support sales cycle with RFP/RFI/RFQ development. Demonstrated ability to influence at all levels of management. Strategic thinker who understands the ever-changing Human Resource market. Demonstrated ability to transition HR Services to BPO delivery centers. Ability to build, develop and implement and engage in new service delivery approaches; possibly different from the status quo. Comfort in identifying and communicating complex problems; takes an analytical and creative approach with problem solving. Energetic, passionate, highly self-motivated, collaborative, organized individual driven to execute flawlessly in a fast-paced, ever changing, dynamic environment. Experienced with creating thoughtful presentations in clear action driven and outcome-oriented ways. Ability to meet travel requirements where needed.

job_description:

JOB DESCRIPTION
Amazon’s Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT) Forecasting team is looking for a passionate, results-oriented, and inventive leader to lead our product and analytics efforts toward building the next generation forecasts for the 100’s of millions of products sold on Amazon worldwide. The team’s charter is to create the machine learning and software platforms that supports various demand forecasting models that are used by over a hundred supply chain software systems to serve Amazon’s retail businesses world-wide. Within Amazon's Supply Chain Optimization Technology (SCOT) team, Forecasting uses Deep Learning to predict customer demand for every product offering anywhere in the world. These predictions drive automated decisions about what inventory to buy and where to put it, all in an effort to ensure that Amazon's customers can buy the things they want and have them delivered as quickly as possible.

The successful candidate is one who thrives in a fast-paced environment, is an exceptionally strong analytical thinker, can define a vision for products in early stages, and can earn trust from business stakeholders worldwide. This leader will manage a team of Product Managers, Business Analysts, and Business Intelligence Engineers. They will be responsible for driving business insight, team operations, metrics definition, as well as managing the scale of our products and support for those products globally for the consumer business. This person will have direct responsibility for product management, analytics and metrics tools, cross team communications, and mechanism improvement. This is a strategic, data-driven role that has the opportunity to influence the global expansion and scaling strategy of Amazon supply chain technology. This leader will also own new programs as needed by the business in order to improve processes, increase team productivity and drive toward execution excellence. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in an exciting and core area of Amazon’s supply chain.

Key Responsibilities:
Foster culture of continuous product and analytics improvement through mentoring, feedback, and metricsDeliver vision for a suite of productsOwn and champion operational excellence through establishment of group-wide metrics for measurement with a consistent, regular process for assessment and improvementInterface with a diverse customer base to understand requirements, priorities, and processesSet clear, measurable quality goals for an organization in a data-driven wayHave the obsession to drive a better customer experience through everything that we do here at AmazonBring innovative ideas to the table every day, in order to find better ways of accomplishing our customer objectivesRaise the bar on functionality, flow, consistency, usability, and simplicity continually; guard the world-class supply chain experience at AmazonMentor and promote your team members

Experience with analytics and large data setsExperience with forecastingExperience working with scientists and engineers on machine learning (ML) or artificial intelligence (AI)Experience with AWS technologies

Accenture Scientific Informatics Services (ASIS) combines the scientific and laboratory informatics expertise with Accenture’s strategic and business consulting capabilities, industry platforms, innovation approach and global scale to help transform how scientific and laboratory processes are conducted across a variety of industries—helping make them faster, more efficient and more effective than ever before.

As an Accenture Scientific Informatics Services (ASIS) Consultant you will be exposed to the technologies and processes that many leading US companies and government agencies utilize. We offer a generous compensation package consisting of salary, bonuses and benefits.

job_title_origin: Procurement Category Senior Manager (Hardware, Software, Infrastructure)
job_description:
FICO (NYSE: FICO) is a leading global analytics software company, helping businesses in 90+ countries make better decisions. Join our world-class team today and fulfill your career potential!
Job Summary
Job Description
Role: Procurement Category Senior Manager (Hardware, Software, Infrastructure)
The Opportunity
“ The Procurement Category Senior Manager, Global Procurement for Hardware, Software and Infrastructure is a critical role within the FICO Procurement team. The successful candidate must be able to both manage a team and provide functional leadership within this specific procurement category. In addition, the role will partner with the key business units to drive supply continuity, reduced lead times and deliver leveraged value/savings aligned with the business needs. ” – Director of Procurement
What You’ll Contribute
Negotiate deals in the procurement categories of Hardware, Software, and Infrastructure.
Support key initiatives such as Source-to-Pay rollout, Business Intelligence, process efficiencies, and controls to ensure adherence to procurement governance.
Collaborates with key stakeholders, including the CTO, Product, and IT teams to ensure engagement, buy-in and ownership of key sourcing strategies.
Brainstorm and provide feedback, category planning, and best practices in supply and procurement organizations.
Makes decisions that support the function's strategy; takes personal accountability for decisions made and gains the support of others.
Responsible for supply continuity, lead time improvements, and regional savings targets.
Actively identifies gaps, proposes, and implement changes necessary to cover supplier risks.
Drive and deliver cost savings opportunities aligned with organization commitments.
Develop vendor management strategy to reduce and consolidate global vendors for Operations.
What We’re Seeking
Bachelors Degree required; MBA, MS in Engineering, MS in Supply Chain Management or preferred.
Proven experience in the Hardware, Software, and Infrastructure procurement category.
Strong knowledge in sourcing and/or category management roles that drive current procurement practices and next generation methodologies.
Successful history of leveraging global deals and collaboration with internal technical stakeholders to set procurement roadmaps and strategy.
Ability to apply knowledge and experience with relevant global suppliers and deal structures within negotiation process for favorable business outcome.
An individual that thrives on applying critical thinking and creative problem-solving approaches to solve tactical challenges.
Demonstrates adaptability for working in diverse environments.
Strong experience applying financial acumen to identify strategic cost-savings, manage efficiencies, and implement change.
Ability and willingness to travel occasionally.
Our Offer to You
A culture and work environment strongly reflecting our core values: Act Like an Owner, Delight Our Customers and Earn the Respect of Others.
The opportunity to make a difference by leveraging your unique strengths.
Highly competitive compensation and rewards.
Flexible work options, opportunities to give back to your community, social events with colleagues and a comprehensive benefits program inclusive of progressive parental leave.
Why Make a Move to FICO?
At FICO, you can develop your career with a leading organization in one of the fastest-growing fields in technology today – Big Data analytics. You’ll play a part in our commitment to help businesses use data to improve every choice they make, using advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, predictive and prescriptive modeling, and much more.
FICO makes a real difference in the way businesses operate worldwide:
Credit Scoring — 150+ billion FICO Scores have been sold to date, making it the most used credit score in the world.
Fraud Detection and Security — 2.6+ billion payment cards globally are protected by FICO fraud systems.
Lending — 3/4 of US mortgages are approved using the FICO Score.
Anti-Money Laundering — our solutions check more than half a billion transactions a day to prevent criminal schemes such as terrorist financing
Global trends toward digital transformation have created tremendous demand for FICO’s solutions, placing us among the world’s top 100 software companies by revenue. We support many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, telecommunications providers and other firms reach a new level of success.
Our success is dependent on really talented people – just like you – who thrive on the collaboration and innovation that’s nurtured by a diverse and inclusive environment. We’ll provide the support you need, while ensuring you have the freedom to develop your skills and grow your career. Join FICO and help change the way business thinks!
Learn more about how you can fulfill your potential at www.fico.com/Careers
FICO values the benefit that diversity and a culture of inclusion bring to our workplace. We are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and we’re proud to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

The Autonomous Driving firmware team is responsible for the low-level firmware associated with NIO Autonomous Driving programs. The team is responsible for the full life-cycle of software development from hardware board bring up to product launch and to sustaining development. You will collaborate with other teams from around the world to develop NIO’s autonomous driving systems.
Responsibilities:
Technical manager for major embedded software systems through the entire product life cycle, from software requirements, design, implementation, tests, release and maintenance.
Facilitate design discussions and code reviews.
Plan resources, manage priorities and deliver on commitments.
Engage in sprint planning and prioritization.
Qualifications:
5+ years of experience managing a team of 5 or more people.
10+ years of experience development embedded systems including experience as a software or system solutions architect.
Hands-on experience with system development and hardware product integration.
Experience delivering major products to mass production.
Experience with microcontrollers and software design from scratch of a complete software product.
Exceptional C, C++ programming skills.
Hands-on experience with general Software Quality Assurance methodologies and Safety Critical embedded firmware (ISO26262 or other like IEC 61508, DO-178C).
Experience in Software Development Lifecycle (e.g. Agile).
Experience using bug tracking systems (e.g. Jira).
Experience with code coverage and static analysis tools.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with multi-site organizations.
Experience with automotive networks such as CAN and Ethernet.
Knowledge of existing ADAS technologies such as adaptive cruise control, automatic emergency braking, and lane keeping.
Knowledge about security and encryption standards.
About NIO

NIO Inc. is a pioneer in China’s premium electric vehicle market. Founded in November 2014, NIO’s mission is to shape a joyful lifestyle by offering premium smart electric vehicles and being the best user enterprise. NIO designs, jointly manufactures, and sells smart and connected premium electric vehicles, driving innovations in next generation technologies in connectivity, autonomous driving and artificial intelligence. Redefining the user experience, NIO provides users with comprehensive, convenient and innovative charging solutions and other user-centric services. NIO began deliveries of the ES8, a 7-seater high-performance premium electric SUV in China in June 2018, and its variant, the six-seater ES8, in March 2019. NIO officially launched the ES6, a 5-seater high-performance premium electric SUV, in December 2018 and began deliveries in June 2019. NIO officially launched the EC6, a 5-seater smart premium electric Coupe SUV, in December 2019 and plans to commence deliveries in 2020.

Equal Employment Opportunity
NIO is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, color, age, sex, ancestry, marital status, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, present or past history of mental disability, genetic information or any other classification protected by state or federal law.

NIO US is an E-Verify employer.

The School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS), within the College of Engineering at Oregon State University, invites applications for Instructors in the Computer Science (CS) undergraduate program. Available Instructor positions are fixed-term, non-tenure track, 12 month full-time (1.0 FTE) positions, with the possibility of renewal at the discretion of the School Head. The closing date for this posting may be adjusted without prior notification to applicants.

The School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science is a leader in undergraduate educational innovation. With programs including TekBots, the online Post-Baccalaureate degree in CS, and the Center for Applied Software Solutions (CASS), EECS engages students at all levels for real-world experiences and opportunities. With a strong research strength, teaching coursework is continually improved to respond to the most current needs of industry and academia.

The OSU College of Engineering is committed to being recognized as a national model of inclusivity and collaboration. We strive to develop a community of faculty, students, and staff that is inclusive, collaborative, diverse and centered on student success. As such, we seek applicants who will broaden our capacity to advance student success across individual identities, racial/ethnic categories and socioeconomic backgrounds.
Position Duties
90% Instruction
Computer Science instructors prepare and teach course materials in one or more areas of CS including, but not limited to, the following: Introductory Programming, Data Structures, Algorithms, Databases, Artificial Intelligence, Operating Systems, Networking, Security, Web and Cloud Development, and Mobile Development.
Responsibilities include equipping students with the required skill set, assessing student performance, and/or preparing students to be successful leaders in their chosen profession.
Instructors may assist in driving curriculum design and development.
Responsibilities also include creating an inclusive classroom (e.g., mentoring and supporting students from diverse backgrounds, and fostering affirming classroom interactions across different and challenging structural/cultural barriers that limit movement towards social equity in engineering education and practice).
5% Supervision
Instructors provide leadership, supervision, and direction for graduate and undergraduate teaching assistants, as well as student workers.
5% Professional Development
Instructors engage in training, continuing education, and other professional development activities contributing to effectiveness as an instructor.
Minimum/Required Qualifications
Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field
(or Bachelors Degree in the same fields with 8+ years experience in those industries)
Experience teaching, mentoring and facilitating learners, inside or outside a classroom setting.Deep understanding in one or more areas of need in the CS program (specifically: Introductory Programming, Data Structures, Algorithms, Databases, Artificial Intelligence, Operating Systems, Networking, Security, Web and Cloud Development, and Mobile Development)
Demonstrable commitment to promoting and enhancing diversity.Excellent written and verbal English skills.
Preferred (Special) Qualifications
Doctorate in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field.Strong interpersonal communication skills.
Working Conditions / Work Schedule This position requires a clear and unambiguous commitment to compliance of all National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) regulations for Division I (FBS) universities. No

At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. The fifth-largest bank in the United States, we’re one of the country's most respected, innovative and successful financial institutions. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

U.S. Bank is seeking a Software Engineering Manager for our Digital Banking Platform (mobile and online banking) with design and development experience to contribute toward the success of our technology initiatives. He/she will be responsible for development and support of the artificial intelligence engine within the digital banking applications.

You will be responsible for architecting and implementing high performing mobile applications on iOS and/or Android. We are super serious about application performance, complex and engaging UI and integrated experience across multiple applications. You'll work closely with the engineers on your team as well Product, Design, QA and other partner teams to deliver well-engineered experiences that delight our customers.


The overall team is a combination of employees, contractors, and off shore developers. This position will include application design, development oversight, and coordination with other groups within the bank to deliver the overall solution. You will own release schedules in our fast-paced environment, and work closely with software engineers, QA, product managers and field testers to get high-quality products and new features built, tested, and released on time. You will coordinate lots of fast-changing, moving parts and still get them to come together as a product. You'll need excellent communication skills to be the go-to person for all questions about release schedules, quality and progress updates.


Key Responsibilities

Manage technical projects or programs, working closely with product managers, engineers and technical staff to develop and track release milestones and schedules for the many moving parts that need to come together.
Develop a plan and schedule with well-defined milestones.
Manage communication of progress/status within the core team and external to the team; escalate issues as necessary.
Assess the quality of releases through monitoring of incoming bugs and code changes to identify quality issues and trends.
Develop tools and processes to improve software engineering productivity.


Successful applicants will exemplify US Bank's ethical principles of uncompromising integrity, respect for others, accountability for decisions and actions, and good citizenship.


Leaders at U.S. Bank consistently demonstrate integrity and ethics, maturity and resilience, and inspire trust and confidence among their teams. Our leaders are strong communicators who promote collaborative relationships, influence others, and value the diversity of backgrounds and ideas among their employees


Qualifications

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent work experience10 or more years of experience with developing and implementing applicationsFour or more years of experience with major tasks, deliverables, formal methodologies and disciplines for delivering new or enhanced applications

Preferred Skills/Experience

Hands on experience developing native IOS, Android or web applicationsFive or more years of managerial experienceExperience managing a front end development teamStrong understanding on mobile design principles, patterns and best practices
Strong analytical skills and ability to review code.
Proven experience in both small and medium size teams
Proven ability to architect mobile application and adopt and improve existing architecture
Strong collaboration skills with peers
Good development background
Coordinate multiple streams of work and plan releases
Strong object oriented programming and design skills
Excellent communication skills written and verbal
Good proven track record of development sustainable governance processes
Experience leading in agile development teams
Web API and REST architecture
Experience with HTML/JS / ReactNative is a strong plus
Experience with Git, Scrum, Kanban
Agile development experience
Strong estimation and resource planning skills
Ability to interact with Business line leaders and develop consensus and obtain buy in Banking experience

Introduction
Axtria is a global provider of cloud software and data analytics to the Life Sciences industry. We help Life Sciences companies transform the product commercialization journey to drive sales growth and improve healthcare outcomes for patients. We are acutely aware that our work impacts millions of patients and lead passionately to improve their lives.
About us……..
Since our founding in 2010, technology innovation has been our winning differentiation, and we continue to leapfrog competition with platforms that deploy Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our cloud-based platforms - Axtria DataMax™, Axtria InsightsIQ™, Axtria SalesIQ™, and Axtria MarketingIQ™ - enable customers to efficiently manage data, leverage data science to deliver insights for sales and marketing planning, and manage end-to-end commercial operations. With customers in over 30 countries, Axtria is one of the biggest global commercial solutions providers in the Life Sciences industry. We continue to win industry recognition for growth and are featured in some of the most aspirational lists - INC 5000, Deloitte FAST 500, NJBiz FAST 50, SmartCEO Future 50, Red Herring 100, and several other growth and technology awards.
Axtria is looking for exceptional talent to join our rapidly growing global team. People are our biggest perk! Our transparent and collaborative culture offers a chance to work with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Axtria Institute, our in-house university, offers the best training in the industry and an opportunity to learn in a structured environment. A customized career progression plan ensures every associate is setup for success and able to do meaningful work in a fun environment. We want our legacy to be the leaders we produce for the industry. Will you be next?
Candidates will be expected to have familiarity with application of analytics to sales and marketing problems such as:-
Commercial Model Design, Sales Force Sizing and Structure
Patient analytics using Real-World Data sources such as anonymized longitudinal patient claims data, lab/diagnostic testing data, etc.
Segmentation, Targeting, , Promotion Response Modeling, Marketing Mix Optimization, Digital Analytics
Market Access Analytics incl. pull-through analysis, Payer-plan segmentation, Rebate optimization, etc
Territory Alignment, Sales Call Planning, Incentive Compensation
Responsibilities: -
Lead cross-functional teams to pilot and implement client solutions with a focus on client satisfaction across a solution area and industry verticals.
Leverage and customize Axtria's proprietary analytics to client needs, resulting in exceptional client value from every project.
Manage multiple concurrent projects ensuring exceptional client satisfaction and on-time delivery.
Work closely with the Technology and Product Management groups to ensure ongoing refinement of our analytical tools and development of new client solutions.
Make presentations and recommendations to clients on optimal customer, sales and marketing strategies and tactics.
Develop and maintain skills to the highest standards consistent with best practices and emerging trends in analytics.
Contribute to Axtria's development of new solutions and analytical models.
Recruit, manage and mentor a team of analysts
Required Skills/Experience: -
A degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field with 6-10 years of prior relevant work experience. Graduate degree is preferred.
Relevant expertise in using analytic tools such as Excel, ProgR, SAS, SPSS, SQL, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, and able to quickly master new packages when needed
Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate actionable analytical findings to a non-technical audience in clear and concise language.
Proven ability to frame a business issue, design the right solution, and deliver results.
Ability to lead projects and teams
Experience with the application of statistical estimation techniques and / or optimization techniques
Exposure to / experience working with large data sets.
Familiarity / expertise in using Pharmaceutical data sets such a prescriber-plan data, patient level data, transactional claims, EMR/EHR data, SPP Hub data, diagnostic data etc. is a plus.

Bristol-Myers Squibb is a global Biopharma company committed to a single mission: to discover, develop, and deliver innovative medicines focused on helping millions of patients around the world in disease areas such as oncology, cardiovascular, immunoscience and fibrosis.
Join us and make a difference. We hire the best people and provide them with a work environment that places a premium on diversity, integrity, collaboration and personal development. Through a culture of inclusion, we create a better, more productive work environment. We believe that the diverse experiences and perspectives of all our employees help to drive innovation and transformative business results.
The GPS (Global Product and Supply) Analytics and Data Science team within Business Insights and Analytics partners with the BMS GPS organization to support data analytics for all key functions within GPS including Manufacturing Operations. GPS Analytics focuses on answering key business questions that will drive prioritized business decisions using advanced analytics and data science. The Manufacturing Operations organization at BMS supports drug product manufacturing from commercialization through end of lifecycle. Manufacturing Operations scope includes Plant Operations, Science & Technology (MS&T), Internal Manufacturing, External Manufacturing and Network Strategy and Business Operations. The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics will partner with the Associate Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to answer key business questions within the Internal Manufacturing Operations space with an emphasis on the Biologics Operations. The successful candidate has a background in Manufacturing Operations and has expertise in one or more of the following areas: data analytics, data visualization, statistics, machine learning, predictive modeling, artificial intelligence, Python and ProgR, coding, ProgR, Shiny app development, and Tableau/Spotfire dashboard development.
The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics and Data Science will partner with the Associate Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to establish core capabilities within the team, namely:
Supporting Business Decisions – Work closely with business stakeholders to proactively identify and address priority business questions within Manufacturing Operations.
Driving Analytics and Capabilities – Answer key business questions using innovative analytic and data science techniques, assist with establishing core analytical and data science capabilities, standards, processes and methodologies for the team.
Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence – Play a critical role in managing team productivity, timeliness and quality of deliverables. Ensure consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff. Continuously seek opportunities and approaches for enhancing the team’s overall productivity.
Supporting Business Decisions
Identifies and contextualizes critical business issues, working to embed an objective and unbiased point of view into the business conversation.
Drives the application of fact based decision making for key questions within the Manufacturing portfolio enabling priority business choices.
Develops and maintains a deep understanding of Manufacturing, and plant operations business priorities, meeting agreed upon analytics deliverables / timing.

A trusted partner. A national resource. A leader in national security space. We are THE Aerospace Corporation. A team that takes pride in our readiness to solve some of the most complex technical challenges in existence. With challenges spanning government to commercial, you’ll have the unique opportunity to work on projects that are literally evolving our nation's space and launch capabilities. We all share a common passion and aspiration – to serve a mission much bigger than ourselves. When you join our team, you’ll be part of a rare collection of thought leaders and game-changing innovators. Are you ready to launch your career?

Responsibilities
The Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Department seeks a creative and enthusiastic Data Science Project Leader to join a diverse team of engineers, data scientists, and programmers with a passion for machine and deep learning, data analytics, natural language processing, statistical analysis, and computer vision. We are a growing, innovative, and collaborative department that makes meaningful contributions to National Security Space (AF, Space Force, NRO, etc.), and Civil and Commercial customers (NASA, MDA, DHS, etc.).
The ideal candidate has a strong team and project leadership experience, and knowledge in one or more of the following disciplines: Data Science, Applied or Theoretical Machine Learning, Deep Neural Networks, Classification Systems, Clustering, Natural Language Processing, and Artificial intelligence. They are also team-oriented, takes initiative, focused on developing cutting-edge technologies and frameworks, and are comfortable balancing a variety of projects spanning internally funded research and development to direct customer support for mission-critical space systems.

Key Functions

Interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams. Work closely with engineers and subject matter experts to identify opportunities and implement improvements to data analytics.
Be a champion of Data Science and Machine/Deep Learning by fostering relationships and collaborative opportunities throughout the corporation and external peer organizations in the interest of National Security Space
Solve difficult and non-routine analytics problems while prototyping and building analytics tools and pipelines
Build and lead high-functioning teams of data scientists and software developers

This position is available as Data Science Project Leader or Sr. Data Science Project Leader

Required for Data Science Project Engineer

Master’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field and strong knowledge of machine learning
The ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance, which is issued by the U.S. government. U.S. citizenship is required to obtain a security clearance.

Familiarity with a broad set of supervised and unsupervised ML-based solutions to complex problems in business, science, or engineering

Experience working and/or leading effectively data science or software engineering teams
Typically, eight or more years of relevant experience in the industry and/or academia

Typically, twelve or more years of relevant experience in the industry and/or academia

Preferred

Ph.D in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field and strong knowledge of machine learning
Active TS/SCI security clearance
Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills
Strong programming skills utilizing Scikit-learn, OpenCV, Keras and/or Tensorflow libraries
Experience with machine learning methods like random forests, logistic regression, neural networks, k-nearest neighbors, etc…

Experience with big data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, etc.)

Company Statement
The Aerospace Corporation has provided independent technical and scientific research, development, and advisory services to national security space programs since 1960. We operate a federally funded research and development center (FFRDC) for the United States Air Force and the National Reconnaissance Office, and support all national security space programs. We also apply more than 50 years of experience with space systems to provide critical solutions to technologically complex systems in such areas as communications, shipping, law enforcement, and cyber, among others.
From our inception, our highly skilled technical staff has focused on ensuring the success of every mission and developing the most effective and economic space-related hardware and software in the world. Our greatest asset is the technical expertise of our people. Our state-of-the-art laboratory facilities are staffed by some of the leading scientists in the world.
All Aerospace employees working in organizations with technical responsibilities are required to apply for and maintain at least a Secret clearance. U.S. citizenship is required for those positions.

job_description:
Rail and Transportation Business Development Manager
Rail and Transportation Business Development Manager
We are seeking to fill the position of Rail and Transportation Business Development Manager. This position is based in Jacksonville, FL. The Rail and Transportation Business Development position reports to the VP of Sales and Marketing. This role is responsible for positioning Duos Technologies to facilitate revenue growth by leveraging our brand products and services, while maintaining the business unit’s sales targets to meet company objectives. The successful candidate will have extensive rail industry experience to leverage new and existing contacts to develop partner channels in the freight and transit rail markets with specific emphasis in mechanical inspection, electronic security solutions, automation solutions and operational service applications. The role requires a detail-oriented individual with exceptional written and verbal communication skills. The candidates’ goals will be accomplished through multiple activities including developing strategies and tactics with the partner for quotes, bids and project or program capture. The candidate will help partners with their differentiation of duostech products and services, market penetration, and revenue and margin growth to achieve quota.
We specialize in developing, implementing and supporting integrated advanced technology systems to address complex business challenges. Our core proprietary technologies focus on passenger and freight rail, correctional facilities, security, and distribution centers gatehouse automation/logistics. Our proprietary applications include artificial intelligence, deep learning/machine vision video analytics-based security applications, intelligent process controls, and information technologies for a wide range of global customers. For more information, please visit our website at http://www.duostech.com/.
Responsibilities:
Recruit, acquire, develop and manage key strategic clients and channel partners
Develop and maintain relationships with clients and partners through identification of key decision makers and managing and building relationships in the Rail and Transportation market segment
Identify and assess potential business opportunities in the freight and transit Rail markets and provide feedback to our engineering and R&D teams
Support partners with project proposals, bidding and presentations to successfully capture projects
Support partners by answering complex questions pertaining to product features, functions, licensing, integration and program or project requirements
Participate in sales forecasting and planning in an effective manner by assisting with researching, developing, and maintaining long and short range sales and marketing plans
Monitor, analyze and communicate monthly sales data and targets
Drive continual training activities which articulate duostech strategic direction, product and technology, sales strategies, go-to-market efforts, demand creation and marketing programs and communications
Develop an in-depth understanding of duostech products, programs, projects and sales methodology
Work closely with Marketing to provide project and content coordination in support of partner-driven marketing events with support from marketing and channel strategy resources
Supports key marketing activities necessary to support sales growth, road shows, conferences, tradeshows, sales trainings, and various sales engagement activities
This position requires extensive travel throughout North America
Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in sales or channel marketing
Background in Freight and/or Transit Rail Market is a must
Experience developing and managing channel partners and programs to meet and exceed sales quotas
Excellent negotiation skills/techniques with channel partners and clients as well as internal delivery teams for successful execution of sales targets
Understands how to develop an ROI rationale for our rail customer ecosystem
Understands how the automation of mechanical inspections and security and integrated products and systems create value for customers
Understands national and regional technology marketplace requirements and trends
Knowledge of and extensive contacts/relationships within the rail, transit and systems integrator community to facilitate the development of strategic teaming relationships is a must
Proven ability to navigate through the partner’s organization
Proven ability to leverage internal and external resources to achieve sales objectives
Successful track record of relationship management in the freight and transit rail industry

Generous compensation package with incentives based on performance. Benefit package includes paid group health, dental, life, and disability insurance plus voluntary vision, critical illness and off the job accident insurance, non-matching 401(k) plan, and paid vacation and sick days.
To apply please submit a detailed resume, and if qualified, our Human Resources will administer a mandatory questionnaire.
Duos Technologies, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and employees or applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.
Duos Technologies, Inc. is a Drug Free Workplace. An offer of employment is contingent upon satisfactory results of a pre-employment drug screening, and a background check.

AWS Applications bring the power of AWS to intuitive applications that use technology like machine learning and robust analytics to help our customers stay ahead of their changing business needs. Our growing portfolio of business applications leverage the power and scale of AWS services to remove the undifferentiated heavy lifting that business users go through daily. As part of our team, you will play a key role in defining and developing the next generation of applications that will be used by millions of people every day.

We are building a new category of AWS Applications that will make customer-centric technology developed to support Amazon.com available to AWS customers. We will leverage the power of Artificial Intelligence and the large ecosystem of AWS services such as SageMaker, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3, and Amazon QuickSight to provide a truly frustration-free, easy-to-use, extensible, and natural customer experience. With this new category of services, we will transform business operations across industries. In our team you will have the unique opportunity to build an AWS service from the ground up. You will influence technical design and product direction and work across the stack from cloud-based services to web apps, collaborating with peer teams across Amazon.

Our team is growing quickly and we’re looking for a Software Development Manager to help us continue to hire and grow the team and set technical direction. You will help teams imagine and implement new products, define and scale our architecture, work closely with senior technical leaders within the team and across AWS. You’ll drive a culture that values operational excellence, security, customer focus, and continuous improvement.

You will manage the engineering team that owns the platform on which we build all applications in this new category of services. You will be working on the design and development of services and you will manage a high-functioning team and hire aggressively to build and drive our vision going forward. With a strong leadership and a culture of challenge, support, and feedback, you will grow your skills and talents so you can scale with the new opportunities that arise as the organization expands.

You will guide a diverse, smart, and hardworking team. We are parents, artists, adventurers, and athletes who enjoy time outside of the office. We’ve worked hard to create a trusting, collaborative, diverse, and supportive atmosphere. We’re looking for a positive, enthusiastic, driven, and personable manager to continue this work environment and lead this team.

Grant Thornton LLP (Grant Thornton) is the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd, one of the world’s leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms. We’ve never been a typical professional services firm. We put people first, and that is what sets us apart.

Innovative and disruptive technologies pose specific challenges to organizations, and particularly the tax functions within them. At Grant Thornton, we’re investing in people who understand innovation and disruptive technology to help organizations in capitalizing on the advantages presented by these new opportunities.

Why Join Tax Consulting?

At Grant Thornton, Tax consulting manages, automates, analyzes and visualizes data to support tax initiatives. We seek to incorporate both AI (specifically machine learning and neural networks), as well as blockchain, in these endeavors.

We work with complex multinational companies to understand the regulatory landscape and influence business decisions. If you have a desire to think globally in a fast-paced environment and influence important decisions in variety of business functions, then Tax consulting may be an area for you to consider.

Qualifications

Baseline Requirements

1-2 years of programming related courses
Java, C++ or .NET (C# or VB) preferred
Database architecture; creating queries and tables using Oracle or SQL server
Project management/project life-cycle knowledge with experience doing systems/business analysis

job_title_origin: Artificial Intelligence Application Business Development Manager
job_description:
Artificial Intelligence Application Business Development Manager
We are seeking to fill the position of Artificial Intelligence Application Business Development Manager. This is a full-time position, based in Jacksonville, FL and reports to the Chief Operating Officer. The role is responsible for positioning truevue360 to facilitate revenue growth by leveraging our brand products and services, while maintaining the business unit’s sales targets to meet company objectives. The successful candidate will be a creative technologist who excels at relationship building and/or can leverage existing contacts to facilitate direct sales and develop partner channels in diverse markets. The role requires a detail-oriented individual with exceptional written and verbal communication skills. The candidates’ goals will be accomplished through multiple activities including developing strategies and tactics with the partner for quotes, bids and project or program capture. The candidate will be instrumental in developing creative application concepts to present customers with disruptive AI solutions and help partners with their differentiation of truevue360 applications and services, market penetration, and revenue and margin growth to achieve quota.
We specialize in developing, implementing and supporting integrated advanced technology systems to address complex business challenges. Our core proprietary technologies focus on passenger and freight rail, correctional facilities, security, and distribution centers gatehouse automation/logistics. Our proprietary applications include artificial intelligence, deep learning/machine vision video analytics-based security applications, intelligent process controls, and information technologies for a wide range of global customers. For more information, please visit our parent company website at http://www.duostech.com/.
Responsibilities:
Recruit, acquire, develop and manage key strategic clients and channel partners
Develop and maintain relationships with clients and partners through identification of key decision makers and managing and building relationships in diversified markets
Identify and assess potential business opportunities in diverse markets and provide feedback to our engineering and R&D teams
Support partners with project proposals, bidding, and presentations to successfully capture projects
Support partners by answering complex questions pertaining to product features, functions, licensing, integration, and program or project requirements
Utilize a solutions-based sales process. Be prepared to uncover business pains, articulate ROI, and deliver customized product demonstrations to help prospects understand the importance of embracing the digital evolution and artificial intelligence.
Participate in sales forecasting and planning in an effective manner by assisting with researching, developing, and maintaining long- and short-range sales and marketing plans
Monitor, analyze, and communicate monthly sales data and targets
Drive continual training activities which articulate truevue360 strategic direction, product and technology, sales strategies, go-to-market efforts, demand creation, and marketing programs and communications
Develop an in-depth understanding of truevue360 products, programs, projects, and sales methodology
Work closely with Marketing to provide project and content coordination in support of partner-driven marketing events with support from marketing and channel strategy resources
Support key marketing activities necessary for sales growth, road shows, conferences, tradeshows, sales training, and various sales engagement activities
This position requires extensive travel throughout North America
Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in sales role (SaaS preferred)
Exposure to selling Artificial Intelligence applications/systems
Experience developing and managing channel partners and programs to meet and exceed sales quotas
Excellent negotiation skills/techniques with channel partners and clients as well as internal delivery teams for successful execution of sales targets
Exceptional English language written and verbal communication skills
Familiarity with data analysis, reporting, and CRM systems
Understanding of national and regional technology marketplace requirements and trends
Ability to analyze and understand channel partner organizations
Ability to leverage internal and external resources to achieve sales objectives
Proven ability to drive the sales process from plan to close
Successful track record of relationship management and sales

Generous compensation package with incentives based on performance. Benefit package includes paid group health, dental, life, and disability insurance plus voluntary vision, critical illness, off the job accident insurance, non-matching 401(k) plan, Employee Assistance Program, and paid vacation and sick days.
To apply please submit a detailed resume, and if qualified, our Human Resources will administer a mandatory questionnaire.
truevue360 is a wholly owned subsidiary of Duos Technologies Group, Inc. (Nasdaq: DUOT) and is an equal opportunity employer and employees or applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law.
truevue360 is a Drug Free Workplace. An offer of employment is contingent upon satisfactory results of a pre-employment drug screening, and a background check.

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent is required plus a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is required within a reasonable period of time. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.

Job Description:
Ready to be a leader with the company that is committed to pushing the limits of truly advanced technologies? At General Dynamics Mission Systems, we create the products and services that help our service members, intelligence analysts and first responders keep our nation safe. The work we do is so advanced, it’s often classified. If you want to put your talent in the spotlight, it’s waiting for you right now, right here.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.


As a seasoned team leader, the Senior Project Manager will develop and implement product strategies and roadmaps for a specific target product by analyzing markets and drive/maintain product acceptance in the market by integrating the work of research and development, manufacturing, marketing, sales, and service functions to solve market problems to meet corporate business objectives relating to revenue, margin, quality, and time-to-market. You’ll interface with customers to gain and maintain market specific knowledge and understanding of product use to formulate their requirements in a Market/Product Requirements Document and work with the marketing team in activities related to the products including competitive analysis and pricing, product requirements, development of marketing materials, and analysis of market trends. We’ll rely on you to use proposal plans and strategies to develop, define, and implement cohesive, integrated program, subcontractor, and material plans that achieve overall current and long term objectives of the program, business unit, and division, as well as develop WBS and WBS dictionary as baseline for scope definition and effective integrated cost/schedule management of the project.

What you’ll experience:
Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered
What you bring to the table:
A Bachelor’s degree or equivalent plus a minimum of 5 years relevant experience; or Master's degree plus a minimum of 3 years relevant experience
Exceptional organizational, analysis, and time management skills, attention to detail and accuracy, and ability to multi-task high priorities
Fully proficient ability to identify issues, track progress, and follow through on effective corrective actions based on data analysis and trends
Ability to develop and implement a product-oriented WBS and WBS Dictionary
Earned Value Management and scheduling tool experience
What sets you apart:
Creative thinking with the ability to resolve issues
Commitment to ongoing professional development
Team player who thrives in collaborative environments and revels in team success
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran

Associate’s degree in related discipline or equivalent is required plus a minimum of 7 years of relevant experience.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is required at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.

Job Description:
Imagine a world-class engineering environment. Now add a team of exceptional talent along with technologies that are so advanced they’re often classified. That’s what you’ll find at General Dynamics Mission Systems. Here you’ll lead amazing engineers as they invent the technologies, products and services that help our service members, intelligence analysts and first responders keep our nation safe. If you want the chance to lead, it’s time to bring your talent to General Dynamics Mission Systems.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.


The Principal Engineering Technician will act as a leader and mentor to new technicians, by providing technical expertise in problem analysis and solutions utilizing complex instrumentation and software. This will entail performing a wide variety of the most complex technical tasks to support, design, develop, modify and improve equipment, tools, processes, product, procedure and documentation. We seek a leader open to new ideas that will serve as a champion for change.


REPRESENTATIVE DUTIES AND TASKS:
Performs wide variety of the most complex technical tasks to support, design, develop, modify and improve equipment, tools, processes, product, procedure and documentation
Provide technical expertise in problem analysis and solutions utilizing complex instrumentation and software
Researches and evaluates comprehensive technical material
Analyzes results and implements procedures for problem resolution
Assists in the development of new/revised product and programs
Improvises, adapts, creates operating procedures to enhance quality, cycle time and customer satisfaction
Technical support lead in the development of prototypes
Trainer for less skilled technical personnel
Can be expected to lead, direct, organize Technician work
Works with associates and other departments and participates in cross-functional relationships
Develops test specifications and procedures as required
Prepares reports, documentation/specifications as required

REQUIREMENTS
Experience in Development and Implementation of New Processes in support of system testing, to include documenting, the processes performed during test article build.
Design and Procurement of Tooling and Equipment.
Responsible for Development and Deployment of Manufacturing Processes. Including;
Development of Detailed Process Work Instructions, Material Resource Planning, Shop
Floor Control, Process Team Leadership.
Control of Non-Conforming Material, Risk Identification and Mitigation, and implementation of Preventive and Corrective Action.
Interface with Design Engineers to evaluate New Product Design for Manufacturability and survivability of system deployment.
Setup facilities and equipment for the building of High Reliability Undersea Fiber Optic Hardware.
Develop and Implement Process Quality Goals and Performance Measurement Tools.
Analyze Process Performance Results and Deploy Responsive Action to ensure that Quality and performance goals are met.

KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
As a highly skilled specialist, contributes to the development of concepts and techniques
Completes complex tasks in creative and effective ways
Ability to generate documents, spreadsheet data analysis, test software and complex block
diagram creation
Understands technologies available to conduct business, when to use them and how to access them for business support
Ability to reuse technologies between multiple programs
Consistently works on complex assignments requiring independent action and a high degree of initiative to resolve issues
Acts independently to determine methods and procedures on new assignments
Provides direction to other employees with similar duties as required.
Often acts as a facilitator and team leader
Proficient in the application and interpretation of complex specifications, requirements, contracts, policies, standards and practices
Proficient in prioritizing and maintaining effective technical support of multiple tasks and assignments
Obtain certification in overhead Crane and forklift operation for the lifting and moving of heavy material.
Proficient and safe operation of power tools, hand tools and equipment required to build test articles.
Knowledge of optical test equipment for the measurement of optical conditions.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
Shows initiative on assignments, exercises independent judgment and professionally executes projects with little direction

What you’ll experience:
Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered
What you bring to the table:
An Associate’s degree in related discipline or equivalent plus a minimum of 7 years of relevant experience
Contributes to the development of concepts and techniques in creative and effective ways
Ability to generate documents, spreadsheet data analysis, test software and complex block diagram creation
Fully proficient in the application and interpretation of complex specifications, requirements, contracts, policies, standards and practices
What sets you apart:
Team player who thrives in collaborative environments and revels in team success
Commitment to ongoing professional development
Leads by initiative and example

With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency.
