job_title_origin: Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics and Data Science
job_description:
Bristol-Myers Squibb is a global Biopharma company committed to a single mission: to discover, develop, and deliver innovative medicines focused on helping millions of patients around the world in disease areas such as oncology, cardiovascular, immunoscience and fibrosis.


Join us and make a difference. We hire the best people and provide them with a work environment that places a premium on diversity, integrity, collaboration and personal development. Through a culture of inclusion, we create a better, more productive work environment. We believe that the diverse experiences and perspectives of all our employees help to drive innovation and transformative business results.


Bristol-Myers Squibb is a global biopharmaceutical company whose mission is to discover, develop and deliver innovative medicines that help patients prevail over serious diseases.


One shared journey is moving us forward at Bristol-Myers Squibb. Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious disease. Empowered to apply our individual talents and ideas so that we can learn and grow together. Driven to make a difference, from innovative research to hands-on community support. Bristol-Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.


The GPS (Global Product and Supply) Analytics and Data Science team within Business Insights and Analytics partners with the BMS GPS organization to support data analytics for all key functions within GPS including Manufacturing Operations. GPS Analytics focuses on answering key business questions that will drive prioritized business decisions using advanced analytics and data science. The Manufacturing Operations organization at BMS supports drug product manufacturing from commercialization through end of lifecycle. Manufacturing Operations scope includes Manufacturing, Science & Technology (MS&T), Internal Manufacturing, External Manufacturing and Network Strategy and Business Operations. The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics and Data Science will partner with the Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to answer key business questions within the Manufacturing Operations space. The successful candidate has a background in Manufacturing Operations and has expertise in one or more of the following areas: data analytics, data visualization, statistics, machine learning, predictive modeling, artificial intelligence, Python and ProgR, coding, ProgR, Shiny app development, and Tableau/Spotfire dashboard development.

The Manager, Manufacturing Operations Analytics and Data Science will partner with the Director of Manufacturing Operations Analytics to establish core capabilities within the team, namely:

Supporting Business Decisions - Work closely with business stakeholders to proactively identify and address priority business questions within Manufacturing Operations.
Driving Analytics and Capabilities - Answer key business questions using innovative analytic and data science techniques, assist with establishing core analytical and data science capabilities, standards, processes and methodologies for the team.
Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence - Play a critical role in managing team productivity, timeliness and quality of deliverables. Ensure consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff. Continuously seek opportunities and approaches for enhancing the team's overall productivity.

Supporting Business Decisions

Identifies and contextualizes critical business issues, working to embed an objective and unbiased point of view into the business conversation.
Drives the application of fact based decision making for key questions within the Manufacturing, Finance and Procurement portfolio's enabling priority business choices.
Develops and maintains a deep understanding of Manufacturing, Finance and Procurement business priorities, meeting agreed upon analytics deliverables / timing.

Driving Analytics and Capabilities

Designs, develops and implements a broad array of business analytics that solve complex problems in a computationally efficient and statistically effective manner.
Identifies new opportunities to further leverage analytics, data and analytical tools.
Ensures best practice adoption within stated areas of responsibility, applying appropriate levels of technical capability, standardization and subject matter expertise.
Proactively manages planned and ad hoc analytics requests, ensuring consistent quality and timeliness in delivery to business stakeholders.
Leverages standards for the provision of analytics to support planning and decision making processes, and utilizes appropriate escalation processes.
Provides input/feedback and works actively to improve and enhance capabilities related to the GPS BIA team
Supports culture of analytics and fact-based decision making through the utilization of standard methodologies and approaches.

Driving Team Productivity and Operational Excellence

Supervises and collaborates closely with external analytics contractors and vendors when applicable or assigned.
Conducts detailed team walkthroughs and peer review of team's work to ensure quality, cross training and knowledge management within the team.
Ensures consistent adoption of standards, processes and methodologies by contracted or other team staff.
Authors detailed documentation that describes analytics tool development, assumptions and input data and any specialized data treatments. Authors user manual for dissemination within Manufacturing Operations user base.

List of minimum requirements

BA/BS required (quantitative area of study or engineering)
MSci, MEng or other Masters in quantitative area of study, analytics or data science preferred

Experience - Responsibility and minimum number of years

5+ years hands-on working in the area of data science, data analytics, data integration, reporting.
5+ years of hands-on experience with analytics, modeling platforms, data manipulation software and visualization tools (e.g. Advanced SQL, PL/SQL, ProgR, Python, SAP HANA, Spotfire, Tableau, Microsoft Suite, Hadoop, Redshift).
Experience working in the manufacturing space.
Experience interpreting analytical results and ascertaining implications to the business.
Experience interacting with business stakeholders understanding, anticipating, and fulfilling their insight/analytical information requirements.
Experience managing a team of contracted resources.
Competencies - knowledge, skills, abilities, other
Strong creative problem solving skills to answer key business questions.
Ability to work with diverse teams across organizational lines and structures.
Strong project management skills with demonstrated ability to lead multiple projects and priorities.
Strong analytical skills with substantial knowledge of data analysis & data engineering.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to quickly gain and apply quality specific knowledge.
Ability to learn new tools quickly.
Proven ability to lead small teams/groups and manage a heavy workload.
Bristol-Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Our Software Security and Quality business is all about building secure software—faster. That starts with our static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis so our customers can build security and quality into the DNA of their code at any stage of the software development lifecycle and across the supply chain. All while minimizing risks and maximizing speed of application development. To find out more about SIG, Synopsys check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html.

Technical Lead – SaaS Platform

As the Technical Lead for SaaS Platform engineering, you will be joining the team that is building our state of art SaaS Platform that enables security and development teams to build secure, high-quality software faster.

You would collaborate with different teams in research & development group taking abstract concepts to elegant technical solutions in production with leadership and hands-on contribution thru design, development, testing and deployment. You would work across teams and organizations to ensure that the architecture and design are of high quality, stable, scalable and reliable. You would drive the technical design and the best engineering practices through design reviews, architecture reviews, hackathon activities and customer interactions.

Specific responsibilities include
Help define and drive technology vision, strategy and roadmap to build enterprise capabilities (scalability, fault tolerance, extensibility, maintainability etc.)
Hands-on implementation of the critical interfaces and complex modules of the systems and features
Collaborate with the engineering team to drive key design decisions, document / communicate architectural expectations and ensuring alignment
Hold engineers to the highest expectations and provide feedback on code and architectural approaches implemented by the team
Help teams disassemble and address complex technical issues
Stay abreast of industry trends, evaluate technologies to progress platform architecture
Partner with product managers to shape product definition and requirements so that it can be built in a flexible, extensible, and robust way
Collaborate with User Experience design team to increase product’s usability
Drive a culture of quality, technical curiosity, continuous improvement, and data-driven decision-making

Key Qualifications
12+ years of software development experience building and scaling enterprise customer facing products and services
Must have a track record of building, deploying and scaling distributed, highly available, large scale, high performing multi-tenant SaaS applications
Must have sound understanding of failure modes, resiliency patterns, and techniques to enable robust, self healing architecture
Must have experience building micro-services and customer facing APIs
Full-stack expertise and experience in Java technologies eco-system (spring, JPA, JMS…) and one of JavaScript technologies (React, Angular, Ember…)
Mastery in database technologies including RDBMS and NoSQL databases (PostGres / MySQL / Cassandra) and experience writing high performing queries
Experience and skills in global deployment patterns using cloud technologies and container technologies
Proven expertise and passion for continuous development - CI/CD
Customer-first and results-first mindset and the ability to make practical decisions when making engineering choices
Experience with at least one public cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure or GCP
BS/MS in Computer Science/Engineering, or equivalent experience

Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Who we are looking for

Rev.com is looking for a Sales Manager to join our growing sales team. This is an opportunity for a proven leader to build and scale a team to drive incredible results. You will be responsible for building and coaching a team, enabling them to sell, and driving new business.

You will also be responsible for articulating the value proposition relevant to the target audience, generating leads and sales opportunities, and closing deals to generate revenue. The ideal candidate will have experience in a high-growth/start-up technology environment. You will report into Rev's Head of Sales


You Will

Drive the team to exceed revenue targets through new client acquisition and install base expansion
Own pipeline for the entire Sales organization and run forecasts
Build and develop a sales team that is successful in identifying, qualifying, developing and closing new business
Build a culture of continued success and goal achievement through talent management, feedback, mentoring and training
Thoroughly understand the ins and outs of the AE team pipeline and accurately forecast bookings
Lead the AE team with a consistent vision of the future
Understand what the data is telling you to diagnose problems within the pipeline and propose solutions on how to solve those problems.
Collaborate with other teams including business development, customer success, marketing, product, finance, and legal to ensure the long-term success of the AE team
Consistently coach AEs to improve their sales skills over time
Successfully onboard and train new AEs as our sales team grows


Qualifications

7+ years of sales experience
3+ years of Sales leadership experience at high-growth B2B SaaS companies
Strong track record of leading AE teams to consistently exceeding sales targets
Team-oriented - Customer acquisition happens through a focused effort from sales, marketing, product, engineering, finance, and legal. We're a highly collaborative organization
Great understanding of contract negotiation and working with procurement, legal, and finance teams
Experience working with SalesForce, Outreach.io, Linkedin Sales Navigator, Zoominfo, and other sales tools


This might not work if

You struggle with ambiguity and change
Don't thrive in complex environments dealing with multiple stakeholders
Data driven decisions are not in your playbook


About Rev

Rev.com is a successful growth-stage startup, headquartered in San Francisco, with a second office in downtown Austin. Founded in 2010 by MIT engineers, Rev has raised millions of dollars in venture capital from top Silicon Valley VCs.

Recently named to America's Most Promising Artificial Intelligence Companies , Rev is shaping the way people work with AI. Rev is a marketplace for remote work with the mission to create 1 million work-from-home jobs by 2025. We currently have a network of 50,000 freelancers (Revvers) around the globe and have well over 150,000+ customers, including companies like Amazon, Google, Airbnb, and more.

Rev's services include audio transcription, video captions, document translations, and automatic speech recognition. Learn more about Rev on our "about us" page and check out our thousands of 5-star reviews.

Director, Oracle Partner Network-20000G6H


No Visa Sponsorship is available for this position.

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English

Preferred Qualifications

The race is on! Emerging technologies like artificial intelligence, autonomous, mobility, and IoT have changed the way business structured with all things digital and their expectation of immediacy and value.


To meet the customers’ needs today and exceed their expectations for tomorrow, Oracle is laser-focused to empower and accelerate companies around the world to respond to customer’s cloud transformation with solutions “Powered By” or “Integrated With” Oracle Cloud Platform, or with services to plan, implement, and manage their “last upgrade” transformation or modernization efforts.


The Oracle PartnerNetwork (OPN), a programmatic effort to enable our partner ecosystem, provides the tools, education, and assistance critical in accelerating the delivery of Cloud solutions or services to assist our mutual customers.

Oracle is looking for a Director, OPN Program Lead to join our dynamic team. We are seeking a passionate, results-oriented, proven individual with experience in the innovation and management of global partner programs. This is a highly visible role across the organization and is an opportunity to make a lasting impact on the growth and success of our customers, our partner ecosystem, and Oracle.

The successful candidate must have proven experience and success in working collaboratively across executive management, field sales organization, product development, marketing, etc. They will be passionate about their work, self-motivated, detail oriented and have excellent problem-solving abilities. Additionally, they will have superb communication and project management skills, communicate progress and results both written and verbally, in a clear and easy-to-understand way.

The ideal candidate will possess an extensive background working with technology partnerships and partner programs, particularly as related to Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and Strategic Implementers (SIs), along with strong business development, strategic alliances, and entrepreneurial skills. He/she should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about new business models, solution selling, and technical challenges to help build and convey compelling value propositions for Oracle customers with our partners. The candidate should also have a proven track record of influencing innovation through a partner ecosystem with a prior solution and program successes.
Key Responsibilities:
 Own programmatic elements of Partner Tracks of the Oracle PartnerNetwork working horizontally and vertically with various LOBs/development organizations
 Build and analyze valuable benefit packages for members of OPN
 Drive awareness of new or updated program information for internal partner facing teams and OPN Partner ecosystem through established vehicles
 Engage OPN program members directly to gain insight on the user experience of the program
 Evaluate effectiveness and propose adjustments to programs to improve performance and ensure objectives are met
 Promote online Oracle partner communities to drive recruitment and market adoption
 Analyze adoption rates and recommend enhancements on a continual basis
 Maintain a positive, proactive attitude, always exercise great judgment and demonstrate the ability to initiate new programs and obtain senior management buy-in and support.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
 Bachelors Degree Required. MBA or another advanced college degree preferred
 7-10+ years in program development for a global technology company, e.g., AWS, Microsoft, Cisco, Salesforce, Oracle. Experience working on MSP and/or SI program development strongly preferred
 In-depth knowledge of the cloud computing industry
 Experience and success in managing large and complex global partner ecosystems with a proven understanding of the various business models
 Strong presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences
 Clear track record of delivering programs that accelerate sales revenue and customer success.
 Proven ability to partner with a wide variety of senior-level individuals including top-level business leaders and customers.
 Strong business acumen, and experience with large, complex organizations during periods of rapid growth and change.
 Resilient and able to thrive in a fast-paced, results-driven environment with a high level of energy.
 Advanced Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel skills (Pivot Tables, Macros).
 Willing to travel domestically and internationally to meet with customers, partners, as needed.

Detailed Description and Job Requirements

Engages in business development strategies and programs in support of Oracle's Sales Organization.

Oversees the development of strategic market/product line business plans and marketing programs to support sales in designated market segments. Engages in many areas of business development to include strategy, programs, demand generation, building pipeline, increasing deal size, and account planning. Analyzes market data to identify trends/opportunities and develops strategic direction from market information. Identifies volume and strategic customers. Primary interaction is with Oracle sales force; however, may interact with external customers as it relates to the development and facilitation of ongoing business and/or business relationship. Supports the business by interfacing with the sales organization and other internal groups (such as Product Development, Operations, GBUs, Marketing, etc.)

Acknowledged authority within the Corporation. Acts as a leader of large-scale company initiatives. Viewed by peers as a leader and top contributor and by line management as a key business partner. 12+ years of Marketing/Business Development experience in the technology industry, preferably software industry. Experience should include relationship management. Conversant in Oracle technology and product strategies. Ability to determine strategy and tactical plans that deliver tangible results. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills. BA/BS degree or equivalent, advanced degree highly desirable.

Oracle is an Affirmative Action-Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Description:
Our goal at Pittsburgh AI Works is to “Elevate the human experience through the use of innovative artificial intelligence”. To achieve our goal, we are seeking an individual to fill the Role of Chief Data Scientist (CDS). A strong background in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning is a necessity for this position and for that reason, an emphasis in the following is required:

Consultative Business Process experience
Artificial Intelligence successful deployments
Machine Learning adoption in the Enterprise
Cognitive Computing knowledge

The CDS Candidate shall work closely with the AI Innovations delivery team to develop innovative data science related solutions. Candidate shall possess a career spanning corporate and/or consulting environments You will assist team members in developing and delivering AI/ML offerings and their associated delivery processes from ideation through implementation. Candidate shall be experienced in all facets of strategy, solution design, product development and business growth through innovation.

RESPONSIBILITIES


Serve as a subject matter expert on all data science disciplines.
Provide thought leadership on topics and trends of emerging technology.
Create robust innovative capabilities and solutions in this technical domain.
Serve as the data science expert for teams across the organization to help teams make the best data informed decisions.\
Advising on best practices for collecting data, and advising on statistical and machine learning models to use.
Be a data science consultant and lead ideation.
Research and brainstorming activities in bringing forth original thoughts and ideas for big, bold innovations as well as inter-sectional ideas that draw on multiple disciplines and fields to create unique and new innovations.
Speaker and data science evangelist for the business by presenting at industry events, conferences, and talking to clients.
This senior role exercises your technical eminence, management knowledge and experience with complex solution development.
Implementation and consulting in the pursuit of starting a world class AI solutions service.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS


Work with senior leadership to develop an overall strategic vision and direction for our AI Innovation team
Oversee all data science-related innovation efforts
Work as a senior member of our solution development team in pursuit of the development and delivery of differentiating solutions based on our core expertise.
Define & deliver on building blocks related to data science (AI/ML) capabilities
Assess / deliver on talent needs for data science (AI/ML) success
Play a key role in deciding technologies and related roadmap for development, testing, and deployment of AI/ML models
Think strategically and apply that through to innovative solutions.

Requirements:

Master’s or PhD degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, or related discipline with 20+ years of relevant industry experience
5+ years of multiple leadership experiences in leading data science (artificial intelligence and machine learning) teams on a variety of business impacting areas that enabled innovation and business outcomes.
Expert in data analytic/statistical/mathematical methodologies.
Proven business experience (10+ years) with data science (AI/ML) tools, including expert level skills in SPSS Modeler, SAS Enterprise Miner, or similar tools.
Outstanding critical thinking skills and ability to understand and communicate complex technical concepts to mixed and non-technical audiences.
Outstanding communication skills (i.e., verbal, written, messaging and storytelling skillsets).

ADDITIONAL SKILLS


Outstanding stakeholder management, negotiation, and influencing skills
Able to exercise good judgment by making timely and effective, well-informed decisions
Ability to work independently and thrive under ambiguous circumstances
Ability to work under deadlines and with multiple competing priorities
Adaptable and flexible: Ability to adapt to changing work environments, work priorities and organizational needs
Demonstrated willingness to aggressively learn new things
Strong collaboration skills, clear team player, enthusiastic, and can-do attitude
Detail oriented

Please note, this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities, and schedule may change at any time with or without notice.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
The future is what you make it!
When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.
Are you ready to help us make the future?
Lead Enterprise Automation strategy and assure effective delivery of sustained technology development for Automation across Honeywell. You will be the primary interface to business and domain leaders to define automation roadmap, requirements and drive development execution enabled through existing and emerging tools. You will be a key member of the IT Application Quote to Cash leadership team, engaging in all aspects of running the IT, with a specialization in the use of technology to fulfill business objectives. You will provide leadership in improving IT process and developing IT team capabilities.

 Develop IT strategy and vision around technology and development
 Provide Automation Architecture and Development Services
 Deliver Automation and Cognitive Services in areas of Process, BOTs, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
 Drive new ideas beyond traditional automation mindset and work across team to get them executed, like OCR, Integration, EDI, etc.
 Align with overall Architecture and Standards Services
 Educate business on technology around automation
 Manage IT professionals
YOU MUST HAVE:
 Bachelor's degree
WE VALUE:
 Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field
 Leadership experience in two or more Information Technology, Engineering or Business functional areas
 Excellent leadership communication and executive presence
 Understanding of key information technology solutions and practices
 Strong business acumen and ability to translate new technology into business value
 Creation of result-oriented Management Operating System
 Effectively demonstrates ability to deliver on complex situations or problems
 Creative and collaborative problem-solving capability
 Conveys specific, observable, and measurable expectations for each assignment
 Driving "fast and right" results in a matrixed environment
 Consistently makes timely decisions even in the face of complexity

We are looking for a senior product manager to define and own the product vision and roadmap for our Analyse, Secure and Transport products within the United Kingdom (UK). Products that extract insights, protect and dynamically share our critical customer data. As a senior product manager at Rebellion, you will be responsible for a key part of a rapidly growing portfolio of products, working to rally Rebellion design and engineering teams to deliver on the vision you’ve charted. You will work with Rebellion’s customers and prospective customers, senior UK Ministry of Defence (MOD) civilian and military leadership, the UK Intelligence Community and the United States (US) Department of Defence (DoD) to understand the core customer needs and to bring a product to market.

This position is located in London, and involves some travel within the UK and internationally. An ability to hold a UK national security clearance is preferred, but not required.
We are looking for a track record that will include the following:
Delivering software-as-a-service products that scale to large enterprises or consumer bases,
Working with software engineers with diverse expertise to deliver a superior product to an end userBalancing customer needs with engineering constraints,
Thorough understanding of product management, engineering, design, and sales functions of the businessDefining and exceeding success metrics with the products you buildInspirational leadership — the ability to coalesce many groups of stakeholders around a common goal without direct authority,
Working with users and shipping products in highly regulated industries or otherwise constrained environments (e.g., government, healthcare, national security, industrial systems design),
Managing senior customer stakeholders with decades of experience in their field,
Communicating effectively across diverse technical and non-technical audiences, internally and externally,
Establishing clear product-market fit, understanding the core customer need, and breaking this into priorities for design and engineering teamsExperience bringing artificial intelligence, machine learning, or computer vision products to market (preferred),
At least 8 years of experience in product management or product design.
You might be a good fit if you:
Have a passion for getting to know the user and protecting the UK, the US and its allies from adversaries,
Are self-directed and can prioritise experiences that will provide the most immediate value for the customer,
Are capable of rapid iteration and comfortable with ambiguity in initial problem definition.
As the senior product manager in the UK, your work will drive our strategic product and technology vision across each of our product areas. You will own the team's products, existing or new, from ideation through development to launch, growth, and expansion.

Rebellion is a well-capitalized technology start-up seeking a talented senior product manager who is passionate about defining and delivering modern, life-changing software products to the US Department of Defense (DoD), the UK Ministry of Defence (MoD), and their allies. At Rebellion we believe in operating what we own, we deliver all of our products as managed services, this allows our product teams to maintain operational ownership across all deployments. Expect talented, motivated, intense, and interesting co-workers. Compensation includes meaningful equity ownership, competitive salaries, full medical coverage, disability and life insurance, and transit reimbursement.

Basic Qualifications :
Bachelor’s degree in systems engineering, a related specialized area or field is required (or equivalent experience) plus a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus a minimum of 6 years of relevant experience. Agile experience preferred.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is required at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.
Responsibilities for this Position:
Developing mission-critical systems that help keep people safe is what we do. At General Dynamics Mission Systems, you’ll be part of the team that helps heroes make a true impact. The work we do is important. The challenges we face are career-defining. The opportunity we can offer is one-of-a-kind.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar space and everything in between.

As a X-Lab Systems Engineer/Analyst Lead, you’ll lead model and simulation activities as you participate in requirements analysis and management, functional analysis, performance analysis, system design, trade studies, systems integration and test (verification). It’s your chance to step up to the challenge and prove you’re ready to lead the world.
The Command and Control, Battle Management, and Communications Experimentation Laboratory (C2BMC X-Lab) is a very fast paced and dynamic environment. The X-Lab is responsible for developing and integrating future-capability prototypes for the Ballistic Missile Defense System (BMDS) including Sensor/Weapon Integration, Algorithm Development, User Interface Development and other critical leading-edge missile defense technologies. The X-Lab has a need to augment the team with a senior systems engineer and analysis lead that holds at least a Secret clearance with a TS/SCI being preferable and possesses demonstrable skills in the following areas:

Analysis tool development using MATLAB, Excel, S-Code, Satellite Toolkit (STK), etc.
Perform verification and validation of systems (functional and performance)
Full cycle systems engineering of new capabilities
System and subsystem decomposition
Use case, system requirements, performance specification development, and UML modeling
System interface design & Interface Control Document development
Conducting and participating in peer reviews
Good communication skills (written and oral)
Leadership of a team composed of multiple disciplines
This position will focus on and lead the analysis of R&D systems in C2BMC and will contribute to other ongoing X-Lab projects as needed. Including the assessment on how the C2BMC prototype system performs by identifying high level objectives and refining into an integrated set of metrics, analysis tool development, assessment of experimental data, generating and presenting customer-quality products containing analytical observations. The Lead Analyst will apply these results to identify and work to enhance C2BMC for future operations. The Lead Analyst must possess expertise in a technical discipline related to systems engineering, analysis, or missile defense. The Lead Analyst should be comfortable with rapidly changing requirements, design challenges that require novel solutions, fast-paced activities, and tight deadlines.

The Lead Analyst must have [12+] years of experience leading or contributing to an integrated team environment with other systems, software, and specialty engineers to develop solutions that includes a background in all aspects of the analysis life cycle. The Lead Analyst should have experience with identification of analysis objectives, metric generation, data assessment, and presentation of the results. The Lead Analyst should have demonstrated the ability to analyze high level customer needs and defined a structured and logical approach to refine the objectives and analysis requirements. The Lead Analyst should have demonstrated the ability to communicate effectively, developed and scripted analysis tools, clearly present technical approaches and findings, and have experience in writing and implementing analysis plans within a project. Ideally, the Lead Analyst will have experience in working on IRAD-type projects.

Position Responsibilities:
Perform as individual contributor and Analyst Lead for advanced concepts development projects. This includes directing the activities of junior level engineers. Contribute in full lifecycle development of advanced concepts. Position is responsible for performing the evaluation of advanced missile defense command and control capabilities to provide highly innovative and ingenious solutions to complex technical problems. Including defining and
coordinating analysis objectives and metrics for various experimental prototypes, performing the associated analysis, and serve as the X-Lab spokesperson on advanced projects when briefing results to the customer. Actions are critical to achieving X-Lab organizational objectives and directly affect the impact of X-Lab technological capability. Assignments are often self-initiated with consultation and agreement of X-Lab leadership. The Lead Analyst will provide oversight of maintenance and improvements to the analysis tool suite. Support advanced concept demonstrations during live and simulated MDA test events. Non-standard work hours are highly likely during event execution and a small amount of travel may be required.

Preferred Qualifications:
The primary work location is the Missile Defense Integration and Operations Center (MDIOC) located on Schriever AFB, CO. The following knowledge base and/or skills are desired for the Senior Systems Engineer:
Integration practices and methodsTest driven development and continuous integration
Ability to extract data to support analysis
Operating systems experience with Windows & Unix/Linux
Algorithm design and implementation
DoD Architecture Framework (DoDAF)
Physics & mechanics of powered and ballistic missile flightTheory and application of the BMDS
Theory and application of command and control systems
Theory and application of track correlation algorithms
Probability theory and optimal state estimation
Familiarity with Link-16, including content, transmission rules, etcCoding skills a plus (Java, C++, and shell scripts)
Excellent communication skills (written and oral)
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran

The Sr. District Sales Manager is responsible for seeking and maintaining relationships with inContact Sales Partners and identifying sales opportunities and building market share in their regions. This position is required to increase revenue streams in small business, commercial, government, and contact centers.


As a Sr. District Sales Manager, a Typical Day Might Include the following:

Meets and exceeds assigned sales quota.
Build and maintain relationships with potential and current customers and sales partners.
Assist and support Sales partners in sales effort by participating in sales calls and closing efforts.
Maintain product knowledge by attending weekly trainings.
Attends tradeshows.
Travels as needed to maximize growth and revenue, while adhering to all inContact travel policies and requirements.
If remote from inContact headquarters, maintains appropriate home office within inContact allowances.
Makes in person sales calls
Interacts with all levels of organization. Makes presentations as necessary to same.
Build trust and rapport with current and potential customers.
Regularly closes deals and builds future pipeline within or exceeding goals.
Completes all inContact paperwork timely - expense reports, sales call logs, etc.
Regularly keeps direct supervisor apprised of issues and potential sales.
Travel required 50%.

To Land This Gig You'll Need:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Information Systems, Marketing, Communications or similar field or equivalent work experience required.
15 + years sales experience
Previous experience selling multimillion-dollar software deals
Previous experience in telecom, call center, software or hardware industries
Highly professional demeanor - presence, voice
Demonstrated high level competency in written and verbal communications
Demonstrated success working with little to no direct daily supervision in a home office setting

Bonus Experience:

Sales Engineering experience
Telecomm sales experience
SaaS experience

ABOUT NICE inContact: NICE inContact makes it easy and affordable for organizations around the globe to provide exceptional customer experiences while meeting key business metrics. NICE inContact provides the world’s No. 1 cloud customer experience platform, NICE inContact CXone™, combining best-in-class Omnichannel Routing, Workforce Optimization, Analytics, Automation and Artificial Intelligence on an Open Cloud Foundation. NICE inContact is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.

Software has revolutionized every industry it has touched. While online learning has taken a strong root over the last two decades, we are at the cusp of the next wave of innovation in the learning space with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. And where better to influence that than in the company known for innovation at a global scale.

Amazon Learning Products and Services team is looking for a Senior Product Manager to join an exciting opportunity to reinvigorate our learning platform. As a senior product manager, you will be responsible for designing, implementing and driving a new customer outreach program for our learning platform. Through this program, you will be contributing to our business growth by bringing in new business partners across the company and its subsidiaries. You will also be responsible for nurturing and measuring the success of these customers and business through a programmatic approach.

On this team, you’ll get to wear many hats, work fast and smart, and iterate quickly. We are looking for someone who is ready to take ownership of a growing business opportunity and join a tightly-knit team tackling interesting challenges. You are innovative, courageous, positive, and are itching to explore your own full potential in creativity, technology, and experiences.

Organizations around the world are going through rapid digital transformation. This is especially true in the US, where we see this phenomenon being accelerated by the scale and agility of the Cloud and fueled by the latest innovation in machine learning and artificial intelligence. As they progress through their transformations and examine impacts on employees, partners, customers, and society, new strategies are emerging with socio-environmental factors and sustainability at the center.
Changes and challenges like these also mean unprecedented opportunities for Microsoft. To capitalize on the opportunities in MSUS, we need a holistic ecosystem approach to ‘make the AI market’ with Microsoft as the indisputable leader. We will work across cities, and states, from start-ups to Fortune 500 companies and leverage coalitions, private and public partnerships, NGOs, industry associations, our partner ecosystem and academic institutions – all for the goal of leveraging AI to enable every person and every organization to achieve more. Do you want to be part an organization that will be a game changer for how we make the AI Market and build upon our mission of Sustainability and investments to support Carbon Negative Pledge by 2030? Do you like to be in an environment of building something new, creating and incubating new opportunities and connecting across the entire MSUS and WW teams? This organization is looking for strategic, passionate and driven individuals who understand AI, the value of ecosystem and the opportunity for collaboration to make new markets.
Responsibilities
As the Senior Director of Go-To-Markets, you will report to the US Vice President, AI & Sustainability Strategy and be accountable for the following strategic priorities:
Build and Manage High Performing Team
Develop inclusive and diverse culture to create agile and nimble approach to changing market conditions
Implementation of a comprehensive AI GTM strategy and program to accelerate our cloud transformation across the ecosystem of commercial partners, start-ups, government agencies, universities, and workforce and education partners to create marketshare in critical technologies of Cloud, Data & AI.
Programmatic GTM strategy definition and execution to accelerate and maximize impact of how we incubate, build and make a market by Industry and Technology including:
Engagement framework for predictable and effective DT sales with prioritized partners, programs and national sales resources in CDO.
GTM Programs execution: lead generation, pipeline acceleration; events integration, PR and Social amplification in partnership with M&O.
Repeatable GTM plays by Industry including Government in close orchestration with M&O, CDO, Regulated Industries and Enterprise team
Lead the development of Microsoft’s AI integration into the State and Local Government critical success factors
Microsoft’s AI Country Plan Activation including field readiness, key plays, BOM materials and coaching strategy with local AI Boards in partnership with key stakeholders
Leadership and execution of Go To Market programs for Microsoft’s Cloud plays across Industry and 5 State initiative.
Develop community building, partnerships and program expansion from WW to US Markets
Manage AI Leads across the US to drive community, best practice sharing and accelerated deployment of AI in markets.
Create GTM for Centers of Excellence including Houston, Atlanta, Louisville and other regional skills and innovation centers to scale transformation within Industry and City.
Leadership of investments across teams to support incubation and acceleration of AI Market Making
Qualifications
Experience Required: Qualifications:
10+ years of experience in product, corporate strategy or technical marketing, partner channel development, business development in the IT industry
BA/BS or equivalent work experience. MBA preferred.
Executive maturity, organizational agility and strong impact and influence competencies.
Proven ability to create clarity, generate energy and deliver success
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.
Understanding of AI, Ecosystem Development or Strategic Partnerships
Proven track record and experience in technical sales and programs strategy and execution
Proven management experience in leading, developing and motivating team members
Strategic thinking with demonstrated creative problem solving of complex business issues through analytics, data driven insights, organizational skills and sound judgment
Inclusive and collaborative – driving teamwork and cross-team alignment

Basic Qualifications :
Bachelor’s degree in systems engineering, a related specialized area or field is required (or equivalent experience) plus a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus a minimum of 6 years of relevant experience. Agile experience preferred.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is required at time of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.
Responsibilities for this Position:
Developing mission-critical systems that help keep people safe is what we do. At General Dynamics Mission Systems, you’ll be part of the team that helps heroes make a true impact. The work we do is important. The challenges we face are career-defining. The opportunity we can offer is one-of-a-kind.


We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar space and everything in between.

As a X-Lab Systems Engineer/Analyst Lead, you’ll lead model and simulation activities as you participate in requirements analysis and management, functional analysis, performance analysis, system design, trade studies, systems integration and test (verification). It’s your chance to step up to the challenge and prove you’re ready to lead the world.
The Command and Control, Battle Management, and Communications Experimentation Laboratory (C2BMC X-Lab) is a very fast paced and dynamic environment. The X-Lab is responsible for developing and integrating future-capability prototypes for the Ballistic Missile Defense System (BMDS) including Sensor/Weapon Integration, Algorithm Development, User Interface Development and other critical leading-edge missile defense technologies. The X-Lab has a need to augment the team with a senior systems engineer and analysis lead that holds at least a Secret clearance with a TS/SCI being preferable and possesses demonstrable skills in the following areas:

Analysis tool development using MATLAB, Excel, S-Code, Satellite Toolkit (STK), etc.
Perform verification and validation of systems (functional and performance)
Full cycle systems engineering of new capabilities
System and subsystem decomposition
Use case, system requirements, performance specification development, and UML modeling
System interface design & Interface Control Document development
Conducting and participating in peer reviews
Good communication skills (written and oral)
Leadership of a team composed of multiple disciplines
This position will focus on and lead the analysis of R&D systems in C2BMC and will contribute to other ongoing X-Lab projects as needed. Including the assessment on how the C2BMC prototype system performs by identifying high level objectives and refining into an integrated set of metrics, analysis tool development, assessment of experimental data, generating and presenting customer-quality products containing analytical observations. The Lead Analyst will apply these results to identify and work to enhance C2BMC for future operations. The Lead Analyst must possess expertise in a technical discipline related to systems engineering, analysis, or missile defense. The Lead Analyst should be comfortable with rapidly changing requirements, design challenges that require novel solutions, fast-paced activities, and tight deadlines.

The Lead Analyst must have [12+] years of experience leading or contributing to an integrated team environment with other systems, software, and specialty engineers to develop solutions that includes a background in all aspects of the analysis life cycle. The Lead Analyst should have experience with identification of analysis objectives, metric generation, data assessment, and presentation of the results. The Lead Analyst should have demonstrated the ability to analyze high level customer needs and defined a structured and logical approach to refine the objectives and analysis requirements. The Lead Analyst should have demonstrated the ability to communicate effectively, developed and scripted analysis tools, clearly present technical approaches and findings, and have experience in writing and implementing analysis plans within a project. Ideally, the Lead Analyst will have experience in working on IRAD-type projects.

Position Responsibilities:
Perform as individual contributor and Analyst Lead for advanced concepts development projects. This includes directing the activities of junior level engineers. Contribute in full lifecycle development of advanced concepts. Position is responsible for performing the evaluation of advanced missile defense command and control capabilities to provide highly innovative and ingenious solutions to complex technical problems. Including defining and
coordinating analysis objectives and metrics for various experimental prototypes, performing the associated analysis, and serve as the X-Lab spokesperson on advanced projects when briefing results to the customer. Actions are critical to achieving X-Lab organizational objectives and directly affect the impact of X-Lab technological capability. Assignments are often self-initiated with consultation and agreement of X-Lab leadership. The Lead Analyst will provide oversight of maintenance and improvements to the analysis tool suite. Support advanced concept demonstrations during live and simulated MDA test events. Non-standard work hours are highly likely during event execution and a small amount of travel may be required.

Preferred Qualifications:
The primary work location is the Missile Defense Integration and Operations Center (MDIOC) located on Schriever AFB, CO. The following knowledge base and/or skills are desired for the Senior Systems Engineer:
Integration practices and methodsTest driven development and continuous integration
Ability to extract data to support analysis
Operating systems experience with Windows & Unix/Linux
Algorithm design and implementation
DoD Architecture Framework (DoDAF)
Physics & mechanics of powered and ballistic missile flightTheory and application of the BMDS
Theory and application of command and control systems
Theory and application of track correlation algorithms
Probability theory and optimal state estimation
Familiarity with Link-16, including content, transmission rules, etcCoding skills a plus (Java, C++, and shell scripts)
Excellent communication skills (written and oral)
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 12,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

Our goal at Pittsburgh AI Works is to “Elevate the human experience through the use of innovative artificial intelligence”. To achieve our goal, we are seeking an individual to fill the Role of Chief Data Scientist (CDS). A strong background in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning is a necessity for this position and for that reason, an emphasis in the following is required:

Consultative Business Process experience
Artificial Intelligence successful deployments
Machine Learning adoption in the Enterprise
Cognitive Computing knowledge
The CDS Candidate shall work closely with the AI Innovations delivery team to develop innovative data science related solutions. Candidate shall possess a career spanning corporate and/or consulting environments You will assist team members in developing and delivering AI/ML offerings and their associated delivery processes from ideation through implementation. Candidate shall be experienced in all facets of strategy, solution design, product development and business growth through innovation.

Position Responsibilities

Serve as a subject matter expert on all data science disciplines.
Provide thought leadership on topics and trends of emerging technology.
Create robust innovative capabilities and solutions in this technical domain.
Serve as the data science expert for teams across the organization to help teams make the best data informed decisions.\
Advising on best practices for collecting data, and advising on statistical and machine learning models to use.
Be a data science consultant and lead ideation.
Research and brainstorming activities in bringing forth original thoughts and ideas for big, bold innovations as well as inter-sectional ideas that draw on multiple disciplines and fields to create unique and new innovations.
Speaker and data science evangelist for the business by presenting at industry events, conferences, and talking to clients.
This senior role exercises your technical eminence, management knowledge and experience with complex solution development.
Implementation and consulting in the pursuit of starting a world class AI solutions service.

Job Functions

Work with senior leadership to develop an overall strategic vision and direction for our AI Innovation team
Oversee all data science-related innovation efforts
Work as a senior member of our solution development team in pursuit of the development and delivery of differentiating solutions based on our core expertise.
Define & deliver on building blocks related to data science (AI/ML) capabilities
Assess / deliver on talent needs for data science (AI/ML) success
Play a key role in deciding technologies and related roadmap for development, testing, and deployment of AI/ML models
Think strategically and apply that through to innovative solutions

Job Requirements

Master’s or PhD degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering, Math, or related discipline with 20+ years of relevant industry experience
5+ years of multiple leadership experiences in leading data science (artificial intelligence and machine learning) teams on a variety of business impacting areas that enabled innovation and business outcomes.
Expert in data analytic/statistical/mathematical methodologies.
Proven business experience (10+ years) with data science (AI/ML) tools, including expert level skills in SPSS Modeler, SAS Enterprise Miner, or similar tools.
Outstanding critical thinking skills and ability to understand and communicate complex technical concepts to mixed and non-technical audiences.
Outstanding communication skills (i.e., verbal, written, messaging and storytelling skillsets).

Additional Skills

Outstanding stakeholder management, negotiation, and influencing skills
Able to exercise good judgment by making timely and effective, well-informed decisions
Ability to work independently and thrive under ambiguous circumstances
Ability to work under deadlines and with multiple competing priorities
Adaptable and flexible: Ability to adapt to changing work environments, work priorities and organizational needs
Demonstrated willingness to aggressively learn new things
Strong collaboration skills, clear team player, enthusiastic, and can-do attitude
Detail oriented

Data Engagement Manager – R&D Data Office
Location(s) - Gothenburg (Sweden); Gaithersburg (USA); Cambridge (UK)
Salary - Competitive salary and company benefits
Would you like to be a part of a Data Science & Artificial Intelligence (DS&AI) group who has direct strategic impact on drug development, playing a key role in getting medicines to patients?
At AstraZeneca, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines, with a real passion for discovery and a pipeline to show for it. Here, you’ll have the chance to create a difference in people’s lives every single day.
AstraZeneca is investing heavily in data management and analysis capabilities, through its long-term Growth Through Innovation Strategy. The DS&AI team collaborates across R&D to drive innovation through data science and AI. Together we seek to:
Improve our understanding of disease and uncovering new targets
Transform R&D processes
Speed the design and delivery of new medicines
The R&D Data Office, within DS&AI, is a key organisation to deliver upon AstraZeneca’s strategy. Data Office operates a central capability, with R&D wide accountability, to ensure that we harness the power of data to drive innovative science. Data Office will govern data, drive data quality and ensure our data is readied for analytics, crafting paved-paths for scientists to perform research driven by data, without compromising our legal restrictions or ethical principles.
Within Data Office, your role is a Data Engagement Manager. In this leadership position, you will be a part of the Data Provisioning team where you will have accountability for ensuring that Data Office services are providing value to one of our three major R&D therapy areas: Oncology; Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolism; and Respiratory Inflammation & Auto-immunity. You will use this position to accelerate and enable data science to support the development of innovative medicines. Your activities will involve understanding customer’s needs, research strategies and objectives, developing a deep appreciation of value that the Data Office can deliver to the research pipeline. Using your consultancy skills, knowledge and professional judgement, you will ensure that major new flows of work are understood, triaged and prioritised, to form a portfolio of data provisioning projects and requests that you will own. Your portfolio will be executed by coordinators within a project office in the Data Provisioning team, and through your oversight and guidance, you will be accountable for successful customer-outcomes. Your will directly enable innovative research, allowing AstraZeneca to create new medicines for patients worldwide.
Typical Accountabilities
Ensure the Data Provisioning team are accelerating delivery of research in your designated R&D therapy area.
Be a champion for Data Office, from broad principle to operating processes.
Establish a network of partners within R&D, this may extend to collaborators outside of AstraZeneca and act as a prime point of contact for Data Office.
Develop and maintain strategic relationships with R&D partners up to VP level.
Liaise with R&D partners to consult upon and guide their data usage to optimise the value they can exploit from data and Data Office services.
Perform high level assessment of customer research plans, including feasibility, legal and ethical issues and readiness of data. To achieve this successfully you will be required to link into other Data Office areas, plus other specialist networks.
Triage and prioritise data provisioning projects.
Liaise with project coordinators who will be responsible for delivery activities, guiding and supporting their delivery of particularly complex, larger-scoped and high-priority projects.
Own and manage a portfolio of data provisioning projects, including risk and issue management associated to data sharing.
Participate in Data Office and Data Provisioning team initiatives to continually improve our services and delivery, helping to reimagine our services and processes as our business evolves.
Education, skills and experience required
Significant experience working in pharmaceuticals R&D or related scientific industry.
Demonstrable experience working as a data management or data leadership position.
We need you to be an experienced influencer, with expert relationship and business partnering skills up to senior leadership level.
Experience in and knowledge of medical research in at least one of the R&D therapy areas.
Knowledge and understanding of the value from application of data science in the R&D domain would be a significant advantage
Knowledge of data management and data-privacy and legal obligations associated to data sharing.
Project portfolio management skills or qualifications would be an advantage
The ability to travel both domestically and internationally.
Next Steps – Apply today!

We are looking for a senior product manager to define and own the product vision and roadmap for our Analyse, Secure and Transport products within the United Kingdom (UK). Our products are built to enhance analysis, to protect information, and to dynamically share our critical customer data. As a senior product manager at Rebellion Defense, you will be responsible for a key part of a rapidly growing portfolio of products, working to rally Rebellion Defense design and engineering teams to deliver on the vision you’ve charted. You will work with Rebellion Defense’s customers and prospective customers, senior UK Ministry of Defence (MOD) civilian and military leadership, the UK Intelligence Community and the United States (US) Department of Defence (DoD) to understand the core customer needs and to bring a product to market.

This position is located in London, and involves some travel within the UK and internationally. An ability to hold a UK national security clearance is preferred, but not required.
We are looking for a track record that will include the following:
Delivering software-as-a-service products that scale to large enterprises or consumers,
Working with software engineers with diverse expertise to deliver a superior product to an end user
Balancing customer needs with engineering constraints,
Thorough understanding of product management, engineering, design, and sales functions of the business
Defining and exceeding success metrics with the products you build
Inspirational leadership — the ability to coalesce many groups of stakeholders around a common goal without direct authority,
Working with users and shipping products in highly regulated industries or otherwise constrained environments (e.g., government, healthcare, national security, industrial systems design),
Managing senior customer stakeholders with decades of experience in their field,
Communicating effectively across diverse technical and non-technical audiences, internally and externally,
Establishing clear product-market fit, understanding the core customer need, and breaking this into priorities for design and engineering teams
Experience bringing artificial intelligence, machine learning, or computer vision products to market (preferred),
At least 8 years of experience in product management or product design.
You might be a good fit if you:
Have a passion for getting to know the user and protecting the UK, the US and its allies from adversaries,
Are self-directed and can prioritise experiences that will provide the most immediate value for the customer,
Are capable of rapid iteration and comfortable with ambiguity in initial problem definition.
As the senior product manager in the UK, your work will drive our strategic product and technology vision across each of our product areas. You will own the team's products, existing or new, from ideation through development to launch, growth, and expansion.

Rebellion Defense is a well-capitalized technology start-up seeking a talented senior product manager who is passionate about defining and delivering modern, life-changing software products to the US Department of Defense (DoD), the UK Ministry of Defence (MoD), and their allies. At Rebellion Defense we believe in operating what we own, we deliver all of our products as managed services, this allows our product teams to maintain operational ownership across all deployments. Expect talented, motivated, intense, and interesting co-workers. Compensation includes meaningful equity ownership, competitive salaries, full medical coverage, disability and life insurance, and transit reimbursement.

job_title_origin: Sr. Product Manager, Technical - Global Telecom
job_description:
7+ years of enterprise IT experience, including database systems, tiered storage architectures, server, and desktop virtualization, data center operations, network security, etc.5+ years of technical knowledge of Telecom industry applications, platforms, and data ecosystem5+ years management of technical customer-facing resourcesTechnical degree required (or equivalent work experience); Computer Science or Math background highly desired

JOB DESCRIPTION
Want to disrupt an industry by delighting customers and have a massive impact? Do you have the business background, technical depth, and communication skills needed to help Amazon Connect build a world-class telephony network? Excited to join one of the newest and most exciting AWS services? Come be a leader on a team that is building a product that will touch millions of people daily.
Amazon Connect is a highly disruptive cloud-based contact center that enables businesses to deliver engaging, dynamic, and personal customer service experiences. Amazon Connect is the result of the ten years of development that went into building the tools Amazon uses to provide its award winning customer service at massive scale and launching it as a publicly available AWS service. With Amazon Connect, you can create your own cloud-based contact center and be taking calls in minutes. Amazon Connect leverages the power of Artificial Intelligence and the large ecosystem of AWS services such as Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3 and Amazon Kinesis to provide a truly frustration free, easy-to-use, extensible, and natural customer experience. With this technology, we are transforming an industry and the way customers interact with businesses and how agents service them.
We have a rapidly growing customer base and an exciting charter in front of us that includes solving highly complex engineering and algorithmic problems. We are looking for a passionate, talented, and experienced Product Manager to join us to innovate on this new service that addresses customer needs to build modern contact centers in the cloud.
The position represents a rare opportunity to be a part of a fast-growing business soon after launch, and help shape the technology and product as we grow. You will be playing a crucial role by developing the next generation user-interface to build the interactions a customer could configure within an Amazon Connect instance. You will have the opportunity to design and deliver scaleable, resilient systems while maintaining a constant customer focus.
Industry analysts have said, “Amazon Connect is quietly positioned to massively disrupt by enabling companies to focus on customer service, not service centers.” and “Amazon is totally disrupting the customer contact center space as they have many other market-spaces with customer-centric solutions with open platform integration with assistance from the partner community.”
As a product manager on our team, you will own driving strategic initiatives through completion. You will work cross-functionally across teams to solve challenging problems using the latest technologies. You will make data-driven decisions and work with leadership across AWS to prioritize your programs.
What is in it for you?
Team culture: You'll be joining a fun team that prides itself on a great work environment with an inclusive group of people that love working together towards a common goal.Impact: Work on a service that will be used, directly and indirectly, by millions of customers and has a meaningful impact to their functions and interactions.Gratification: You will know you are directly responsible for solving real customer problems.Critical and Fast: This is a strategic new business for AWS, and we are moving fast, really fast.Ownership: You will quickly become responsible for key components of the service, and drive what and how to build them.Learn & Grow: If you want to learn and grow with challenges of a designing and building a large-scale fault tolerant systems – this is an opportunity of a life time.Innovate: We learn from our customers and invent every day on their behalf.Make history: AWS is the leader in a current industry wide revolution, and specifically at Amazon Connect, we are changing the way customers think about contact centers.Have fun: Surround yourself with a highly talented team of product managers, engineers, and UX designers that like to solve complex problems, but also work in a fun and autonomous environment.
Additional resources:
Learn more about Amazon Connect here.See the media coverage about Amazon Connect here.Understand the true power of Amazon Connect here.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Deep understanding of user behavior and interactions with web products.Sharp analytical abilities, proven design skills, and a track record of delivery.Strong communication skills for both a technical and business audience, with an emphasis on writing down ideas effectively.8+ years of experience working on successful technology products from ideation through launch.Experience in the contact center industry or B2B SaaS.Experience with cloud technologies.Proven ability to influence a large organization effectively.Strong track record of shaping business strategy for technical products or services for large Enterprises or partners.5+ years of technical knowledge of Telecom industry applications, platforms, and data ecosystemHighly technical and analytical and will be capable of understanding the complexities of negotiating complex Telecom contracts.

Basic Qualifications :
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, a related field or equivalent experience is required plus a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus 3 years of relevant experience.


CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Department of Defense Secret security clearance is required within 24 months of hire. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.

Responsibilities for this Position:
At General Dynamics Mission Systems, we create the technologies, products and services that help our nation’s heroes keep our nation safe. The work we do is so advanced, we are continuously moving the boundaries of what’s possible. Here you’ll work with the best and your talent will be front and center on projects that impact the world. Are you up to the challenge?

We apply advanced technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, AR/VR, Cloud Native and Quantum Physics to solve our customers’ missions in cyber, RF, undersea, interstellar and everything in between.


As an Advanced Systems Administration Specialist, you’ll serve as a front-line interface to users with technical issues by conducting systems analysis and development to keep systems current with changing technologies. Your duties may include installing new software, troubleshooting, granting permissions to applications and training users. You’ll also be responsible for the day-to-day support of server services by performing server administration for physical and virtual server operating systems and configuring, maintaining and troubleshooting of physical and virtual hardware and network related interfaces on servers. And, you’ll perform OS and vendor software patching on servers and monitor physical and virtual servers performance using monitoring tools.

What you’ll experience:
Technologies that aren’t just top-notch, they’re often top-secret
A team of bold thinkers committed to exploring what’s next
Opportunities to gain new knowledge - as it’s discovered
What you bring to the table:
A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, a related field or equivalent experience plus a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience; or Master's degree plus 3 years of relevant experience
Solid understanding of server based operating systems
Enhanced troubleshooting skills within the server OS as well as both networking and storage technologies
Working knowledge to create and run scripts to automate repetitive processes
Familiarity with compliance controls: STIGs (Security Technical Implementation Guides), RMF (Risk Management Framework), DFARS (Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement), NIST SP 800-171, Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification (CMMC), CIS Controls
Familiarity supporting software/hardware development tools & processes: JIRA, GitLab, Jenkins, CI/CD, GIT, DevOps, Software Development Kits (SDK)s, IDEs
Scripting languages such as Bash, Python, Ruby, PowerShell
Experience installing, configuring, and writing ansible playbooks for infrastructure as code (IaC) automation with production and development environments
Kickstart/PXE Boot used to automate installation of operating system
Monitoring and alerting packages such as Nagios and Ganglia
TCP/IP, Internet Routing Protocols, private and public networks, VLANs, Firewalls, Load Balancers, addressing schemes, subnet creation and subnet masking
Experience with patching of Windows platforms Client 10 and Server 2012R2/2016 or newer
Experience with patching of RedHat Linux/CentOS
Experience managing virtual machine with VMware vSphere and related technologies

What sets you apart:
Creative thinking with the ability to multi-task
Team player who thrives in collaborative environments and revels in team success
Commitment to ongoing professional development
Company Overview:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation. With a global team of 12,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas. Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency. We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded. If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!

General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce. EOE/Disability/Veteran
