By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that I agree with Takeda’s Privacy Notice, Privacy Policy and Terms of Use.
Job Description
Are you looking for a patient-focused, innovation-driven company that will inspire you and empower you to shine?
At Takeda, we are transforming the pharmaceutical industry through our R&D-driven market leadership and being a values-led company. To do this, we empower our people to realize their potential through life-changing work. Certified as a Global Top Employer, we offer stimulating careers, encourage innovation, and strive for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our global teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.
Here, you will be a vital contributor to our inspiring, bold mission.
For the Takeda global scientific community who aspire to deliver transformative medicines to patients Scientific Informatics is the technology leader, with domain specific expertise, that provides innovative platforms and technologies to improve both operational efficiency and data-driven decision making. As an embedded partner Scientific Informatics is at the leading edge of both science and technology and proactively reacts to the changing scientific environment and needs of researchers in an agile fashion to deliver timely, value-adding solutions.
The Digital Advisory Board programs aim to ensure our growing data is easily accessible to everyone so we can help our patients and HCPs faster and more effectively.
Ethics & Compliance (E&C) focuses on what the organization needs by partnering closely with the business stakeholders to help create, support and enable an embedded ethics and compliance framework. We do this by
Being a forward-thinking leader who anticipates the impact that changing regulations and public debate on topics of ethics will have on the business
Taking a modern approach to the E&C operating model by establishing and maintaining a functional structure and agile framework, supporting the achievement of Takeda’s Vision 2025 and the E&C strategy.
E&C will respond rapidly to changing environment and business needs, it is close to the market, and encourages and help enable ethical behaviour in line with Takeda’s values. By working in an agile manner E&C ensures the balance between stable structures, governance, processes and systems, and dynamic approaches to delivering innovative solutions to appropriately manage risks.
E&C commits to
Act as role model for Takeda's values and foster an ethics and values-based decision making mindset in internal clients, partners and team
Enable the organization to make ethical decisions in line with our priorities of Patient, Trust, Reputation, and Business
Collaborate across all E&C teams and partner with stakeholders in BUs / BFs and LOCs to embed ethics and compliance as part of the inherent way of work at Takeda.
Takeda is looking for an experienced Head of Technology-Ethics with extensive digital transformation experience specific to health innovation support & validation.
This position with be working closely with the R&D department to help design/develop and build out new products/solutions.
Use Technology Ethics Principles to govern technology including factors like risk management and individual rights.
Understand and resolve moral issues that have to do with the development and application of technology of different types.
ACCOUNTABILITIES
Lead and establish simple principle-based frameworks to support enterprise digital innovation (e.g. AI Ethics, Data Ethics, Digital Health Ethics, etc.)
Build, design and manage a day-to-day cross-functional group of experts supporting / reviewing enterprise-wide digital health projects with the intent to foster compliant and ethical patient-focused innovation (e.g. E&C, Medical Device regulatory, Drug regulatory, Safety, Quality, IT security, Privacy, Legal, etc.)
Develop protocols to ensure ethics-by-design of key digital and technological innovations (e.g. Privacy impact assessments, Safety Assessment, Device Determination, Human Right Determination, Algorithmic bias prevention, etc.)
Provide targeted advice from past digital transformation on ethics and compliance of technologies globally and across the enterprise, to support ideation prototyping, piloting & scalability
Identify emerging digital and technological risks, and propose mitigation solutions
Identify areas requiring capability development among the E&C community and the business (regulation and ethics of technologies, technology 101, etc.)
Design and deploy development programs to upskill E&C professional at global, BU/BF and LOC/Site levels
Develop educational content to raise the awareness within the business of the importance of ethical innovation
Collaboration with E&C in leveraging existing best practices as basis for Techno ethics solutions
Collaboration with R&D to ensure solutions are business focused
Act as role model for Takeda's values and foster an ethics and values-based decision making mindset in internal clients, partners and team
Enable the organization to make ethical decisions in line with our priorities of Patient, Trust, Reputation, and Business
DIMENSIONS AND ASPECTS
Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise
Strong background in Technoethics: Digital Health, Artificial Intelligence (ML, NLP, MV), Extended Realities (AR, VR), DLTs (Blockchain), Health Robotics & Med Techs, 3D Printing
Leadership
Build and lead day-to-day cross-functional group of experts supporting / reviewing enterprise-wide digital health projects with the intent to foster compliant and ethical patient-focused innovation (e.g. E&C, Medical, Device regulatory, Drug regulatory, Safety, Quality, IT security, Privacy, Legal, etc.)
Decision-making and Autonomy
This individual will be the SME for Techno-Ethics to provide targeted advice on ethics and compliance of technologies globally and across the enterprise, to support ideation prototyping, piloting & scalability
Interaction

You will join the Product Management team and work alongside other leaders who have built and shipped AI and Machine Learning products at Google, Facebook, Microsoft, and Salesforce.
JPMorgan Chase (JPMC) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. JPMC has made a strategic decision to fundamentally transform its operations through the adoption of artificial intelligence and machine learning at scale. The AI Acceleration (AIX) team, headquartered in Palo Alto, is a new group tasked with achieving this vision. We're hiring the best of the best from Silicon Valley to come join us.
To learn more about the AIX team and JPMC, please see this recent interview with our team leader and Global Head of AI, Apoorv Saxena.

Partner with engineering team and TPM team to define product priorities

Evangelize AI and Machine Learning across the firm

A willingness to help and share knowledge with other team members.
An insatiable appetite for feedback and constructive criticism
The ability to anticipate needs and take required actions
Familiarity with Analytics, Big Data, and public Cloud technologies.
Strong project management capabilities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong work ethic and the utmost attention to detail.

Preferred
Previous product management experience in Public Cloud area

PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, or Data Science
MBA from a top tier business school

Morgan and Chase brands. job_title_origin: Principal Data Scientist- Industrial Discrete Sector Industry
job_description:
Introduction
As a Data Scientist at IBM, you will help transform our clients’ data into tangible business value by analyzing information, communicating outcomes and collaborating on product development. Work with Best in Class open source and visual tools, along with the most flexible and scalable deployment options. Whether it’s investigating patient trends or weather patterns, you will work to solve real world problems for the industries transforming how we live.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Quantum computers are incredibly powerful machines that take a new approach to processing information. Built on the principles of quantum mechanics, they exploit complex and fascinating laws of nature that are always there, but usually remain hidden from view. By harnessing such natural behavior, quantum computers can run new types of algorithms to process information more holistically. They may one day lead to revolutionary breakthroughs in materials and drug discovery, the optimization of complex manmade systems, and artificial intelligence. We expect them to open doors that we once thought would remain locked indefinitely.

What you’ll be doing:
IBM Services is looking for a Quantum Data Scientist who will interface with research and algorithm experts to implement quantum approaches, which includes data pre-/post-processing, running numerics and visualizing data. Working with quantum industry experts, you will be a key member of a multi-discipline squad focused on building quantum capabilities and researching quantum application development for clients within discrete manufacturing industries, including aerospace & defense, automotive and electronics manufacturing.
Work with IBM Q Start team on active exploratory research engagements to prepare for future use case commercialization within specific industries
Engage and educate client data science teams to define promising areas for quantum exploration
Implement quantum approaches, which includes data pre-/post-processing, running numerics and visualizing data
Collaborate with industry and solutioning experts to design and shape experiments to demonstrate quantum-enabled advantage
Define best practices related to information architecture, including collection, integration, organization, analysis and visualization of data for quantum-enabled impact
Engage in practice development initiatives focused on building employee knowledge and skills in specific areas of expertise through coaching and development of training course material
At IBM our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people.

Career Growth
Skill development: We help our employees develop and grow their foundational skills
Finding the dream job at IBM: Endless career paths and advancement opportunities
Diversity of people: Commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive culture

IBM offers a competitive benefits program, designed to help employees build a solid financial foundation for meeting a diverse array of needs.

Benefits
Parental Bonding/Maternity LeavePaid Care LeaveHealthcare, Dental and VisionFlexible Work HoursAdoption and Surrogacy Assistance ProgramEmployee DiscountsWorldwide Diversity & Inclusion and Business Resource GroupsEmployee Stock Purchase PlanRetirement Plan

Learn more about what working at IBM can mean for you!
http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits

IBM has been recognized over the years for our ability to innovate and promote a culture of principles and values, using technology as a key element.

Recognitions
Fortune — Most Admired Companies
DiversityInc. — Top 10 Companies for Global Diversity
National Association of Female Executives — Top 50 Companies for Female Executives
Working Mother — 100 Best Companies
2016 Climate Leadership Award



Required Technical and Professional Expertise

PhD/Masters in STEM related fields with knowledge in quantum computing.
5+ years of data engineering and data science experience
2+ years of consulting experience within specific industries with strong domain expertise and business acumen
Proficiency with classical approaches for optimization, machine learning and linear algebra, including linear and combinatorial optimization, routing heuristics, classification and clustering technics, numerical simulation, statistics analysis, real time processing
Familiar with Qiskit software, including Qiskit Aqua for domain applications and Qiskit Terra for quantum circuit design and optimization
Excellent ideation, facilitation and communications skills
Detail-oriented team player with strong interpersonal skills and ability to take a leadership role when necessary
English: Fluent

Must be willing to travel both domestically and globally up to 40% (Will be required once we return to a travel-safe normal)



Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Experience with linear programming and/or general mathematical programming
Proficiency in Python with good knowledge of Jupyter, Tensor, Numpy
Deep knowledge and application expertise in ML/DL
Familiarity with Qiskit and quantum concepts and principles, able to model classical ML/DL algorithms within quantum principles
Experience with some aspect of high-performance computing use within an industry context

Req. ID: 202603

Micron Technology’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life and our commitment to people, innovation, tenacity, collaboration, and customer focus allows us to fulfill our mission to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions. This means conducting business with integrity, accountability, and professionalism while supporting our global community.

As the Technology and Products Group (TPG) Sr. Director of Data Science, you will define and drive the vision for digital process and product development at Micron. In this role, you will lead a team in all areas of Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Data Analytics as applied to solving sophisticated problems in semiconductor solutions.
The team will have two focus areas:
Enabling sophisticated modeling and algorithm development across a broad spectrum of problems to accelerate technology solutions and decision making.
Using vast streams of data (mostly unstructured) and developing intelligence around these data streams to help engineers develop semiconductor solutions faster.
We are looking for a senior-level experienced leader, with a consistent record of attracting, hiring and retaining top talent. You must be comfortable working in a multifaceted, iterative environment that also affords the stability of a global, well-established technology company.
You will enable a broad focus across smart technology development initiatives exploring capabilities with artificial intelligence, advanced analytics, cognitive computing, machine learning, etc.
Primary Responsibilities Include:
Set and execute a vision for the smart process ecosystem at Micron using artificial intelligence, cognitive computing, physics-based modeling, and data analytics
Lead a diverse internal Big Data and Analytics team in the Technology Products Group, to drive overall enterprise value
Interact with functional subject matter experts from Si Process, Design, Product Engineering, and Systems teams, to identify and deliver smart development solutions and discover areas of the business that can be automated through machine learning
Drive training curriculum and execution that blends functional expertise with data science skillsets
Partner with manufacturing and process/integration engineering teams to identify capabilities that impact yield, quality and efficiency; identify solutions to optimize.
Apply statistical or machine learning knowledge pertaining to the use cases of specific business problems and data
Interact with vendors to drive design and validation automation
Requirements
PhD or Master’s degree in an Engineering or Science field; additional informative experience in Data Science preferred
At least 5-10 years of related experience in senior management positions with excellent knowledge in modeling and data analytics
Experience in large semiconductor company in process technology, product technology, design, or systems level development
Consistent track record forming successful teams from scratch, managing under tight deadlines and providing mentorship on strategies to attract, retain and reward talent and effectively deploy them to improve every individual’s potential.
Demonstrated ability to collaborate with teams and key partners, both in and outside the organization, to develop highly effective working relationships
Experience with data visualization techniques and concepts
Expert knowledge of statistical programming languages such as ProgR, Python and SQL
Experience crafting a Data Science Roadmap and executing the vision behind it
Familiarity with common data modeling approaches and good understanding of how to deal with various datatypes, larger data sets and parallel computing problems
Experience leading projects that span the fields of data science and data engineering using cluster computing environments such as Spark, Hadoop, other
Preferred Skills:
Results-oriented, with a growth mindset and strong dedication to identify and implement improvement opportunities
Strong analytical skills
Excellent written and verbal English-language communication and presentation skills
Proven track record to perform in an environment characterized by volatility, uncertainty, complexity, and ambiguity (VUCA)
Strong influencing skills and the ability to build strong interpersonal relationships
Ability to assume high exposure responsibilities and interact with senior leadership
Demonstrated capability to build highly effective and engaged teams
Strong project management and organizational change skills and experience
Ability to execute requests with strong attention to detail and strong time-management skills
Passion to teach others about data science and continue to learn new techniques

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that I agree with Takeda’s Privacy Notice, Privacy Policy and Terms of Use.
Job Description
Are you looking for a patient-focused, innovation-driven company that will inspire you and empower you to shine?
At Takeda, we are transforming the pharmaceutical industry through our R&D-driven market leadership and being a values-led company. To do this, we empower our people to realize their potential through life-changing work. Certified as a Global Top Employer, we offer stimulating careers, encourage innovation, and strive for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our global teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.
Here, you will be a vital contributor to our inspiring, bold mission.
For the Takeda global scientific community who aspire to deliver transformative medicines to patients Scientific Informatics is the technology leader, with domain specific expertise, that provides innovative platforms and technologies to improve both operational efficiency and data-driven decision making. As an embedded partner Scientific Informatics is at the leading edge of both science and technology and proactively reacts to the changing scientific environment and needs of researchers in an agile fashion to deliver timely, value-adding solutions.
The Digital Advisory Board programs aim to ensure our growing data is easily accessible to everyone so we can help our patients and HCPs faster and more effectively.
Ethics & Compliance (E&C) focuses on what the organization needs by partnering closely with the business stakeholders to help create, support and enable an embedded ethics and compliance framework. We do this by
Being a forward-thinking leader who anticipates the impact that changing regulations and public debate on topics of ethics will have on the business
Taking a modern approach to the E&C operating model by establishing and maintaining a functional structure and agile framework, supporting the achievement of Takeda’s Vision 2025 and the E&C strategy.
E&C will respond rapidly to changing environment and business needs, it is close to the market, and encourages and help enable ethical behaviour in line with Takeda’s values. By working in an agile manner E&C ensures the balance between stable structures, governance, processes and systems, and dynamic approaches to delivering innovative solutions to appropriately manage risks.
E&C commits to
Act as role model for Takeda's values and foster an ethics and values-based decision making mindset in internal clients, partners and team
Enable the organization to make ethical decisions in line with our priorities of Patient, Trust, Reputation, and Business
Collaborate across all E&C teams and partner with stakeholders in BUs / BFs and LOCs to embed ethics and compliance as part of the inherent way of work at Takeda.
Takeda is looking for an experienced Head of Technology-Ethics with extensive digital transformation experience specific to health innovation support & validation.
This position with be working closely with the R&D department to help design/develop and build out new products/solutions.
Use Technology Ethics Principles to govern technology including factors like risk management and individual rights.
Understand and resolve moral issues that have to do with the development and application of technology of different types.
ACCOUNTABILITIES
Lead and establish simple principle-based frameworks to support enterprise digital innovation (e.g. AI Ethics, Data Ethics, Digital Health Ethics, etc.)
Build, design and manage a day-to-day cross-functional group of experts supporting / reviewing enterprise-wide digital health projects with the intent to foster compliant and ethical patient-focused innovation (e.g. E&C, Medical Device regulatory, Drug regulatory, Safety, Quality, IT security, Privacy, Legal, etc.)
Develop protocols to ensure ethics-by-design of key digital and technological innovations (e.g. Privacy impact assessments, Safety Assessment, Device Determination, Human Right Determination, Algorithmic bias prevention, etc.)
Provide targeted advice from past digital transformation on ethics and compliance of technologies globally and across the enterprise, to support ideation prototyping, piloting & scalability
Identify emerging digital and technological risks, and propose mitigation solutions
Identify areas requiring capability development among the E&C community and the business (regulation and ethics of technologies, technology 101, etc.)
Design and deploy development programs to upskill E&C professional at global, BU/BF and LOC/Site levels
Develop educational content to raise the awareness within the business of the importance of ethical innovation
Collaboration with E&C in leveraging existing best practices as basis for Techno ethics solutions
Collaboration with R&D to ensure solutions are business focused
Act as role model for Takeda's values and foster an ethics and values-based decision making mindset in internal clients, partners and team
Enable the organization to make ethical decisions in line with our priorities of Patient, Trust, Reputation, and Business
DIMENSIONS AND ASPECTS
Technical/Functional (Line) Expertise
Strong background in Technoethics: Digital Health, Artificial Intelligence (ML, NLP, MV), Extended Realities (AR, VR), DLTs (Blockchain), Health Robotics & Med Techs, 3D Printing
Leadership
Build and lead day-to-day cross-functional group of experts supporting / reviewing enterprise-wide digital health projects with the intent to foster compliant and ethical patient-focused innovation (e.g. E&C, Medical, Device regulatory, Drug regulatory, Safety, Quality, IT security, Privacy, Legal, etc.)
Decision-making and Autonomy
This individual will be the SME for Techno-Ethics to provide targeted advice on ethics and compliance of technologies globally and across the enterprise, to support ideation prototyping, piloting & scalability
Interaction
Develop educational content to raise the awareness within the business of the importance of ethical innovation
Innovation
Design and deploy development programs to upskill E&C professional at global, BU/BF and LOC/Site levels
Promote and Develop an Accelerated DAB-enabled enterprise-wide digital heath innovation which requires a sustainable and dedicated support model from an E&C perspective.
Complexity
Identify areas requiring capability development among the E&C community and the business (regulation and ethics of technologies, technology 101, etc.)
EDUCATION, BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES AND SKILLS:
Bachelors degree or relevant work experience (Advanced Degree preferred)
Experience in providing thought leadership
Demonstrated planning, organization and leadership skills
Demonstrative business acumen with strong cross functional communication ability
Excellent demonstrated cross functional Relationship and Stakeholder Skills
Track record of achieving aggressive and growing targets
Ability to think logically to solve complex problems
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Pharma experience

About Turing Video Turing Video, a well funded A.I. startup co-founded by several PhDs from USC and UCLA, is pioneering the robotics industry with leading artificial intelligence and navigation systems for security robots being used worldwide.Located in the heart of Silicon Valley, Turing Video develops state-of-the-art deep learning, edge computing and self-patrolling technology, to enable robots to assess situations and collaborate with human beings and security systems in real-time, keeping facilities and inventory secure.Job Summary The role of the Product Marketing Manager is to be the market hardware expert Turing’s device and device-based SaaS services business, partnering closely with both marketing and product management.This includes understanding how sellers use our existing hardware in-market, tracking market conditions impacting product sales and usage, understanding customer segments and defining messaging, setting up and running product betas for new products, gathering product insights, and helping to feed those insights back to the central hardware team for incorporation into future product development. It is the ProductMarketing Manager’s job to ensure that the right customers are getting the right message through the right channels, and that we are building and supporting the right products for our customers.This role will be based in the Bay Area and will primarily cover the North American market, but will support hardware product marketing in other markets as necessary. This individual will work across our full existing hardware portfolio and future products launched in the US and potentially other markets. This role will also work closely with a cross functional team of product management, hardware and software engineering, marketing, creative, sales/account management, customer success, supply/demand and logistics.We are looking for a highly motivated, top performer to join the team. The right candidate will be data- driven, strategic, analytical, results-oriented and a clear communicator with a background in product management or product marketing and/or strategy, ideally with Job Description – Associate/Director

ALQIMI is seeking an Associate Director to join our team.

The successful candidate is a dynamic, highly-motivated self-starter who will manage client engagements and drive profitable growth of ALQIMI products and services. ALQIMI is considering candidates of various experience levels including Associate (4-8 years of experience) and Director (8+ years of experience). The successful candidate will report to the President of ALQIMI.

ALQIMI is a global information technology solutions company based in Washington, D.C., USA. For more than 20 years, ALQIMI has operated in demanding government agency and commercial environments delivering a wide range of cutting-edge IT solutions enabling these organizations to surpass their missions and goals. ALQIMI's domain expertise includes big data software development, artificial intelligence, healthcare IT and large-scale enterprise computing. ALQIMI offers services and products to clients in the US, Europe and Asia.

ALQIMI has developed a big data platform (RAAVN) consisting of applications, microservices and other back-end technologies. The RAAVN platform is a complete end-to-end, system-of-systems capable of open source data collections, all-source data fusion, analytics, artificial intelligence, visualizations and more. Rather than develop point applications, ALQIMI's RAAVN suite is meant to serve as a platform for the rapid development, tailorization/customization of client applications. Such a platform allows a higher level of “future proofing” given that new technologies, third party tools and existing client applications can all be easily integrated. Successful applications of RAAVN have taken place with IBM, the United States Department of Energy and Defense, Jane's, Bajaj Capital and was used to detect and analyze the now famous Russian Troll farms accused of US presidential election meddling.

OPPORTUNITY DETAILS
ALQIMI is currently seeking a dynamic, self-starter to help us manage and grow our business. The candidate must have a minimum of four years of experience and ALQIMI will consider candidates with more experience.

Responsibilities

Manage existing customer engagements. Acting as the “customer success manager” you will ensure the client's satisfaction through attentive interaction with the client and a watchful eye on the statement of work. In addition, you will generate revenue growth by generating new ideas and selling them through to the client.
Growth revenues through new account acquisition. Independently, and as part of a team, pursue new sales of products and services through direct sales efforts including RFP submissions, cold-contacting, marketing, conferences and networking.
Build marketing and proposal materials. Utilizing existing libraries and working from scratch, create pitchbooks, white papers, RFQ submissions, slicks and any other materials necessary to accomplish the goal.
Accept dynamic tasking. ALQIMI prides itself on being highly responsive to its customers and prospects. The candidate will work on a myriad of tasks and projects which will shift with client and customer needs. The candidate will need to be prepared to do whatever has to be done to make progress.
Meet goals. The candidate will have throughput volume, sales volume, customer success and customer expansion goals which the candidate accepts responsibility for.
Continuously learn. Part of our success is dependent on all team members understanding the latest AI/Analytics/Bid Data methodologies so we can develop own best-in-class solution. The candidate will embrace learning initiatives impacting the organization.
Know how to self-task. Having a clear sense of the goals, the candidate should be able to independently lay out a plan for execution and self manage that plan.
Maintain the right mindset. The candidate will help foster a culture of accountability, professional development, high-performance, and ethical behavior including establishing and maintaining productive peer-to-peer relationships with colleagues, customers and prospects.

Must Have Qualifications/Requirements

Minimum of four years experience in a prospect or customer facing role.
Have intermediate knowledge in at least one of the following subject areas: healthcare, DoD, IC, AI, analytics or computer science.
Hold a passport and be willing to travel locally, domestically and internationally

Bonus Qualifications

Fluency in Russian, Spanish or Mandarin a plus

[1]The title the candidate will be designated with will be determined by the candidate's experience level

The Position

The Digital Health Technologies (DHT) group at Roche/Genentech is part of the R&D Personalized Healthcare (PHC) Center of Excellence building the next generation digital health platform, tools, products, and solutions for the future of medicine. We are building an intelligent, regulatory compliant, highly scalable and secure software platform with regulatory, quality, and privacy requirements. We are building clinically validated, regulatory grade digital health products and solutions which include Software as a Medical Device (SaMDs), algorithms, and Digital Therapeutics. Our digital products are built with our intelligent platform and services to provide real-time advanced analysis of multi-modal data which generate actionable insights for our patients and care providers. Our products and solutions are helping bring improvements to the R&D of disease understanding, higher quality of life, and improved health outcomes.

DHT partners across the company with other Digital Health groups to advance digital health solutions which include hardware, software, applications, tools, and platforms to enable development of our therapies as well as more personalized care of patients across a range of therapeutic areas. Our primary focus is on the validation, scaling, and productization of digital health products, solutions, platform and services; inclusive of late-stage development of novel digital biomarkers and endpoints, as well as the design, conduct, and analysis of analytical validation, clinical validation, and clinical utility studies to meet clinical and regulatory requirements, as appropriate.

THE OPPORTUNITY
We are looking for an experienced technology architect who wants to deliver the next generation intelligent digital health platform that will be the foundation of our products, services, and solutions across therapeutic areas such as Neuroscience, Ophthalmology, and Oncology. You will be a senior member on our Architecture & Design team devoted to real-time processing, analytics, machine learning and artificial intelligence. You will design and develop our intelligent digital health platform built from the ground up on our BigData and AI stack using cutting edge technologies. Our platform allows rapid development of clinically validated, regulatory grade applications and solutions leveraging our advanced optimized platform technology stack, AI Engine, Core SDK and Tools. Your work will drive drug discovery, clinical trial ecosystem, and mobile and biomedical wearable sensor analytics that touch millions of patients.

Our goal is to improve access, safety and efficacy of treatment by building evidence-based, clinically-validated digital health products on our advanced intelligent platform.

We are looking for someone who is technology obsessed - with a passion for improving patient care and outcomes.

WHAT YOU’LL DO
You will design, develop, document, test and and deliver our advanced digital health platform and its components, features, and capabilities that improve the well-being of millions of consumers. You will drive the design and implementation of our BigData and AI stack into deployable solutions in production. You will own the technical design and implementation, but align with product management and compliance requirements. This role is inherently cross-functional. You will work closely with the DHT Platform Product Managers, Measurement Scientists, and Compliance & Strategy Leads to develop our platform across our product portfolios.

To be successful, you will leverage cross-functional partnerships with other groups across Roche to define and execute the strategic platform direction of Digital Health, transforming drug development and patient care.

A successful candidate will be passionate about developing technology and data-driven solutions to help improve the lives and health of patients. You are highly technical, analytical, able to work effectively in a matrix organization, and adept at synthesizing a variety of information including research, competitive analysis, user behavior, and new technologies / capabilities, transforming them into features and experiences that consumers love.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Design, document, develop, and test the Big Data and AI stack from design to production, impact all aspects of our system
Perf tune and scale our system
Evaluate latest technologies and make appropriate dependency choices
Mentor junior engineers
Further the culture of product innovation and excellence, characterized as highly collaborative, execution-focused, customer centric and high velocity
Collaborate closely with DHT cross-functional stakeholders including Product Management, Measurement Science, and Compliance & Strategy
Be an evangelist for our work in DHT not only within the broader Roche/Genentech organization, but externally through publication and public speaking at industry events.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Passionate about using technology and data-driven approaches to help improve the lives and health of our patients!
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems or related field; Master’s in Mathematics, Computer Science, or related preferred
8+ years relevant experience in a software development role including experience with large scale systems.
Advanced programming in Java and python.
Experience with BigData technology stack; Spark, Cassandra and Kafka including performance tuning and troubleshooting production issues.
Experience in bringing one or more AI based products deployed in production or at scale which uses machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, or natural language processing
Experience in oAuth2 and SSL.
Experience working with Asynchronous networking frameworks – Netty.
Experience tuning Network sockets layers in the cloud.
Experience with Complex event processing – CEP
Experience with reactive programming – Vert.x.
Experience with ML techniques and ML runtime environment.
Experience working with Private Virtual Cloud Infrastructure.
Drive to live the dream (required).
Able to write clear and concise documentation, excellent written and spoken communication with superb presentation skills
Able to drive and continuously reinforce the PHC DHT culture, operating principles, and product development practices
Ability to travel internationally 25%

PREFFERED QUALIFICATIONS
10+ years relevant experience in a software development role
Experience with Druid, Neo4J, TensorFlow, PySpark, Vert.x, Mesos DC/OS, Marathon and K8
Experience in Kubernetes KubeFlow
Experience with network mesh for service-discovery, load balancing, ALB; Apps Load Balancing, blue-green deployment
Experience working with Quality Management Systems
Experience with medical devices and/or Software as a Medical Device
Familiarity with Wearable and IoT Devices
Experience with developing Virtual Reality/Augmented Reality hardware/software solutions

WHO WE ARE

A member of the Roche Group, Genentech has been at the forefront of the biotechnology industry for more than 40 years, using human genetic information to develop novel medicines for serious and life-threatening diseases. Genentech has multiple therapies on the market for cancer & other serious illnesses. Please take this opportunity to learn about Genentech where we believe that our employees are our most important asset & are dedicated to remaining a great place to work.

Genentech is an equal opportunity employer & prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, disability, marital & veteran status. For more information about equal employment opportunity, visit our Genentech Careers page.

**Remote-based Role; must reside in NC**
Technical Cloud Project Manager
ClearScale is a leading cloud systems integration company and AWS Premier Consulting Partner. We provide a wide range of cloud services including Migrations, Application Modernization, DevOps, Data & Analytics, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence, IoT, Managed Cloud and Cloud Strategy. Our team has been working remote for the past 10 years supporting our clients. Since 2011, our expert team has helped Fortune 500 enterprises, mid-market businesses, SMBs, and startups in all major vertical markets succeed with ambitious, challenging, and unique cloud projects. We architect, develop, and launch innovative and sophisticated solutions using the latest cutting-edge cloud technologies.
ClearScale is growing quickly due to high demand for the services we provide. Public cloud is one of the fastest growing markets in the technology industry, with Gartner forecasting a $226 billion market - nearly 20% YoY revenue growth for public cloud services in 2020. With AWS as the recognized leader in public cloud, our status as one of the select few AWS Premier Consulting Partners positions us for sustained success.
This is a unique opportunity to make a big impact, enjoy competitive compensation, manage a wide variety of projects for clients across multiple industries, and work alongside some of the best minds in the cloud services industry.
Job Summary:
The Technical Cloud Project Manager works directly with external clients managing multiple projects simultaneously. The PM's responsibilities start from the moment a project is signed and proceed until the engagement is successfully completed. The position leads clients to a successful outcome through process, resource management and financial tracking.
Manages client engagements from kickoff to delivery
Monitors project dates, tasks, hours spent, risks, blockers and customer satisfaction throughout the project life cycle
Identifies scope changes from the original plan or agreement and escalates to the management team
Works directly with Tech Leads and Directors to ensure project success
Facilitates meetings and other communication, including status reporting and meeting notes
Manages customer expectations and meets clients face to face as needed
Seeks process improvements
Reviews project hours reports for accuracy
Does not manage personnel
Does not perform any "hands-on" technical work
Desired Skills & Experience:
5+ years of Technical Project Management / Engagement Management
Understanding of infrastructure and cloud technologies is a must; AWS knowledge preferred- Consulting organization experience is highly preferred
Proficient in Project Scheduling and Project Lifecycle best practices
Organized and motivated team player, with the ability to manage multiple projects while paying close attention to detail
Highly responsible, self-motivated, and able to work with minimal supervision
Results oriented person with the ability to adapt to a constantly changing environment
Strong communicator (both verbal and written) skills are a must
Familiar with Jira, Confluence and other project management tools
Familiar with Scrum/Agile

ClearScale is growing quickly due to high demand for the services we provide. Public cloud is one of the fastest growing markets in the technology industry, with Gartner forecasting a $226 billion market - nearly 20% YoY revenue growth for public cloud services in 2020. With AWS as the recognized leader in public cloud, our status as one of the select few AWS Premier Consulting Partners positions us for sustained success.
This is a unique opportunity to make a big impact, enjoy competitive compensation, manage a wide variety of projects for clients across multiple industries, and work alongside some of the best minds in the cloud services industry.
Job Summary:
The Technical Cloud Project Manager works directly with external clients managing multiple projects simultaneously. The PM's responsibilities start from the moment a project is signed and proceed until the engagement is successfully completed. The position leads clients to a successful outcome through process, resource management and financial tracking.
Manages client engagements from kickoff to delivery
Monitors project dates, tasks, hours spent, risks, blockers and customer satisfaction throughout the project life cycle
Identifies scope changes from the original plan or agreement and escalates to the management team
Works directly with Tech Leads and Directors to ensure project success
Facilitates meetings and other communication, including status reporting and meeting notes
Manages customer expectations and meets clients face to face as needed
Seeks process improvements
Reviews project hours reports for accuracy
Does not manage personnel
Does not perform any "hands-on" technical work
Desired Skills & Experience:
5+ years of Technical Project Management / Engagement Management
Understanding of infrastructure and cloud technologies is a must; AWS knowledge preferred- Consulting organization experience is highly preferred
Proficient in Project Scheduling and Project Lifecycle best practices
Organized and motivated team player, with the ability to manage multiple projects while paying close attention to detail
Highly responsible, self-motivated, and able to work with minimal supervision
Results oriented person with the ability to adapt to a constantly changing environment
Strong communicator (both verbal and written) skills are a must
Familiar with Jira, Confluence and other project management tools
Familiar with Scrum/Agile

Artificial Intelligence Senior Program/Portfolio Manager-200011316

At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. The fifth-largest bank in the United States, we’re one of the country's most respected, innovative and successful financial institutions. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

U.S. Bank is looking for an Artificial Intelligence Senior Program/Portfolio Manager to join the fast-paced Innovation team, supporting some of the largest initiatives in our company. The Artificial Intelligence Senior Program/Portfolio Manager is a hands-on role that will provide oversight and management of all aspects of delivering Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) solutions to production. The Artificial Intelligence Senior Program/Portfolio Manager will be responsible for managing the full scope of activities within one of Innovation’s AI/ML solution portfolios, to include partner exploration and outreach, user/customer experience design, marketing and branding considerations, solution development and implementation, and demonstration of business value in production environments.


This role will work within the fast-paced Innovation team, which strives for excellence in all phases of execution and lifecycle management. The ideal candidate will have the right attitude and an imaginative mind set, is creative, and has extensive experience with AI/ML solution delivery within industry. The individual will be comfortable working in an innovation-focused environment – in particular, evaluating emerging trends and technologies to assess their feasibility and viability and functioning effectively in a fail-fast environment. The position relies on the individual to be a self-starter and a quick learner, to have a futurist mindset, and to be able to innovate and report on tasks and status proactively.

Job Responsibilities:


Oversees AI/ML solution exploration and delivery through the entire development lifecycle, e.g. rapid prototype, design, build, assemble, test, and pilot.Acts as an advocate for their AI/ML portfolio and conducts outreach to identify partners and define scope for continuing collaborative efforts.Collaborates with other organizations within the company to identify and flesh out new growth opportunities using AI/ML technologies.
Documents and articulates solution architecture and lessons learned for each exploration and accelerated incubation based on feedback from supported components.
Responsible for partnering with the Lines of Business and other stakeholders to determine the impact and facilitate changes related to new and updated Federal law, state law, and agency/investor regulations.
Encourages new transformative thinking and trail blazing and facilitates imagination and ideation sessions.
Maintains current knowledge of technology landscape and emerging developments.
Works with various Product and Enterprise teams to optimize customer and user experiences.
Employs practical approach to data access and management and eventual platform integration of AI/ML solutions.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in a STEM field (e.g., Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Statistics, or related quantitative/technical field) and at least 5 years of combined experience in program management and/or AI/ML technology development, OR a High School Diploma/GED and at least 10 years of experience.
Significant experience in project/program management and customer relationship management in the AI/ML technology space in an industry setting (banking/financial industry preferred).
Experience working with R&D/innovation-style activities.
Experience with programming and software design fundamentals, e.g. object oriented and functional design principles, best practices, etc.
Knowledge and familiarity with a broad range of AI/ML algorithms, e.g. NLP/Conversational AI, predictive modeling, deep learning, computer vision, etc.
Experience with both relational and non-relational databases and data access methods, e.g. Postgres, MongoDB, SQL, NoSQL, RESTful API’s, GraphQL, etc.Experience with Python programming environment or equivalent (e.g. ProgR, Scala) and related open-source technologies such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, BERT, SpaCy, NLTK, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, Deeplearning4j, etc.Knowledge and familiarity with AI/ML solution development within cloud-based environments (e.g. Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure), with emphasis on GPU-enabled computing.
Experience delivering communications in a clear, concise, and compelling manner.Willing to travel up to 25% of the time for business purposes.

Other Locations District of Columbia-DC-Washington, Georgia-GA-Atlanta, New York-NY-New York, CA-CA-San Francisco

Director, Oracle Partner Network-20000H4E


No Visa Sponsorship is available for this position.

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English

Preferred Qualifications

The race is on! Emerging technologies like artificial intelligence, autonomous, mobility, and IoT have changed the way business structured with all things digital and their expectation of immediacy and value.


To meet the customers’ needs today and exceed their expectations for tomorrow, Oracle is laser-focused to empower and accelerate companies around the world to respond to customer’s cloud transformation with solutions “Powered By” or “Integrated With” Oracle Cloud Platform, or with services to plan, implement, and manage their “last upgrade” transformation or modernization efforts.


The Oracle PartnerNetwork (OPN), a programmatic effort to enable our partner ecosystem, provides the tools, education, and assistance critical in accelerating the delivery of Cloud solutions or services to assist our mutual customers.

Oracle is looking for a Director, OPN Program Lead to join our dynamic team. We are seeking a passionate, results-oriented, proven individual with experience in the innovation and management of global partner programs. This is a highly visible role across the organization and is an opportunity to make a lasting impact on the growth and success of our customers, our partner ecosystem, and Oracle.

The successful candidate must have proven experience and success in working collaboratively across executive management, field sales organization, product development, marketing, etc. They will be passionate about their work, self-motivated, detail oriented and have excellent problem-solving abilities. Additionally, they will have superb communication and project management skills, communicate progress and results both written and verbally, in a clear and easy-to-understand way.

The ideal candidate will possess an extensive background working with technology partnerships and partner programs, particularly as related to Managed Service Providers (MSPs) and Strategic Implementers (SIs), along with strong business development, strategic alliances, and entrepreneurial skills. He/she should have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about new business models, solution selling, and technical challenges to help build and convey compelling value propositions for Oracle customers with our partners. The candidate should also have a proven track record of influencing innovation through a partner ecosystem with a prior solution and program successes.
Key Responsibilities:
 Own programmatic elements of Partner Tracks of the Oracle PartnerNetwork working horizontally and vertically with various LOBs/development organizations
 Build and analyze valuable benefit packages for members of OPN
 Drive awareness of new or updated program information for internal partner facing teams and OPN Partner ecosystem through established vehicles
 Engage OPN program members directly to gain insight on the user experience of the program
 Evaluate effectiveness and propose adjustments to programs to improve performance and ensure objectives are met
 Promote online Oracle partner communities to drive recruitment and market adoption
 Analyze adoption rates and recommend enhancements on a continual basis
 Maintain a positive, proactive attitude, always exercise great judgment and demonstrate the ability to initiate new programs and obtain senior management buy-in and support.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
 Bachelors Degree Required. MBA or another advanced college degree preferred
 7-10+ years in program development for a global technology company, e.g., AWS, Microsoft, Cisco, Salesforce, Oracle. Experience working on MSP and/or SI program development strongly preferred
 In-depth knowledge of the cloud computing industry
 Experience and success in managing large and complex global partner ecosystems with a proven understanding of the various business models
 Strong presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences
 Clear track record of delivering programs that accelerate sales revenue and customer success.
 Proven ability to partner with a wide variety of senior-level individuals including top-level business leaders and customers.
 Strong business acumen, and experience with large, complex organizations during periods of rapid growth and change.
 Resilient and able to thrive in a fast-paced, results-driven environment with a high level of energy.
 Advanced Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel skills (Pivot Tables, Macros).
 Willing to travel domestically and internationally to meet with customers, partners, as needed.

Detailed Description and Job Requirements

Engages in business development strategies and programs in support of Oracle's Sales Organization.

Oversees the development of strategic market/product line business plans and marketing programs to support sales in designated market segments. Engages in many areas of business development to include strategy, programs, demand generation, building pipeline, increasing deal size, and account planning. Analyzes market data to identify trends/opportunities and develops strategic direction from market information. Identifies volume and strategic customers. Primary interaction is with Oracle sales force; however, may interact with external customers as it relates to the development and facilitation of ongoing business and/or business relationship. Supports the business by interfacing with the sales organization and other internal groups (such as Product Development, Operations, GBUs, Marketing, etc.)

Acknowledged authority within the Corporation. Acts as a leader of large-scale company initiatives. Viewed by peers as a leader and top contributor and by line management as a key business partner. 12+ years of Marketing/Business Development experience in the technology industry, preferably software industry. Experience should include relationship management. Conversant in Oracle technology and product strategies. Ability to determine strategy and tactical plans that deliver tangible results. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills. BA/BS degree or equivalent, advanced degree highly desirable.

Oracle is an Affirmative Action-Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Title
Technology Communications Manager
Job Description
Position Overview
At Autodesk, we exist to turn ideas into new realities in order to shape a thriving future. Our software and services harness emerging technologies – such as additive manufacturing (3D printing), artificial intelligence, generative design, and robotics – to provide companies and individuals with the power to work more quickly, effectively, and sustainably throughout the entire project lifecycle.
Our customers make and build amazing things – from interplanetary landers and electric concept vehicles , to the tallest modular hotel on the planet and designer furniture co-created with AI . If these kinds of innovations excite you as a storyteller, this role might be a great fit. We’re looking for a well-organized, proactive communications professional with a nose for a good story, strong media relations skills and accompanying media contacts to join our team. As a member of the Autodesk Communications team, you’ll collaborate with our global brand marketers and other company stakeholders to plan and execute U.S. comms activities (earned, owned, social) while contributing to Autodesk’s success around the world. Sound intriguing? Drop us a line!
Responsibilities
Work with the Autodesk Communications team to plan, execute and measure brand-level communications activities
Collaborate with stakeholders from our manufacturing industry strategy teams to identify and develop news announcements and customer stories for earned and owned media
Assist with development of other assets including social media content, presentations, videos, etc.
Identify and conduct outreach to media and other influencers; prepare for and staff media interviews with experts and executive spokespeople
Assist with execution of media & analyst programs for industry tradeshows and Autodesk-owned events like our annual user conference, Autodesk University
Track and analyze data for earned media performance; draw insights that can inform and adjust our media strategies
Manage and prioritize multiple projects at the same time
Stay abreast of technology trends, policy developments, media movements, and competitor activity to find opportunities to advance our narrative
Be proactive about seeking out and/or suggesting ideas for better ways to tell our stories
Facilitate global distribution and use of communications assets through our Geo Brand Marketing team in ~15 countries
Have fun and engage in witty banter about pop culture with your teammates
Minimum Qualifications
8+ years of relevant work experience at a PR/marketing agency or in a relevant in-house role in communications, journalism, marketing or a related field
Proven ability to build and manage relationships with company stakeholders, executives, journalists and external partners
Strong organizational and project management skills
Flexibility and ability to multitask
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Some travel required (<10%)
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with analyst relations
Experience scaling communications efforts globally
Experience with media tracking and/or data analytics tools (e.g. Cision, Trendkite, etc.)
At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

What you’ll be doing...
Verizon is serious about innovation. About being the first and being the best. We are building a future using technologies like 5G, Multi-Access Edge Computing and Artificial Intelligence that are allowing us to create products that were previously impossible. We’re building tomorrow with the best of today.
We have a unique ability to develop next generation platforms, influence technology standards, forge durable business partnerships, and define the playing field for the next wave of technology innovation with applications such as IoT, connected cars, aerial drone solutions, augmented intelligence and more. Within these evolving ecosystems, Verizon is uniquely positioned to capture new growth and value opportunities.
The newly formed Strategy Consulting team with Verizon’s Corporate Strategy organization holds a key role in helping shape this new path. We challenge ourselves to solve top-of mind strategic questions, collaborating with leadership and experts across the organization. We can do so by leveraging the multi-faceted background of our team consisting of former management consultants, financial services professionals, data scientists and technology experts. We are responsible for challenging the status quo, looking beyond the horizon, and making the future real, role-modeling the new Verizon 2.0 way of working that builds on customer centricity, collaboration and innovation to drive positive change.
Want to have a meaningful impact? This is where it happens!
Develop new capabilities and enhance critical business processes with advanced analytics and visualization capabilities to drive new growth opportunities and value creation.
Collaborate with data engineers and developers across our global technology services teams to build analytics solutions focused on value drivers and stakeholder experience.
Assess technology commercialization initiatives and accelerate execution, working alongside technology leaders to ensure effective evaluation, design, implementation and change management.
Leverage critical thinking & sharp problem solving skills to guide the design & development of data science tools and advanced analytics solutions.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders & business leaders on cross-functional growth initiatives; designing blueprints for new products, ways of working and other disciplines.
Evaluate digital use cases and new product ideas providing strategic and technology-focused leadership to proof-of-concept and/or pilot engagements with technology and business partners.
Craft and deliver actionable recommendations to senior leadership through data-driven analysis and visualization for executive decision making.
Coach junior members of our team to enhance their personal effectiveness & ability to make a positive impact.
What we’re looking for...
You are outcomes-driven, smart, hard-working, and a great team player. You thrive on new challenges, and are excited by the prospect of mastering new things. You can be creative and visionary, but are able to roll up your sleeves to structure a project plan, develop an analytics tool, or craft a presentation. You are comfortable leading and following. You are confident enough to voice well-informed, dissenting opinions, yet always treat others and their views with respect.
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Six or more years of relevant work experience.
Even better if you have:
Advanced degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering or Business Analytics.
Two or more years of experience in a strategy or quantitative/technical role (e.g., data science, applied analytics, mathematics, engineering, etc.) for a tier 1 management consulting firm or a leading technology firm.
Technical expertise across a wide range of technologies including DevOps, Cloud, and Machine Learning.
Strong understanding of advanced statistical methods (e.g., sampling; regression methods; classification algorithms; distributions, etc.) and experience in data analytics platforms and visualization software tools.
Analytical and creative problem-solving skills in combination with a deep knowledge of SQL and scripting/statistical programming languages (Python, ProgR, etc.).
Experience with innovation methods (e.g., human centered design, design thinking, systems thinking).
Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment, meet deadlines, and simultaneously work on multiple projects.
Experience in a leadership role responsible for the design, development, and implementation of a strategic plan for an organization, company or business unit.
Ability to translate complex ideas and express them in concise, simple to understand ways.
Experience working across all levels of an organization, leveraging organizational, interpersonal, presentation, and time-management skills.
Proven ability to manage complex programs and drive cross-functional teams to meet business objectives and influence co-workers while fostering strong working relationships.
Experience handling confidential information appropriately.
When you join Verizon...
You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.
Equal Employment Opportunity
We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

About Natus:
Natus Medical is a leading manufacturer of medical devices for the Newborn Care, Neurology, Sleep, Hearing and Balance markets since 1989. Natus products are used in hospitals, clinics and laboratories worldwide. Our mission is to improve outcomes and patient care in target markets through innovative screening, diagnostic and treatment solutions.


Job Summary:


Looking for a once in a lifetime opportunity to lead a revolution? The Chief Software Architect will help lead our technology vision and strategy across a globally distributed development team spanning a large product portfolio consisting of cloud and medical device software applications. Working closely with fellow software and system architects, developers, research, marketing and the leadership team, you will apply your expertise in software architecture and technology to help create architecture platforms and solutions for our current and future product portfolio. Leveraging your expertise, you will provide recommendations on processes and tools to help improve our architectural quality and efficiency while facilitating a Natus Software Ecosystem that supports reuse across the entire Natus Software Organization. You will lead fellow architects to ensure architectural design and implementation conforms to established architecture guidelines while promoting reuse and insuring highest level of quality. The ideal candidate is an expert at software architecture, design and implementation of cutting-edge cloud solutions as well as being able to lead fellow architects and developers on how best to re-architect existing medical application platforms to scale into the future.


In this job, you will:

Lead software architecture across the Natus product portfolio:

Lead fellow architects analyzing existing Natus products to determine optimal cloud software architecture in support of product roadmap
Establish best-in-class software architecture procedures, tools and templates to facilitate Natus Software Ecosystem
Insure governance of software architecture and design across major Natus Products
Must be capable of developing proof-of-concept prototypes in support of future product concepts
In partnership with leadership, marketing and research, maintain technology roadmap and drive architectural runway in support of future business strategy and market need
Proactively provide recommendations on improvements to product and/or processes to increase efficiency and improve quality


Travel Required: Minimal (30%)


Qualifications:

Fifth year college or university program certificate and 10 years software architecture experience. Masters degree in computer science or similar preferred.
One of more of the following Certifications strongly desired:
Certified SEI Software Architecture Professional, Certified Software Architect (Carnegie Mellon)
Microsoft Azure Certifications, or equivalent in AWS or GCP
Desired: Microsoft Certified Azure Solutions Architect Expert certification
Certified SOA Architect or similar
10+ years experience as a software developer, lead and architect
5+ years experience architecting and design highly complex systems
Expert knowledge of technical architecture best practices
Experience developing architectures in multiple diverse domains and technology stacks
Fluent in one or more software architecture modeling tools (EA, Rational, etc)
Excellent organizational skills
Excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Fluent with both agile and waterfall SDLCs
Expertise in Azure solutions architecture
Practical experience with containers (e.g. Docker) and container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes)
High proficiency with C#, MFC, ASP.NET, .NET, .NET Core, WPF, .NET configuration
Experience and understanding of SQL Server, and use of Azure SQL Database a plus
Experience and understanding of ASP.NET MVC and MVC Web API
Experience and understanding of Azure App Services
Proficiency with Web Services; SOAP, REST, Web API
High proficiency with design patterns especially MVC
Experience on an Agile Software Development Cycle team (Scrum master, tech lead, project manager, requirements manager, functional manager, task manager)
Experience with a cloud-based operations infrastructure (Microsoft Azure) and its services (Run Books, Virtual Machines, instrumentation, firewalls)
Experience with network technologies (VPNs)
Experience and understanding of web and mobile app security best practices (oWASP)
Experience with managing third party service vendor relationships
Experience using collaborative communication tools and collaborative development tools
Experience or familiarity with AWS and GCP solutions architecture

Desired Qualifications:

Familiarity with Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
Understanding of HL7 is a plus
Experience with Agile PLM
Working knowledge of IEC 62304, ISO 13485 and ISO 14971
High proficiency with mobile development; Objective-C, Swift, SwiftUI, Java
Experience with mobile application POS (Google Play Store, Apple App Store)


Benefits:

Natus offers competitive salaries, comprehensive benefit package that starts on your 1st day, 401k match, employee stock purchase plan, 9 paid holidays, generous paid time off plan (4 weeks to start) and tuition reimbursement up to $5,000 annually.

General Atomics Aeronautical Systems, Inc. (GA-ASI), an affiliate of General Atomics, is a world leader in proven, reliable remotely piloted aircraft and tactical reconnaissance radars, as well as advanced high-resolution surveillance systems.

As the Senior Director of Mission Architecture, this individual will be responsible for developing a vision shaping the future mission pursuits for GA-ASI’s unmanned portfolio. Reporting to the Vice President of Mission Payloads & Exploitation (MPEx) at GA-ASI, this individual will develop a product roadmap, allied to a capture strategy, that takes GA-ASI’s unmanned aircraft beyond the COIN/CT missions. The successful candidate will have extensive DoD experience or have experience working in the Defense business, and be familiar with the latest advancements in technology like Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Define forward looking capabilities, abstract sensor suites, and strategic vision to drive mission expansion across all platforms
Create capture plans and roadmaps for capability development, fielding, and transition to sales
Develop concepts for to effectively utilize Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning capabilities to enhance MQ-9 autonomy, and reduce manpower
Shape MQ-9 modernization efforts for operation in permissive and contested environments
Develop concept for MQ-9 as a communications gateway integral to Joint All Domain Command and Control (JADC2) and the Air Force Advanced Battle Management System
Create a strategy for MQ-9 that goes beyond its core COIN/CT mission
Shape GA-ASI OMS and UCS/UCI implementation strategy
Direct CONOPS group development activities in support of domestic and international pursuits across GA-ASI
Work through Strategic Development team to shape customer community with GA-ASI solutions for contested environments
Provide architectural guidance, technological recommendations and transition strategies that support the development, implementation and adoption of emerging technology initiatives
Drive communication, cross-pollination, and cross-skilling across development programs
Follow Aerospace and Defense industry market trends, and help identify technology market disruptors to leverage in developing strategic roadmaps
Provide vision and leadership of innovative technology development and integration programs within/across the unmanned family of systems
In coordination with MPEx leadership team, provide input for long-range strategic planning and internal research and development efforts
Collaborate with engineering on design concepts, criteria, and engineering efforts for payload research, development, testing, and integration as part of strategic planning and investment
Aid identification of program/platform issues and provide leadership in developing solutions such as re-allocation of resources or modifying specification(s)
Collaborate with technical staff and/or Division/Group executive management to develop and implement current, annual, and long-term technical and schedule objectives
Performs other duties as assigned
We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.

General Atomics Aeronautical Systems, Inc. (GA-ASI), an affiliate of General Atomics, is a world leader in proven, reliable remotely piloted aircraft and tactical reconnaissance radars, as well as advanced high-resolution surveillance systems.

Reporting to the Senior Director of Mission Architecture at Mission Payloads and Exploitation (MPEx) at GA-ASI, this position conceptualizes and articulates innovative mission architectures in shaping GA-ASI unmanned aircraft beyond the current COIN/CT missions. Functioning in a leadership role is instrumental in the planning and oversight of the successful implementation of those resolutions. This role represents the company nationally and internationally through technical presentations and papers as an expert, consultant, and champion of specialized knowledge for enabling new mission capabilities. Participates in or directs the allocation of technical resources and professional staff to achieve objectives
Prepares status/progress reports and ensures compliance, reporting, and safety standards are maintained

Functions as an influential presence in attracting and retaining new business as well as key professional staff

Responsible for observing all laws, regulations and other applicable obligations wherever and whenever business is conducted on behalf of the Company
Expected to work in a safe manner in accordance with established operating procedures and practices
We recognize and appreciate the value and contributions of individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences and welcome all qualified individuals to apply.
